gaSv1LI684RVQOErt3Xuhg.text: I had received gift cards from my company as a gift on valentine's day ,unfortunately  my company keeps me so busy we just never had time to go ,so we had some free time and decided to check out the restaurant,  it was our first time there , service was great, we had the chefs choice filet mignon and lobster the wife had crab when food arrived the steak was awesome ,one of the best steaks I ever had , the lobster for me was super small and my wife felt the same about the crab ,but it was good I just felt portion size was small

89mRJ-mOZ-09rUYmjMwcDw.text: Awesome! Amazing service and so professional.  Food is amazing. We try to come here once a month at a minimum!  Try the Flemings potatoes!!!

wdy0XCouQm_ntIs_4PAjSA.text: Love to come here for happy hour. The happy hour burger is delicious and an absolute steal. They have a ton of wines by the glass and have drink specials too. The iPad wine menu is kind of cool but I found it a little hard to find things... Might be because there is so much to look at.

ylHeaaDkBRkwAhn0hgUfQw.text: GREAT food!  We had a Valentine's reservation for 9:45, since that was all that was available.  I called around 8pm to see if we could get a seat earlier.  I was told, " we are booked for the night."  We showed up at 9pm and were seated immediately.  There were MANY empty seats.  I am not sure what the deal was with seating us earlier.  The food was INSANE good.  We each got a filet. We got a backed potato and Fleming's potatoes.  I am not sure why we got them, since we were so stuffed and had to get them to go.  We got the chocolate lava cake for dessert.  It was good, not great.  It tasted burned.  We got the calamari for an appetizer. They were slightly soggy.  The wine was great.  The service was great.  Overall, VERY GOOD.  I will definitely go back!

PIVR7tWn2S4vSrJOAK8Bnw.text: I always enjoy the Flemings near me, so it is always great to discover a new location.  Located in a shopping center, there is certainly plenty of parking.  We had reservations and were seated immediately.   I had the Flemings martini, and a glass of red wine, along with a daily special featuring steak and tempura shrimp, along with a wedge salad and my date had a scallops dish, along with red wine.   The wedge salad is amongst the best you'll ever find.  They will even chop it up for you if you request.  Savory and delicious.  The steak and tempura shrimp had better flavor on the steak side of things, although friend anything is not my favorite lately.  The shrimp did come with a delicious dipping sauce.   The wine list is amazing and something Flemings is famous for.  We even requested a dessert, which normally takes some time to prepare, and I was concerned, as we were there right at closing time.  But they were gracious and prepared everything to our liking.    The dining room is always elegant, although there was a very loud mouth gentleman talking at top volume about drugs and medical marijuana dispensaries that did not want to seem to quiet down.  At all.  The dining room was empty when we left, as we were the last ones there.  It is strange that this town closes so early on a Thursday, but truly it was a ghost town after 10pm.  Even the waitress was walking to her car as we left.     Overall a wonderful elegant dining experience, and I'd recommend any Flemings locations.

_DrtfoVcmay6kPqZ3tTYGg.text: Probably the best out of the large steak chains. Better than Ruth's Chris or Mortons hands down. The filet is amazing. They could have better sides, but let's face it, we go for the steak. We go at least two to three times a year. The customer service (wait staff and managers) are 5 STAR service. They keep us coming back. Personally my favorite steak house for high end.

FTJm-9sMS2gqSETjIg5rVQ.text: Had an extremely delightful experience here while visiting Arizona in October. The service was great - waiter was not pushy, but there whenever needed. The food (especially my steak) was excellent, as was the wine. Can't wait to bring my husband here when we visit again.

zbhEwzQf-N8gNwMwsrkvdA.text: Not as nice as the Flemings I went to  regularly in Palo Alto.  It starts with sitting in the back room, which feels like a mid-level hotel restaurant.  It continues with the wedge salad, which is still above average, but not nearly as good as I'm used to (i.e., the bacon should be chopped and the blue cheese dressing should have more chunks of blue cheese).    The Flemings Potatoes were excellent.  My rib eye was underwhelming.  It didn't have the usual crust I've come to expect.  Service was good.

gkGQx8yOiEKhBl8fZlDW5g.text: My husband and I came here for our anniversary. We both got filets and they were incredible, perfect temperature and VERY flavorful. The service was phenomenal as well. A True 5-star restaurant.

JudZ1La__nBxzneVE7nfjA.text: This restaurant has a lot going for it. We celebrated our anniversary here before seeing Phantom of the Opera, and they definitely kept the night classy. They fell short of five stars, but in ways that made 4 stars an easy decision.  It started with a reservation. Perhaps we just aren't regulars, but people would come in after us and be seated before us for the exact same reservation, exact same time. This is the moment I knew we'd have time issues.   However, we were wished happy anniversary by everyone as we sat, and they signed a card and gave a small box of chocolates. The service tried to be great, and nearly succeeded. The place was loud, but in a festive kind of way. Not quite romantic, but fun nonetheless.  The servers took great care of us, making solid recommendations and being generally humorous and engaging. Unfortunately, they also brought out the calamari appetizer AFTER the steak, and only after being reminded. Yet I can't completely throw them under the bus, because they took the calamari off the check.  And that calamari. Amazing. And that New York Strip. Perfection. And that chicken. Total win. Even the gnocchi was great. The salad sucked, but it was a basic Caesar. Just wish they'd used something other than hearts in there. But the rest was amazing.   Again, overall amazing food, and a solid recovery that kept this a four star experience even with the blunders. I still left wanting to come back. And come back we will.

hM2UK6ZKUxhNAgebPyOL9g.text: I really can't find any reason to not give Fleming's 5 stars.  Is it absolutely the best meal I have ever had, no, but pretty darn good.  We have been going to Fleming's for years and will continue to do so.  Yes, it is expensive for a typical night out so it's not a go-to that often for us but we still really enjoy the little splurge every now and again.  Fleming's is a great date night or special occasion place with friends.  I typically get the petite filet with the 3oz add-on shelled lobster tail.  The filet is always cooked to perfection and extremely tasty.  The lobster looks small when it is served but is always the right amount for me.  We almost always get a few sides and last night was no different.  We had our standard creamed spinach (my fav), Fleming's potatoes and creamed corn (I wasn't a huge fan of the creamed corn as it was a little spicy and that's not my thing).  The service is always excellent.  Almost forgot to mention that I love the Farmer's Daughter Martini...Delicious!  But beware, they go down quickly!  It's always a nice night out at Fleming's.  Just writing this review is making me hungry!!

0Sp5GqPdrZPKR5grPREhIQ.text: We had an amazing anniversary dinner. The wait between appetizer and main course was a little long but we had amazing service. The seafood appetizer was delicious, we had the rib eye special of the evening with crab legs on the side and it was amazing. They gave us a gift for our anniversary to come back next time. It was our first time there and a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. What a thoughtful gift from the restaurant!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Amazing seafood appetizer!

yUxK-7CwuRnH1ZHdL5m05w.text: Superb service! The food wasn't too bad either...  We ordered the spicy chili calamari. A little sweet, a little spicy...but just perfect!  Followed that up with the Main steak and a side of Fleming's potatoes (extra cheesy with jalapenos) and the specialty Parmesan crusted halibut topped with lump crab in a lemon/butter/cream sauce over sauteed spinach....DELISH!  Because it was my fiance's bday we ordered the lava cake. Takes 20 min to make but soooo worth the wait! Request to have Alan as your server - he's on point!

knYk1UeCgV2BUM0S9d91pA.text: We went to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed. Our waiter was great. We shared the spinach salad and chipotle mac & cheese. Both were very good. My husband LOVED his ribeye. I had the filet topped with a crab cake and bearnaise sauce. It was perfection. So good. Neither of us were able to finish our meals because we wanted to leave space for desert. We shared the crime brulee. It was amazing. We topped it with the Chantilly cream, which you can just eat alone with a spoon. It was the perfect cap to the night. Because of the occasion, they also sent us home with truffles and a $25 gift card for our next visit. Great evening.

jHpaG2C9lZBrwsKqM1QpJg.text: Not what you would expect for a $150+ meal for two. For an "upscale" steakhouse the food and service were nothing great. First, we never got the bread our server said would be right out when we arrived. We proceeded to ask for it two additional times before it was finally brought to us when we received our entree. The halibut was ok, but over cooked and the sauce on top was over bearing. The calamari was decent, but I have definitely had better. I also wish they put whatever sauce they had on it on the side so they breaded part stayed crispy. The only saving grace of the meal were the Fleming's potatoes. They were delicious. I doubt I would ever find myself back here, but if I did I would get the potatoes. Lastly, its not necessary to ask every time you refill water/ice tea, just fill it up and if I am not thirsty anymore I won't drink it and thus you won't refill it.   If you are looking for a delicious meal with great service this is not the place for you. My personal favorite in the valley is Mastro's City Hall - you will not leave disappointed.

12LkVzMZWBo0cKCMCgvy5g.text: Tonight was my Birthday (7/17/2017) and so we went to Flemings to celebrate. Appetizer of Shrimp cocktail came out and it looked and tasted very good. Order was taken for dinner and my wife ordered a side salad as her meal because she wasn't super hungry and decided to add salmon to it to flare it up. I ordered the king crab leg entree but wanted soup to come out first, which it did a short while later along with my wife's salad that was supposed to be an entree. Now the salad, although premature, didn't come out as requested with Salmon on it (as my wife may have considered eating it since it was at the table already) so it was sent back. Soup was very good and flavorful and the servers and assistant were on point as far as pre-bussing and getting refills. Ok, now entrees hit the table. First impression was Blah.... presentation was severely lacking. My wife's salad is really just lettuce with a small filet of salmon on top. Not really much body to the salad and she said the salmon was very bland as she couldn't have butter... but you would have thought the chef could have gotten creative with it despite the allergy to butter/oil. Now my Crab legs, when it was placed in front of me it was 3 small pieces about 6in in length that were halved. That's it, very boring and portion size for amount paid was horrible. I inquired with food runner about the portion size confirming this was my entree and he said yes. My wife and I looked at each other in amazement. Approximately 5 min later or so into the meal one of our two servers came by and said "your other half of your meal will be out shortly". Well that's a relief, but when it came out it tasted like salt water from the ocean and was not edible. 50% of the cost was comp'd. The server also spilled Ice Tea on/in my wife's purse. When we get the bill, my wife was charged $44 for the salmon and I think $12 for the lettuce. A $56 salmon salad that was horrible at best. The salad was more expensive than my crab legs. So Sad, time to find a new place.

SpAF8sXcOQalthZv4Lcb3w.text: Tasty food, attentive serving staff and good drinks including a fairly extensive wine list. We've been here often and will continue to come, HOWEVER...  We had a couple of non-food related problems on our visit a couple of weeks ago.   As we waited for our table, my daughter purchased the three of us drinks at the bar to make the wait a little more enjoyable. After being seated at our table, we were hit up by the manager for a new bar-bill total. Their mistake. This was a bit uncomfortable and looked to the surrounding tables as if we tried to pull a fast one. Not a comfortable situation. It seemed to me as if they might have taken the small hit instead of coming to our table asking for a couple of dollars.    The other issue involved virtually non-existent ADA restroom access for a person in a wheelchair. This is huge for injured persons in wheelchairs and if you happen to be a para or quadrapaligic, forget about it. First, you will not be able to get into the bathroom stall unless you are quite creative and then, when leaving, you will find the main door opens inward and even if you are able to get hold of the handle in the small space provided, you won't be able to open it and move your chair at the same time. Imagine having to ask someone walking by to open the door to the bathroom door so you can get back to your table  With all the ADA tools available, an upscale establishment like this should pony up for a push button door control!

FBV1zkcGw0tIK7OhHgjpAA.text: We went for a date night with my boyfriend on a Monday night. It was much fancier than I had anticipated. I felt a little under dressed in jeans and flip flops. We had zoe as our server and she was great. We ordered the sea bass, the filet and the flemings potatoes. Everything tasted great but I thought the filet portion was a little small.

_uXHV7HSrK_dgHzERfy0dw.text: We had such a delicious meal~!   My Hubby and I split a Bone-In Ribeye, Flemings Potatoes, Ceasars Salad, Bottle of Merlot, and Creme Brule for desett~!  We split it all and we left stuffed~!   They recorked and sealed our bottle so that we could finish at home.  We had a late dinner...we called and arrived 15 min to closing....and they said they would still serve us.....Our Server Zoe was Awesome~!   She never made us feel rushed......She encouraged us to enjoy our meal and relax~!   We only have good things to say about this place~!   People were dressed business casual to dressy so everyone feels comforyable~!   ;)

OHNm_VCaMTK946K95WTMrQ.text: Oh my god! This place is amazing! First of all you have to know that I am French. I enjoy American food but actually this place could be an upscale French restaurant.  Great place to bring a date if you don't mind to spend so much money, but actually it's worth it...  I had a beer, a great IPA, rotator from widmer brothers. Very nice.  Then we ordered some appetizers, some seafood, shrimps and crab and lobster plate. That was beautiful, fresh and the sauces with it were so good. I was already full after this but we had then one of their suggestion. A huge piece of beef for 2 with a very long bone. I can't remember its name. Sides : the corn and mashed potatoes with garlic. Insane. Great. We also had some onions, so tasty! Amazing! I was so full after this but I couldn't resist to try one of their desserts. I had the creme brulee, and god it was perfect! I tried several times before but that one is the best I had in USA. Served with fresh berries.  And then, the coffee. You guys don't know what is a real espresso, I'm sorry to tell you this. But actually Flemings espresso is great! Oh and, I forgot the most important... The bread. They give you a big piece with sauces, blue cheese and a whipped butter. Oh my god this is the best bread I had in the area. Even if it's not as good as French baguette, that was pretty good.  I will go back to that place for sure, expensive one but worth it so bad!

Q_1solC8-KDxRnPo4ARAcQ.text: We had the chance to give this place another chance for dinner tonight. Food was really good. Steak was cooked to perfection. Our server was amazing. Appetizer was really good and the lava cake was just fabulous.  Just updating my previews review we were glad we gave this place a second chance.  Thank you Nick.

EWqlcIE3Ll1agrldnlZmfA.text: It only gets a 3 Star because of the customer service. I would barely give it a 2 for the food. Its been a few years and in another city that I frequented Flemings. Gigi gets 5 stars, she was great. I made reservations months in advance because I was coming to town to celebrate my moms 75th birthday...not realizing it was Restaurant Week. We had a party of 6. The waiter was VERY busy when we arrived at 6:30pm on time for our reservation. He brought us menus and seemed bugged from the beginning. He was not happy when my mom asked for the Pre Fixe menu. She eats smaller portions so why not? 2 ordered off the Pre Fixe menu and 3 of us ordered off the regular menu. (one of our party left because he became ill from travel and dehydration) I ordered the tuna steak which was cut in half, not a steak but a 1/2" LITTLE piece that had been cut horizontally into two small pieces and was $47.00 The others ordered steak and a lamb chop which looked plentiful. We had 3 sides as well as salads and dessert. The food honestly was just okay. Not worth the $375.00 plus 20% tip which I paid but it was not earned. I am really disappointed in Flemings, it was always my go-to steakhouse even though I dont eat anything but fish...thanks for the memories.

eOT6zt28geBQKj8TPbjYrw.text: my filet medium-rare was cooked perfectly, my husband  had filet with  oscar style crab asparagus and Bearnaise sauce.  I thought he was going to lick the plate. Caesar salad and clam chowder to start. probably one of the best experiences and food that I've ever had, absolutely nothing to complain about. our 5 year wedding anniversary was acknowledged several times by the waiter and the floor manager who came around and knew us by name, how awesome for a first-time experience! they also give you dessert which was a molten lava chocolate cake with fresh whipped cream and berries with little vanilla wafers. I almost cried that's how good it tasted. they give you a little box of chocolate truffles that I have yet to try and $25 off your next visit, worth every Penny of. our $250 Bill. a must-try for your special occasion!

i0TE7Q6GB_Z0iGP688VwoQ.text: Have always enjoyed coming here for the good food and great service.  Went last night to celebrate our anniversary and the prices have increased and the quality has decreased.  My husband's $57 NY strip was 1/4 grizzle.  We spent $300 for dinner, wine and appetizer.  Didn't think it was worth that.

HpOug3uMNJpes_DyJVT0bQ.text: Service was great!   Nick was a fantastic waiter!   The food.....meh....The Keg is definitely better. We gave this place a shot after hearing great things about it.   I can't put my finger on it, there was just nothing special about it, especially for its higher price range. The Filet was just ok, and a little chewy. The truffle mashed potatoes were good.   My wife got the french toast brunch special, and it was not good at all. She did not eat but one bite. She said it reminded her of bread pudding.   Needless to say, we will keep going to The Keg for our steak house dinners.

ZeINjbui0x9sg1FBoFfHlQ.text: This place while incredibly expensive is delicious. There filet is great and the ribeye is even better. They cooked them to a perfect medium rare as well. The creamed spinach side is probably as good as the steaks themselves. The lobster one person had there was not that great which is my only complaint. The service though is unmatched, they are incredible.

QRER0YrFsPuEwvp9gpPcZQ.text: We celebrated my sons birthday. The lobster tails were out of this world. One of the best meals we have ever eaten, it was a little more pricey than I had expected but the overall experience was fabulous. I will return for special occasions.

8S-u_ZjepszaZbUXK-7J6w.text: Super pricey, great cuts of meat, steaks cooked perfectly. Dress is casual.  Valet parking service is great!    Expect to pay about $50 per person before drinks.    We have 4 drinks.  2 filets and 2 sides, $225 later we walked out stuffed

2t0u_K44fW_J-N36eMgTZw.text: We went here to celebrate my husband's promotion. Our steaks were delicious and cooked to our preferred perfection.  I added the lobster with caviar and it was unbelievably tender and melted in my mouth.  We had the lava cake for dessert and nearly died and went to heaven it was so delicious! Pricing is high but we'll worth it!

--PoIsyLdj5hXTUX8PdpHg.text: This is a strange review to write, because I'm a fan of Fleming's. I expect to write a 5 star review every time... but today, this is a 3 Star review that was bumped to 4 for good reason. I came in with a party of 8 coworkers, celebrating the end of the year. Our party included a mixture of people, some who eat at higher end restaurants on occasion, and some who were experiencing $50 steaks for the first time. Those of us with a little more experience, hyped up Fleming's and set expectations high. After all, it doesn't get a whole heck of a lot better. Right? We took advantage and ordered a lot of food. For starters we had the crab cakes, the calamari and the cold seafood tower. The calamari was fantastic! Great flavor, and this coming from someone who normally doesn't like calamari. Crab cake was good, though not amazing, and everything in the seafood tower was solid.  We had a couple of bottles of  a great Cab, Stag's Leap Artemis- which was wonderful ($135 a bottle). A few salads were ordered, all looked good and plates were cleaned. We shared a number of sides; Fleming's potatoes, mashed potatoes, asparagus, mushrooms, Brussel sprouts, and the Mac-n-cheese. All the sides were good, no complaints at all. Fleming's potatoes and the Brussels sprouts (believe it or not) seemed to get the best reviews. The disappointment tonight, shockingly, was the steaks. 7 of 8 ordered steaks. 5 of the 7 were cooked at the wrong temperature, 4 under cooked and one over cooked.  I'm not a complainer and I'm pretty good at eating a steak anywhere around medium, but my steak was medium-rare and closer to rare than medium-rare. As I cut around the edges of my $60 steak, I noticed others doing the same. After taking a pole, I learned that nearly everyone had an issue with their temperature. Problem was, by the time a waiter came by to see how everything was, the meal was half over. He asked how everything was, and I showed him my steak. I asked, "what temperature is this?", he said "mid-rare", that's right! But I ordered medium, and so did he, and so did she, and him over there...all the medium temps were cooked mid/rare to rare and one was cooked closer to med/well. Not one was cooked perfectly. Very surprised. I've never had temperatures so far off, for so many, in a single meal at any restaurant.  The issue of course is sending your steak back when the meal is half over. By the time you get it returned, everyone is finished and you're eating alone! No thanks, I'm not going to send it back- but I'm not happy. I expect wrong temperatures from Outback or Texas Roadhouse, but not Fleming's. And certainly not 5 of 7 steaks. If that was the end, I'd call this a 3 Star review. However....  The manager came by and said he heard there was a problem with some of the temperatures, I showed him what was left of my steak, explained that 5 of the 7 were wrong and why it was too late in the meal to send them back. He apologized, and without batting and eye, said they expect better and so should we...and took all 5 steaks off our bill. That's about $300, just like that.   I wasn't asking for free food and truth be told, my undercooked steak was still really tasty, just not the way I ordered it. The manager could have stopped at offering to cook our steaks more, or bringing a new one, but understood that it was too late. He went above and beyond my expectations by removing them from our bill. And that's why I had to add a star.   Will I be back? Yes I will. I've had a number of 5 star experiences at Fleming's...and now that I know there's basically a money back guarantee, I've got nothing to lose! A+ on the customer service.

ozh5B5MMC18gLlY77Ejmdg.text: Awesome service. I'm not one for uncomfortable snooty dining, and this restaurant made me feel very relaxed and comfortable. Food was good and well presented

JCK_w5GIkVjsZLV5rOOZ4g.text: Service was good. Food was average.  Nice patio but the Happy Hour has gone to the waist side!  The happy hour is no longer "Happy" drink prices will leave you feeling pretty sad!  For a $60 steak in Chandler sitting in a parking lot with a view of parked cars, I'll have to pass and find a more reasonably priced steak house.

KpYrEkyThuAIyRxo4OyNRg.text: First time. 6th anniversary. Heard a lot of great things. Very disappointed.  Seated immediately. Great staff. Very attentive. That's were all the positives stop. No sides come with the very overpriced Steaks. What turns out to be nothing more than a side salad is $13. Something called Fleming's potatoes which is about a  three-by-five brick of augratin potatoes with cheese on top, $13. The wife and an 8 oz filet and if it was 8 ounces before cooking it lost a lot of weight somewhere before it got to the table. I had a $50 ribeye that was so disappointing, I  honestly believe I could have gotten a better steak at Denny's with breakfast. The one cocktail I had was $11 and maybe had a half a shot of bourbon. Needless to say that was my one and only experience with Fleming's

YQTlZm_o7szJA9UtUk-u6Q.text: My steak is cooked exactly how I want it every time. The service surpasses my own expectations. Yes this is not the greatest deal on a steak dinner but its worth it!

nNYce-HHaZAf86t_pb6tvw.text: I had never been here before and was SUPER excited to eat here for Thanksgiving dinner I heard great things about the restaurant, so needless to say I was very disappointed in the food. I got the steak and lobster and it wasn't good at all no flavor it was just so blah nothing special about it and for the price you pay the food should be out of this world and it's just not and not worth going and spending all that money just to be let down I hate to say this but I would've rather gone to the Outback and had their steak and lobster at least I know I would've enjoyed my dinner. I won't be back nor will I refer people to the restaurant don't waste your money people.

EYygn1RhoRMwGK8Ygqj5tg.text: Wow!  What a great steakhouse with such a nice ambiance.  The wait staff is superb, very professional and taught very well.  They use technology and everyone is welcoming. They educate on each wine that they offer.  We had such a fun experience with Moscato and Moscow Mules but got down to business with the wonderfully enjoyable food they served.  I had the peppercorn steak with chipotle mac and cheese and sauteed mushrooms.  The dish was well done and its actually making me salivate as I remember how tasty it was.   Worth every dime.
