3kWw03NjO118_wltjeDhUw.text: Can I select a half star? I was so looking forward to Crab Monday...only to receive a very dry and anonymously seasoned King Crab and filet.   SO disappointing.  If the crab had been succulent, I would have forgiven the accouterments, however, the "potato casserole with cheddar something" or whatever they call it, was ridiculously overcooked, burned on the bottom with a very rubbery cheddar topping. The cook apparently  was trying to hide the mistakes underneath the thick, chewy, dry and crusty cheese topping layer.  Do they not think their patrons have at all a distinctive for file dining?  This was an absolute joke.   SO not succulent crab, and the bill...over $300 for 2 with a special of $39/filet & lobster or crab dinner.  I really need someone to please explain the $39 filet and lobster/crab dinner...?

NhhHXdA9hRbPREbPOWEGRQ.text: We went for date night on a Saturday evening.  They sat us in the back room which gave us a little bit more privacy, tables are very nicely spaced so you can't hear the next table's conversation and the back room keeps the noise from the main area muffled.  Staff were all very friendly, didn't feel rushed at all.  Food was amazing (though the stakes came out the wrong way round and my partner salted his to death before we noticed this mistake).  We'll be visiting again.

eWQvCzfJQJasMayHyDzKcg.text: This is sort of a tough review.  Flemings puts themselves out as high-end, and they charge high-end prices.  So one expects more from them than, for example, a Black Angus.  Normally I wouldn't go to a high-end steak house.  Frankly between my wife and I, we can do as well or better at home.  She does a couple of different seasonings depending on her mood, and I am pretty good at grilling them.  Anyway...we were invited to a seminar and the deal was they would feed us here.  Flemings does have some menu options you won't see at Black Angus, which is fine.  On this occasion I had the filet medallions (I think that's what they called them) with mashed potatoes and green beans.  Really nothing that fancy, but done properly this would be really good.  First point...I ordered medium well.  We agreed (the waiter and I) that this meant there would be a little pink, but not much.  Just a bit.  So when it come out it's medium rare.  VERY pink.  Not even medium.  Gotta mark them down for that.  Lots of places do that, and it's annoying.  I've given up asking anyone to cook it more because it always comes back either dry or burned.  Not Flemings specifically, but any steak place.  It's like they're annoyed..."you want it done more, I'll show you 'done more', you cretin!!".  Instead I just live with it.  Flavor-wise the filet was good.  Basic seasoning, nothing fancy.  But "nothing fancy" works in this case.  Nice flavor.  The potatoes were a bit cheesy, not much garlic.  They were fine.    Nothing special.  I think a bit more garlic was in order as I couldn't really detect any. The green beans I thought were a little under-cooked but I know a lot of people like that crisp snap.  The seasoning of the beans was good.  More than just a little salt, they really jazzed them up.  I liked them.  So the verdict?  Well, given how they bill themselves and what you pay I simply expect more.  I expect exciting flavors (even with potatoes), and I expect them to know what "medium-well" means and how to achieve it.  The meal was fine.  Even good.  But was it truly "high-end"?  I don't think so.  I've had high-end a few times, and this wasn't it.  So they're "OK", but I can't go so far as to say I'm a fan.  Three stars.

ircIVhUHdwlitPqdMynWCQ.text: Spot on in every category! Food was great, aged steak cook to perfection. Service was second to no one. We go here on special occasions at least 2-3 times a year. Manager even brought us out a gift box of truffles and a $25 gift card when we were done. Maybe they do this for everyone but I liked the touch anyway. Not a fan of potatoes or mac and cheese but I could eat theirs every day of the week.

lv6rWphcRFoR6-Le1KiJGA.text: Get the summer pairing of a filet and salmon with the chile lime prawns-best salmon I've ever had!!

d-P62aFfpd2sXsPomI3gwA.text: Pricey but always a great steak!  We came here for a family celebration and even though the place was full of business diners, we received good service.  We started with the chilled seafood tower which while pricey, was excellent.  This was followed by salads and I have to say that I preferred the"old" Wedge versus the New Wedge. The previous Wedge was the best that I have had anywhere and was just the right combination of flavors and crispy iceberg lettuce.  Steaks (Filets and Prime Ribeyes)  were tender, moist, and cooked to perfection.  Personally, I just prefer the high-temperature broiling method that Flemings uses to cook their steaks versus an open-flame/grilling approach. One diner had Seabass which fresh and tender. Sides (grilled asparagus, Fleming's potatoes, and creamed spinach) are always fresh and flavorful and among the best I've had anywhere.  The Raymond Napa Valley Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon was a nice value accompaniment with the steaks.  Creme Brulee was excellent and the Chantilly cream is just sinful.  A great place for special occasion.

_R1Pi_l1GWGLld6SF_adWg.text: Overall, I was very impressed: *Bread service- delicious mild herb crusty bread with a duo of herbed feta spread and sundried tomato butter. Not a huge herb fan, but this excellent. *Prime Rib- My husband ordered it and it was cooked perfectly. *BBQ salmon- I loved this dish. A little crispy and just the right amount of sauce. The server steered me away from the sole bc she said it wasn't very good, so I'm glad I took her advice. Loved it! *Molten chocolate cake- I don't normally like this type of dessert, but the portion was so big, I shared my husband's. It was rich, but not obnoxiously sweet. Served with premium vanilla ice cream, tulle cookies, pistachios, and the most Delicious homemade whipped cream I've ever had. The only downsides: * Fleming's potatoes were a bit oily and didn't taste the jalapeno. Next time I'll try one of the mashed choices. * One of my pet peeves is when a menu lists a ton of ingredients for an item, and it seems to be fully inclusive but it's not. This is the case with the house salad. The menu listed cranberries, tomatoes, croutons, etc. but not onions. I didn't think to ask bc the description seemed very comprehensive. Well, there were red onions all over the salad I had to pick off and some type of shallots or other similar onion relative chopped into small pieces that could not be separated. I can't eat onions, so I tasted the salad but couldn't eat it. The lemon vinaigrette dressing was excellent, though. $ - We got two entrees, 2 salads, two side orders, one dessert, and 2 nonalcoholic beverages for $104. Not bad at all for the quality of food. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Barbequed salmon

CJmmWEdHKEYSb6qJ2mCqMw.text: Went here with three couples on Valentine's Day and had the unfortunate luck of getting "Aubrey" as our server. From the very beginning, she came across as very snooty and condescending. It made the whole table feel uncomfortable to the point of almost requesting another server. During the entire meal, she made little snide remarks and felt the need to correct us about everything from the type of coffee they serve, whether the cappuccino was sweetened, what order we needed to order in and even how bad the blood Mary's were there. She didn't check on the food after served and seemed bothered by any questions about the menu. Overall, it was a very bad experience not necessarily because of the food but because of Aubrey.  Although we looked young, everyone at that table makes 6 figures a year with platinum Amex cards as you saw. Don't do that...be mean, judgmental and arrogant. You were officially the lowest tip I have left in the last 20 years. Flemings you deserve and have better servers. Please know that Aubrey is not representing the brand or the chandler restaurant well at all.

vfxJCNGAi0qFRkwGT2bVAg.text: Okay everyone let's start off with price this is not a place you're going to walk out the door without spending pretty much close to $100 per person  so if that something you consider when you're going out don't eat here. OK enough said about that, the service here is phenomenal excellent wait staff excellent food my wife went here for her birthday and had a great time we stuck to small plates not because we were worried about cost but we like to eat smaller portions and I am NOT one to really go for a $60 steak I do believe that's a bit on the high side. We started off with a spinach salad that was outstanding and I had the soup of the day which was a leek soup which was really one of the best I've ever had for the main course we had a short rib and a shrimp and scallop dish both wonderfully prepared actuall  did have a good bottle of wine and topped off with the creme brulee I understand that there molten lava cake is something to be seen but we're creme brulee fans and it was again perfectly prepared and enough for two the same is True of their side dishes   again the service was outstanding the waiter was attentive without being overly bearing this is a perfect place for an anniversary or birthday it's certainly not going to be your Thursday night steak joint but highly recomend for special treat.

kz-EVInXbGuDwglTZhig3w.text: I'm not that pleased with this experience. For the price, I expected better ambiance and better presentation. The steaks were seasoned and cooked well. Our family enjoys a good cut that's perfectly done to each person's speculations. Also the service was perfect. Our server was thoughtful and attentive, without overly interrupting when we didn't need anything. However, for the high price of everything (not just the steaks) on the menu, we would've expected the place to feel more exclusive, more fancy, not so loud. It felt like a nice bar rather than a fine dining establishment. We had to shout over the noise and the place wasn't even totally full (Sunday evening). The plates were also nothing special to look at. Again because of the price, we expected a few frills. The meat and separate sides came out just plainly put onto plates. No effort was put into the presentation. Even casual restaurants throw some greens or garnishes on the dish for a little extra aesthetic. Probably won't return. If I'm paying this much, I'd like to feel a little more pampered.

Oz2sGOOjo3EXqE3UTu99dg.text: I came here with my husband for a special occasion and found the food to be just ok and the service was terrible. The waiter didn't want to be there and should not have been. I heard good things about this place so we checked it out but I will not recommend it nor will we go here again.

_MZOXGXe7VRzx90DWUmp1g.text: Love, Love, Love Fleming's happy hour!  It is a nice atmosphere with smokin' deals on decent wine and drinks and great appetizers. There is also a very tasty burger on the happy hour menu.  The service is usually excellent.

mUqzwb--ZKZJLMtABNtOCQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here for our 3 year Anniversary. This was my first time dining at Fleming's so I was excited. The atmosphere was absolutely perfect. We had a reservation so we walked in and was greeted with an Anniversary card that was signed by the staff! Unbelievable! We get seated and order our drinks and meal. The service was spectacular! The food is amazing. Everything was perfect to make our night so special. The manager came to our table to greet us and wished us a Happy Anniversary. My boyfriend asked a question about his meal and noticed they left off the bacon on his steak. No big deal but the manager took care of it immediately. After we finished our meal, we got our check and our waiter gave us a $50 gift card and some gourmet chocolate! We could not believe it. Our experience was unforgettable and we plan to go back very soon! Service goes a long way and they nailed it!

jywYvzfkRqb0ABh3RwbxLw.text: Excellent food, top-notch service, exorbitantly priced.  Not for budget minded diners...

EDySN9cSxOSJb2K7JbBdiQ.text: 5 stars pretty much speaks for itself and Flemings reputation as a prime steak house is well known, so the reason we're writing this review is to shout out that their free range lemon-rosemary brick chicken is absolutely fantastic!  One of the best entrees we've ever had.  Now it's hard to go to a steak house and order anything but steak but this particular dish is worth the sacrifice.  A full half of chicken beautifully grilled and surrounded by a dozen or more mouth-watering spinach gnocchi.  Everything was wonderful, from the bread & spreads to the creme brulee, but the star of the night was the free range chicken.

h311utAymtCvQKeRhnrbAA.text: I'm a fan is because the service here is excellent. The servers are helpful but not overbearing (i.e. asking every 5 mins if we need anything) and if anything goes wrong - i.e. it starts raining while you're on the pation or the food is served incorrectly, the management staff is EXCELLENT in making sure you're happy.  Of course, this place is pricey but definitely worth the $.Good food, great wine and terrific servers, bartenders and managers.

HWQXgw7UAnUR1W-lqtB-yA.text: My wife and I met 2 friends at the bar for some happy hour and dinner action last night.  It was about 6:30 and I think we snagged just about the last open table.    I was pretty impressed with their happy hour selections and prices.  The ladies had glasses of wine and the guys had a Kettle martini with blue cheese olives (my absolute fav!).  The martini was excellent especially because it was 6 bucks.  The wine pour was a bit skimpy though.  The 4 of us shared the crab cake appetizer and it was excellent and will definitely order it again.  For an entree I ordered the sliced fliet mignon burger sans bun.  It is exactly as it sounds; basically a sliced filet mignon.  It was pretty thick so I have no idea how people actually eat the thing on a bun.  Anyway it was excellent as well as good sized.  I would order it again but I keep reading about how the Fleming's prime burger is very good not to mention a 3rd of the cost of the sliced filet burger.  I will probably try that next time.  My wife ordered the portebello mushroom burger and it was awesome.  It was topped with sauteed spinach and goat cheese.  OMG sooo good!  I should order that next time to put on top of a real burger.  It  was actually very good and I could see myself ordering that if I was not in the mood for red meat.  For dessert we all shared the lava cake.  WOW! Sooo good!  You have to order it 20 minutes in advance so you know it is fresh.  It comes with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a bowl of fresh homemade whip cream.  The whole thing was just awesome but that whip cream put it over the edge.  The entire staff that waited on us during the evening were very fast and friendly.  All-in-all it was an excellent evening with great food and service.  I will definitely be back!

oTXuMYBltmK91vRfM9buNA.text: The steak was good, but not particularly impressive at $40 per plate. I got the Surf and Turf special with scallops, and two 5oz filet. The filets were good, cooked perfectly, and great cuts of meat. Just not wowed. The real disappointment was in the scallops that came with the dish. For the class of the place, one expects a certain level, and those scallops didn't even come close.

-KUzTVGPIaI6K3gjCVm5aA.text: The prime burger was absolutely amazing! I visited this location on 10/2/2012 with my sister-in-law and parents.  First ever visit ti Fleming's as I live out of state.    The only (2) two complaints that I have: the prime burger is a whooping 1105 calories (and I'm not even sure if this includes the special sauce and the two onion rings that are served on the side). It's my fault I should've asked the server since the caloric intake is not listed on the menu.  Second issue, how many times do you have to ask a server for straws until you get frustrated. Also, wouldn't you think that an empty glass of water means " please fill up my glass". Come on servers this is a high end establishment. Get it together!!!!! Very frustrating!

J0QJepHVw20NYqGGCcx-PA.text: My family of 11 went with a reservation on a Monday night. There was some changes to our party size and the hostesses seemed so stressed about it. I would think that crisis this these would happens from time to time but they acted like the whole world was collapsing and they did not know what t do... get some extra chairs and get on with it! They were beyond annoyed by this time and we were kept waiting in the lobby for them to fix this code red catastrophe (insert eye roll).Ok so on to the actual meal. Our waitress was here and there and forgot more often than forgivable. Also when we were ordering our meal she asked us if we wanted soup or salad with our entree, in my opinion implying that it was included with the order, but guess what? Not the case. This establishment tries to act like it is some high end steak house, but they only succeed in ACTING like it. My meal was cold and the steaks were a joke. The only good review that I would give would be for their clam chowder. As we were exiting the restaurant the hostesses gave us no more than a look in our direction leaving me feeling like a second class citizen... who spent more than $500 on a below average meal.

8jrkmWYQxJelWorlYpiIjg.text: The steak was okay. A little gritty and not as tender as I'd hope. The Flemings Potatos were terrible! They wern't cooked all the way. Our drinks sat empty quite often. They forgot the butter for our king crab legs and we had to remind them a few times to bring it. For dinner at $150 I would expect better. We wished that we had gone elsewhere.

nkJXiLu2ZAYL7F6N4CXxvA.text: Very upscale and nice. Valet only on weekends and the food is great. The bartender remembers me even if I havent been in months. The steak and seafood tower are the best. Expect to spend some money here.

GwUK28rs-wL3Su91UkesKA.text: Went in for a quick bite and glass of wine, came out happy. Would be five stars if the glass wine list was better.

HxXFkVU_V-EanA1Z5x3U1Q.text: I had heard that this was a good fancy restaurant to go to so I took my parents here when they came to visit town and I must say that I was dissappointed. The cost for 3 people was exorbitant for the quality. We are not a family that minds spending a little for excellent food but this meal did not meet the standard for the amount our meal was for three people.  The portions of the appetizers we shared were tiny. I think we had three pieces of ravioli in the ravioli dish which was not much. My steak left a pile of inedible gristle that filled a quarter of my plate and I don't even usually mind a little fat which adds flavour.  It was clearly not edible but the waiter asked me 'aren't you going g to eat that?' 'Uh..that's a no.' For the price I would not go there again. Too expensive for mid level quality. I would prefer somewhere like the keg where I have had far better food at a better value.

CTXUpIFHA8T70er5qwaYIA.text: My group of three did the Sunday prime rib special, which includes a salad, side, and dessert. Particularly noteworthy items we tried were the bread, Caesar salad, sauteed mushrooms, cheesecake, and creme brulee.  The steaks were ordered three different ways, and all of them came out perfectly.  The hostess and servers did an excellent job in making us feel welcome and special. As someone else noted, they swap out the white napkins for black ones if your slacks or skirt are dark.  The only reason I'm not a regular diner at Fleming's is the price. It is an expensive meal, so it is a place reserved for special occasions. Thankfully, the experience is so outstanding that it justifies the cost.

rVEQPMzwIamtrfJV5db-aA.text: Wow! This Steak House is Awesome. My husband and I decided to Celebrate our Anniversary here. We both enjoyed our server "Cody", he was very friendly and had great knowledge of the menu. Our Steaks were cooked perfectly. The wine recommended by our server tasted exactly the way he described "fresh and crisp". I'm happy that my awesome husband made reservations because there was a pretty big crowd waiting for a table so if you plan on going here  reserve a table ahead of time.  Thanks for a great experience we will definitely be coming back.

XcfjdnfCvBozwOHu72dVMw.text: It's restaurant week and it was the first place I chose. The total came out to ~$50 a person, and I was surely disappointed. The Steakhouse didn't live up to expectations.   Here's their 3 course meal:  1)Fleming's Salad: Candied walnuts, dried cranberries, tomatoes and croutons. Rating: 3/5. The salad was decent, but not memorable. I thought the salad was very simple, nothing to rave over. When I think of a good salad, I think of Wildflower's combination salad. This one was just average.   2) Lite Filet Mignon served with Fleming's Potatoes. Rating: 3.5/5. Maybe it's because I had Sushi Roku's Filet Mignon 4 days prior (which was superb and steak isn't even their speciality). The Filet Mignon was good, I just expected it to be a lot more juicy and tender since it is a steak house afterall.   3) Hazelnut Chocolate Mousse. Rating: 1/5. The first bite was OK, I had two or three more bites expecting it to be much better but it didn't get better. Our waitress even said it was her favorite... but it was a total disappointment.   Overall, they've got great service and its a classy restaurant. However, I do not think I'll be coming back. All I could think about was this was the most expensive meal I've had in a year and for ~$50 it's a plane ticket from PHX to SAN.

U49OqqDYOXKLFINSjpe5KQ.text: I celebrated my birthday there with spouse and another couple.  The atmosphere is nice and an extensive menu.  I had a small filet which was perfectly done.  It was my birthday so we received 2 lava cakes, a box of truffles and a $25 gift card to return!  Prices were not unreasonable and the service was excellent.  I would suggest some soft background music and maybe just a bit dimmer on the lights to create a bit quieter, more relaxed mood.  Overall, we would return.

s31VCMUmMAiwptk4-GZOmg.text: Came here for my girlfriend's birthday. As I had told them before hand what we were celebrating they had a nice booth in the back waiting for us. Food was really good except for the dinner salad which was 11$ and I'm pretty sure it was the bagged pre mixed lettuce. They provided a gift card and some truffles for my girlfriend which was a nice touch. The reason for the poor review is are table was surrounded by gnats that were flying around us during our entire meal. One even landed in our wine glass and we had to brush them away which made for an unromantic dinner. We told the waitress and they called see us brushing the gnats away but made no attempt to move us. Not sure if it's a lack of cleaning in that area but avoid the back booths.

ZKXwKIAdqxcV3nneS4d17Q.text: This is a high-end steakhouse and you pay for it. I never spend my own money here... too expensive - but I never pass up a chance to eat here on someone else's dime!  All the food is excellent... the one time my steak was bad they took it back no questions asked, gave me another and comp'd the entree.  The seafood tower, if you can afford it, is fantastic. The wine selection, as you'd expect, is very good.  Not much else to say as since if you know what a high-end steakhouse is supposed to be, this is it.

vhy76-d0VhISuQBGZvuEeQ.text: We have been here a few times and the staff is always great. The food is good, and the chocolate lava cake is the best dessert i have ever had. We never have to wait, the servers are knowledgable and ready to reccomend based on our taste, and the drinks are excellent. Try the ruby slipper, the martinis or the peach sparkler. Great service and a great atmosphere and happy hour is totally worth it. The lobster is the best in town.

jlo8HzVmvHIHVOYKwtiUoA.text: Consistently incredible service and flawless steaks award Fleming's Steakhouse five big ones. I've been to steakhouses all over the country and this place holds it's own with the best of them while not being overbearingly expensive. It's not cheap by any means, and it's got a dash more of the old school cool flare than the modern feel to it, but I don't consider that a particular fault. Few places at this point in time get me as fired up as knowing I'm going to Fleming's for a bone-in rib-eye... that thing is a masterpiece.

vGRAuS-7vRhn6h7CMpSVng.text: Although the steak was terrific, the service was slow and the food was cold when it did come.  When making my reservations, I had asked for the warmest spot in the house but we were seated in a cold and drafty area.  Very disappointing because we brought my mother for a very special occasion and we were all sorry we had come

GRbiWwc8ZDUkl1LzfKUxPw.text: Wanted a top notch meal and that's what we got.  The pork belly appetizer was cooked perfectly and also had a polenta/cherry sauce that worked well.  Wedge salad was a pleasure - big slices of blue cheese on fresh bacon.  Wonderful.  All entrees were prepared perfectly - dry aged ribeye, filet, salmon - excellent.  Mac and cheese and au gratin potatoes were just as decadent as we'd expect.  The onions were a bit grainy but not bad.  For desert we got a molten lava cake - oozy as expected plus a perfectly crisp vanilla cookie and ice cream.  Wow.  A grass hopper for a night cap and I'm already planning my next trip.  Service was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. The crispy pork belly - well accented by polenta and a cherry sauce.  Flemings rocked it.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Molten lava cake, vanilla ice cream, a crisp vanilla wafer and extra whipped cream.  Delicious, Flemings rocks!

LBdZ0gidXtLw5AyOyW3P7w.text: I use to visit another steak house downtown Chandler until I found Flemmings. Staff have gone above and beyond. Love this place

vfg8eXAefmyovmxZuGxszg.text: It was my Birthday and my wife, her mom, a dear friend and I headed to Fleming's Steakhouse in Chandler, AZ. We heard only great things about this place and wanted to experience their 'unforgettable' steak dishes. That, we did, unfortunately.   The restaurant was lovely dim-lit, adequate atmosphere for an expensive steak place. We were seated immediately and tended to by the waiting staff. The small roll of bread and two kinds of butter were good but insufficient for four hungry souls and we polished it up right away. No one offered to bring more. Our waiter told us about the daily specials, after which we ordered food and wine. After a short wait, four large dinner plates arrived. I was the lucky one, my steak (a large  rib eye steak, ordered medium-rare which tasted very good despite two large blobs of fat) was sitting pretty in the middle of the large dinner plate. Nothing else on my plate, just the steak. I looked around at my wife's plate and couldn't believe, her fillet mignon was laying there, in the middle of the large dinner plate without anything garnishing it, be that a glaze, a leaf, a slice of whatever! At the prices asked by this restaurant, it felt like an insult to each of us to have such a poor presentation of a steak!! We asked our waiter for a side dish, mashed potatoes with Parmesan, and when they arrived, we couldn't believe it! There were no more than two scraggly potatoes turned into mashed potatoes, or about a tablespoon of mashed potatoes per person. Mind you, they tasted good, but at over $9.00 per side dish? In short, we left hungry and wondering why we spent over $200 for the entire meal.  Next time, we'll go to a well tried place for steaks and more. Durant's, downtown Phoenix and worth the drive.

PhWhHjae5esqV33G1CDzrA.text: For the price you pay, would expect better quality food.  Felt like I went to outback and multiplied bill by 3.   Food wasn't bad, but no where NEAR what they are charging for a meal.  Service is top notch though.

TtSkIYsLsfkSf0jqZnUFwQ.text: What an amazing night we had.  We were looking for restaurants tonight in and near Tempe (we're visiting from Los Angeles), we found Flemings!  And then I remembered I  had a gift card for $100 that a friend had given me.  The portions looked so huge that we decided to split an entree, a potato and a salad. We even split a glass of wine!  It was a wonderful decision.  As we looked around, we saw all male/female couples and we pondered and wondered if male/female couples were treated any differently than us. So Janet casually asked our waitress  if she were homophobic. She said, "No, not at all!"  We told her we were celebrating our anniversary - 2 years of legal marriage and almost 24 years of being together.  She thought that was great!  How wonderful, we thought.  We even showed her a picture of our 3 month old granddaughter.  So we ate our delicious meal which was excellent, everything cooked to perfection- we were too full for dessert.  The check comes and it's almost exactly $100... $102 to be exact. Great!  I took out the gift card and was about to pay when the manager comes over and extends his hand and says "I hear it's your anniversary!"  "Yes," we say.  He tells us that they are very supportive of us and he is so happy to tell us that the whole meal was comped!  We were more than thrilled!  Not only for the comped meal but for the recognition that we are as legit as any other couple.  They even brought us some Godiva chocolates to take with us.  Please patronize Flemings whatever your relationship status! We come back here about once a year and will certainly come back again - for our next anniversary!  All because we decided to speak up and be seen as who we are - a couple, in love, celebrating with good food and a great atmosphere. And instead of prejudice, we were met with compassion, equality and legitimacy. Made us feel very special. Megan was our server who was great even before she knew about us. And Anthony was the manager who was so genuinely kind and generous. We were really astonished!  The whole staff was great.  Oh and when one of the male/female couples left (one of the ones we noticed were very sweet and close to each other) they came over to us and said "We overheard it was your anniversary and we wanted to tell you our congratulations!"   Amazing!!  How far we've come. Thank goodness.

srNjstOSs-w-dfHyqAimyw.text: This Flemings is awful. This is the 2nd time we have had the worst service by the SAME horrible server! His name is Ray. And we had to complain about the service the last time we went in and thought we would give it a shot again maybe it was just a new guy or something. The food was also so bad the last time we had to return the meals after waiting for so long to get it. This time around there were 4 of us, he took our drink order one person at a time (literally turned around and walked off after one person ordered and did not return for a long time) After we all finally got drinks I was able to get him to take an appetizer order. It was brought out after a while. When it was delivered he came by and took out menus. Did not take our order. Just grabbed the menus. After he came back to collect the empty seafood tower I asked him if he would like to take our dinner order. "Oh are you ready to order?" Really?? Who orders their entre after finishing the app? After our mediocre steaks were delivered 2 HOURS AFTER WE GOT THERE is when we decided we would never return. We sat at the table for 30 min after we were done eating and our table had been cleared waiting for our $500 bill. We had to flag down another waiter to get it delivered who told us all their servers including Ray has worked there for about 15 years and was chuckling about the poor service we had received 2 times in a row from him. I have been a waitress and a bartender for many years, so I can laugh off a crappy server here and there. But when you are dropping $500 on a dinner that isn't even amazing it is nothing to laugh about. The service is ridiculous and the prices they charge for their only decent food is outrageous. WILL NEVER RETURN!

DatrFb37FPtHjJyJ1Z_NIw.text: Ruth's Chris quality without the commute ... or the snoot.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

HZ2wc4-RuhlH0PLp2sdU2A.text: I was visiting town on a business trip and we stopped into Fleming's for a mid-week dinner.  The visit wasn't a complete flop, but close to it...  If the ribeye was in fact a "prime" ribeye, they did one heck of a job cooking all of the flavor out of it.  To mask the horrible grill work, they covered the steak with more salt that was necessary for the entire cow.  I've been lucky enough to dine an a wide array of steak houses that claim to serve "prime" steak, and this is the bottom of the list.  I would not recommend this restaurant for a large group as the atmosphere is quite loud.  We had six people at our table and a conversation that included everyone was not possible.  To end on a positive note, the servers and wait staff were terrific.  They are easily on-par with other prime steakhouses around the country.  Regarding the item on the menu that I enjoyed the most was the sweet chili calamari.

tw6vWuVSA_Oi9jIdJdwuxg.text: If u make a reservation plan to wait 15-30 minutes longer. We made a 7:45pm reservation & were not seated until 8:15. If you like a good steak it might be worth the wait. Just don't plan on a movie after.

hHxlBx_lWAX6SlBGsNoGbg.text: New Year's Eve reservations were made well in advance, but when we got there on time, the lobby was packed, people were lined up waiting, and the bar had no seating. We were told when we checked in that previous customers decided to linger and so the wait time would be about 20 mins to half an hour and that we could order a drink in the bar lounge while we waited.  Well there was absolutely no room in the bar  or anywhere else to wait, so we waited for about 20 mins lined up against a wall in the pathway of waitstaff.  People just kept  coming and waiting and waiting and waiting. If Flemings is going to take reservations, they need to honor that and not greedily overbook so that there are so many people waiting in the lobby that there is no breathing room.  I'm sure that they have done New Years Eve before and should be able to guess pretty accurately how many reservations to take. Otherwise, they should be honest and say, sorry we don't take reservations and it is on a first come serve basis so that people can plan for that. Management is really not concerned with how customers view this restaurant. Management is really not concerned with how customers view this restaurant since the manager didn't acknowledge the problem when we spoke to him  or apologize or do anything else. We used to think Fleming was a pretty good restaurant,  but we don't plan to go there again or recommend others to go there or take our out of town guests there.  It's the principle of the thing. People will hear about our experience there as we are always asked about where to eat. A word of advice to the management.  Customer service IS very important to the survival of any business.

0JWkXXChVh0ywsbK4Z9bVQ.text: Sunday night prime rib special is amazing!  Comes with salad, side dish, and dessert!  This prime rib was the best I think I have had!  Usually when you order it rare to mid rare it can be a little tough or chewy, but this prime rib melted in my mouth!  There were four of us, we all ordered the same special with different sides so we all could share...highly recommend it!

lZtBjCObCtHI6kXktjniOA.text: Thie service at this place has gone down hill.   I feel like I'm at mcDonalds.  When you pay top dollar for a steak and get treated with slow in friendly staff it puts a bad taste in my mouth.    I live within a mile of this place but will no longer give them my business.

gtBsiI6bR8vB-gOhXebRRQ.text: New to the area and I stopped in after a long day at work to relax and enjoy a burger. Wow, spectacular food. Service is another why the less than stellar review. I waited standing for 40 minutes for a spot in the bar area and they clearly saved a.spot for someone who came in 15 minutes after I waited. I had asked if anyone was sitting in the spot he went to and was told yes by the bar staff...not True because I watched the man come in and ask of there was room.at the bar....the spot i asked for was maniacally available...ugh. But still, I am glad I waited. Very rarely do I eat meat... this was perfect and Brandon was a great server.... I'll be back. Only suggestion... bar staff be honest and more personable... kind of nonchalant and for AZ that's normally not the case.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

787VoW442Ksi2xK_IRU0RQ.text: Thought we'd try a different restaurant tonight so we decided on Fleming's in Chandler.  Enjoyed a nice dinner with my wife and friends. Fleming's is a great place for steaks.  I love a good NY Strip steak and the one I had tonight was well seasoned, flavorful, and cooked just as ordered, medium rare. My wife kept saying that her lobster tails were delicious. I should add that the French onion soup was very tasty, better than most. Oh, I don't want to forget to mention the delicious brussel sprouts. Seasoned with bacon... what's not to love? Service was adequate, but I thought our server could have been a little more attentive.  All in all, a great steakhouse.

JigunS2OW98vaE0SfihokQ.text: Menu change. All small plates are gone and all prices have gone up even more. We only go when a friend asks to join. Had the Halibut, maybe 4 oz at best. Sauce was tasty, but at $49 not worth the effort. Started with seafood tower, nothing outstanding.  Stick with basics if you go. A good steak, some creamed spinach and a potato. Table also had Chilean Sea Bass, was missing that fluffy-ness was a cheap tail end cut

YChKip51tghRgf8X9x7rFQ.text: I took advantage of the AZ Restaurant Week. Reservations for 3 on Open Table for Tuesday at 7:00 p.m. When we arrived we were greeted and seated at a spacious booth. Zoe introduced herself and took our drink and cocktail orders as water, hot bread and butter were being served.   The 3 of us ordered off the AZ Restaurant Week menu (great deal even with the extra charge on certain items). For Starters we ordered the New England Clam Chowder and Caesar Salad. For Entrees we ordered the 6 oz. and 12 oz. Fillet Mignon, and Chilean Sea Bass. For Sides we ordered Fleming's Potatoes, Creamed Spinach, and Thai spicy green Beans. Desserts were Cheesecake and Walnut Turtle Pie which were box up because we were all too full. The steaks were cooked perfectly to our request. The Sea Bass was OK. All the sides and Desserts were excellent.   Service from Zoe was excellent. Food and cocktails were very good. I would definitely be back again. Hint Hint, you save some $$ if you buy the Gift Certificates for Fleming's at Costco and pay with them.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carpaccio
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chilean Sea Bass
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Caesar Salad

9TN68IRXHN3ASq3Cq8831w.text: My wife and I were celebrating our 16th wedding anniversary and chose Fleming's for dinner.   From the time we arrived to the time we left we were treated extremely well. Our server Emily made our experience wonderful. From the drinks, to the meal to dessert, we were totally pampered for our evening. The food was stellar, the drinks were spot-on and the gifts provided by the restaurant were incredible

aTR9KcbYo5pa_sbnIR-iOA.text: Won't be back, sorry. We came in with another couple. Placed an order. About 5 minutes in the server announce that they are out of tuna. In the next 5 minutes - one of the other main courses was no longer available either. Drinks were very mediocre. The servers and the manger were very pleasant, but we counted at least 6 people waiting on us throughout the evening which is nice, but I am sure it cost a restaurant a lot of money to keep all that staff and the food price would be higher just because of that. Food was nothing to go back to. It's a beautiful place, but they need to restructure.

Sj3JLiAIIdGsdhfK7fiVcA.text: My mom and my best friends and I came to this restaurant hoping to get a nice steak dinner and some wine...but what we got was so much more. I am in awe at what they do to make sure the experience for their guests is spot on. Our server Brittany was amazing. We ordered a bottle of white wine and a glass of Prosecco. We each ordered a filet mignon and a bunch of sides to share. One of the steaks was supposed to be well-done and came out pretty pink. He wasn't going to say anything but the server came back and noticed it was pink. She apologized and took it back. The steak was brought back and was still a little undercooked. They comped the steak off the tab. The managers, Bruce and Mark, both came over separately apologizing and did whatever they could to make it right and they sure did. They gave us free desserts and took off the filet off our tab. Brittany was so personable. Mark and Bruce really were nice and accommodating. We didn't expect anything out of and they went the extra mile to make us feel special. I am in awe with these amazing people who provided us with a wonderful and special dinner. We felt like we were treated like royalty. And for that, we will be back. Amazing food and even more amazing service. Thank you Bruce, Mark, and Brittany for giving us an amazing evening at your restaurant. We appreciate it so much!!

dIh0yzYc0D2mIaxleaS_bA.text: My boyfriend and I were celebrating my recent job promotion and our two year anniversary. I must say that the service is what will bring me back again for other celebrations. We had a wonderful server, and were greeted by the manager who congratulated us. The ambiance is very nice for special occasions and anniversaries, however if you wanted to catch the football game or baseball game, you could eat at the bar area. The noise from the bar area does not carry into the fine dining area.   We both ordered a Caesar salad, the filet mignon and lobster tail, and for dessert we shared the chocolate lava cake AND the cheesecake. Their prices are fair - it's a fine dining establishment. The filet mignon was cooked exactly how I wanted it, and the lobster was delicious. Needless to say, I will be looking forward to celebrating at this Fleming's again.

WwlV2CN7PAPL4ew8G5g-8Q.text: Dang..Hate to write this.  Big plans...Make reservation specifically asking for quiet table. Guess what?  They sit us next to a group of 20..... Waiter and staff were very nice..professional. Takes our Drink order..spends the next half hour with the group of 20. Finally I get his attention and beg for another beer. I actually have to ask about getting an appetizer...Dang..  So far the anniversary is going south.... Next we decide to split a $65 Ribeye medium rare..... Comes out raw. Dang.... Could have went to Safeway for this steak. Server tells me be careful with the plate...Hot...and all that.  It was about as hot as a chilled salad plate at Applebees. Dang.. So much for sizzling butter.  Ah..man...Well the coffee was delicious....I will say that. Again, the waiter and staff were top notch. The food was no better than Sizzler..and that is after dropping $200.  Cant risk going back with that kind of damage....

C-2sYvaq3tzvA48lMcozYg.text: Good food. But skip the deserts. The ice cream is poor Quality. You would think a high end steakhouse would at least serve haagen daz. Come on Fleming's Blue bunny?!

8tcbWPvMBKL0DJTCVw5uEQ.text: I don't normally like to write negative reviews, and I certainly did not expect to write one about this steak chain based on its reputation, but our first experience here will be our last.  We chose to eat at Fleming's because we wanted a nice dinner before a show we were seeing at the AMC Cinema across the highway.  Our reservation was early, 5PM, just at opening.  Perhaps this was the mistake we made, or perhaps our experience was typical.  Entering the restaurant I was instantly blinded by how dark it was.  It was as if they had forgotten to turn on the lights.  Being led to our small, cramped, too narrow booth, I bumped into other booth edges and tripped over chairs because I could not see them.  After squeezing into the seat I was handed the wine list which I also could not read.  It took a good 10 minutes for my eyes to adjust to the cave-like lighting.  Not impressed.  Also not impressive was the waiter, who maybe was having a bad day or maybe he had just arrived and was not yet in "waiter mode" or maybe he was just a jerk, but he was not attentive nor seemingly interested in serving us.  He did not have a suggestion for wine even after I informed him I was ordering a bottle, which is not in character for a "Wine" restaurant.  If he worked for me he'd have been out on his ear.  The wine list was good, although short on our favorite varietals.  We found the one red Zinfandel on the list to try.  And then we waited.  A bus boy brought us water, but no bread.  Other tables seemed to have bread.  We waited some more.  And some more.  Does it take 30 minutes to get a bottle of wine?  I started checking my watch, knowing we only had 2 hours until the show.  Eventually the waiter returned with the wine.  I tried to joke with him that maybe the bottle was just a hard one to find and he grunted something unintelligible, showed me the label for 5 seconds and popped the cork, then asked if we were ready to order.  We ordered salads and steaks and he said "thanks" and left.  OK, I will pour my own glass.  The salads were the highlight of the meal.  My wife had a wedge and I had their special salad, and we both enjoyed them.  This was the only part of the meal we enjoyed.  When the steaks arrived we had to ask for bread to accompany the meat, which eventually arrived.  The steaks looked to be done to our Med-Rare order but both my wife's filet and my aged NY Strip were raw at one end.  It was almost as if they had been half-off the grill.  We could not eat them, and had no time to send them back.  We ate what we could and had the rest boxed to nuke at home.  My wife ordered a side of mushrooms and I the asparagus, and while the asparagus was done it was flavorless and my wife's mushrooms so full of garlic that was all they tasted of.  We finished our wine, paid the nearly $300 check and left.  We will not be back.  Also, we cannot assert that there were hormones in the beef, but my wife is sensitive to this and after eating here she was sick for some time.  Ugh.  We cannot assert that the beef was tainted... however...

BZwjQar4Ik8xQ9V7B02tsA.text: I have been here and the one in Scottsdale many times before and it's been great. Tonight was mediocre at best. My crab cakes were gross and didn't taste fresh. My sisters steak was so undercooked it had to be sent back. My husband's steak could've walked off of the plate because it was nearly raw. I was really disappointed. The waitress did not tell us about any specials and I even asked about Monday funday that I had gotten an email on and she did not even describe the 3 course deal to us. Not impressed. Probably won't return.

MsMu4NU3AEX6kUqwBxG7JA.text: I needed to submit a receipt to be reimbursed and I looked EVERYWHERE with no luck. I called Flemings and within minutes my original receipt popped in my e-mail. Service at this place its truly impressive.

X0FuFJxeEYP6Apj_tQW1sA.text: I was craving a steak so here we came!  Been awhile since I dined here.   iPad is left at the table for viewing drinks. I did not look at it.   Some bread and two flavored butters came with. We ordered the aged rib eye. ($58). Medium rare. Cooked perfectly throughout. I do fear that one edge was spoiled. However the seasoning was perfect. Enjoyed most of it tremendously. We also ordered the creamed spinach. Simply delightful.    Service was odd. Polite and engaging...yet distant. Waiter failed to mention the daily special.   A good steak.

0i4sTz9M31TFr7XEWp_2sw.text: Why 3 stars?? When I eat at somewhere like Fleming's and pay the prices that they ask, my expectations are higher than usual: I expect to be impressed. I have been to Fleming's restaurants several times over the years, although I think the last few visits have been to the Scottsdale location.   My wife and I came for a prime rib special. The set menu included the meat, two sides, and two desserts. We were able to get a reservation for 7pm, but ended up getting free earlier, so we stopped by to see if there were any walk-in tables available. It is worth noting that walk-ins are probably difficult to come by here: the dining room was booked solid until our reservation time. Curiously, though, the dining room was basically EMPTY. We were offered a seat on the patio, which was fine. We were told that we could sit in the bar. Sadly, the tiny bar was already full of people who knew how this works.  Service: I have to give props to the waitstaff. The people handling our table were great. Our water glasses were never less than half full, despite being on the patio and that requiring a special trip during the first part of our visit. We seemed to have come at a transition time for some of the staff, so we didn't start with him, but Casey was ultimately our waiter and he was great.  Meat: While not my favorite cut of meat, I have roasted several rib roasts and do enjoy it. I am accustomed to a more round than blade-shaped cut of prime rib, but you can carve a slice from different places on the roast, and they will have different shapes. We ordered the steaks medium, and they came out a bit more brown (well) than mauve (medium). I know, I know: medium rare is the way to eat prime rib and how we usually cook it at home. Out, though, I've had too many experiences where that comes out still bleeding, so I asked for something a little more "done" this time. It was not worth complaining about, since it was pretty close and I don't like wasting food. I chalked it up to learning how Fleming's interprets doneness for prime rib. The meat came with three sauces for dipping the meat into: a creamy horseradish, an au jus, and a third one that had a bit of vinegar and spice to it. That was nice.  Sides: We had the Fleming's potatoes and the grilled asparagus. The asparagus was cooked well, but some of the stalks still had the hard part on the ends -- you know, the part that you usually snap off before cooking? It is still asparagus, but I would expect a little more care from a high-end place like Fleming's. The potatoes that impressed us so much last time were a little flat this time. They were creamy and good, but not amazing.  Dessert: My wife had the cheesecake and I had the creme brulee. The second was by far the star of the show. Unless there is a reason you can't have it, get that one. Seriously. I guess the molten chocolate cake is popular as well, but I'll take custard over cake just about any day. My wife said the cheesecake was nothing special and that I had definitely made the better choice.   I generally like Fleming's enough to give it 4 stars, and, overall, the meal was fine, but it wasn't spectacular as I feel it should have been at a place like this. According to the other reviews, I apparently need to order the filet. For me on this visit, though, the Yelp 3-stars = "A-OK"

-Ubnhcm1vFTST0uc8Ri6AQ.text: One of our favorite places.  Very special anniversary treatment, fine prime rib and excellently designed seasonal specials.    The hot lava cake is my wife's favorite and I even enjoy it a little too. Service is exceptional and  I highly recommend it for anniversary's weddings or any occasion you can muster up to celebrate.

TPNeaWtlmwk-1uN40TZsAw.text: I came because AMEX gave me a $40 gift card, but I stayed because I was totes hungry.  It was very fancy, from the moment I sashayed my pretty little self in, to the time I was escorted to my white linened table, with their newfangled iPad wine and dessert list.  The parmesan crusty loaf was accompanied by both a feta and sundried tomato spreads, but I like Firebird's bolero loaf better.  The water tasted chlorinated though.  I could understand maybe bleach, ya know, for whiter teeth  Once again, I chose the wrong venue to sport my lederhosen and ICP mesh half shirt.  This place was popping, at 9:30pm.  It's nice to see the older generation still having date nights... with what appears to be their granddaughters.  :/  My waitress, Megan was an old soul and classy delight.  I am nearly transported to the days of old Hollywood, when people had nannies and rode elevators.  This is surely out of my element, but tonight, I'm self medicating, without the alcohol or Mexican quaaludes.  The bone in ribeye was near sheer perfection, with a taste that eschewed my typical topping of gefilte fish with cream.  The Thai green beans were a lil spicy, and a lot of fun.  And I'm pretty sure my Spidey senses were tingling thanks to some green Chile in the taters.  You know... PO-TA-TOES... boil em, mash em, stick em in a stew

GtVbtUZQd81aMaQUtE9Tjg.text: My wife and I were in town for a family wedding and decided to look for a steakhouse during our visit. We originally were looking for a local restaurant or one not available to us in our local area. We did not have much luck between closed(11/26/18 - Monday night) or not very good reviews so we drove to Fleming's. I will have preface that I dined at a location in LA several years ago with my mother and was disappointed and have never returned. On with our dining experience. We were greeted warmly and seated promptly. (again a Monday night). We were equally warmly greeted by our server, Zoe. We were given ample time to review the both the wine/cocktail menu and the food menu. Zoe went over our options and we placed our orders. We ordered salads to start, Caesar and the Wedge and both were very nice and served promptly. My wife ordered the petite filet med rare and I ordered the bone in ribeye, also med rare. My wife's ordered was cooked perfectly and both entres came out timely EXCEPT that I was brought the incorrect ribeye, boneless. I politely pointed out the error....from there we were both amazed at the response and treatment we received. Zoe quickly corrected the oversight(after rechecking her notes) and the correct ribeye was out quickly and cooked to perfection. Zoe and the mgr both apologized though I did not complain only pointed out that it was the incorrect steak. No fuss....Marc Flatley was the mgr on duty and also bought a round of the wine that we were drinking which was much appreciated though not expected. Fleming's also brought out an additional side with my steak. We were quite content with the amount of food we had! We enjoyed an exceptional meal and will put Fleming's back on my rotation of steakhouses. We both truly appreciate both Marc and Zoe going above and beyond for us. If you are in Chandler I highly recommend them as your choice when looking for a steakhouse for both service and dining experience...Ask for Zoe's station!!!

GHXyhxumlhnM5oqqthkILA.text: Great food, excellent staff and classy yet relaxed ambiance. Location was also perfect for a nearby date night with the hubby.

5c5SuuHU-oejKrjCWDmyhw.text: My husband brought me to Flemings on my birthday. The staff were lovely, all wishing me a 'Happy Birthday' which was a nice touch. The food itself was great. I found a lovely wine on their great wine list and my husband went with a wine recommended by the server which he enjoyed. We both had steak which was cooked as requested and to perfection. If I was to be picky, I would say the side dish of fries I had did not justify the $10 price charge. For dessert I had cheesecake which is the best I've had in a long, long time. Again the staff recognised my birthday and the cheesecake had a candle on it. When we were paying the bill I was given a lovely box of truffles and a gift voucher. Yes, it is expensive but if you have an event you are celebrating they do go that extra yard to make it a memorable occasion for you :-)

2Lv9zzvC-VYSlqkWj-haHg.text: We've previously dined here before and had a great time but I guess they've gone downhill since then (or at least this location). There's no valet :( we waited a few min before we were sat at a booth, we let our server know we would need a steak to go and she advised us to order it after we get out meal.We started out with the carpaccio and pork belly, the carpaccio is still the best in town but the pork was dry and underwhelming at best. The salads followed we had the Caesar (great flavor) and Flemings (very bland). This is where the bad starts my husbands NY strip was cooked properly but mine and my friends were not I ordered med rare ( I received med well) my friend ordered med (got med rare) I sent mine back, the server was not happy with that. After 15 min I got my new steak done right, at this point the rest of the table were finished eating so we ordered dessert and reminded our server we wanted a meal to go and our check because we had to leave soon. She seemed very busy and I had to flag down another server to pay our bill, after 25-30 min we finally had our meal and could leave. Bottom line I think next time we want a good steak we'll go to the Scottsdale location or City Hall!

U0q_U6fw1_cp7rXRQf6-zA.text: Outstanding!  Service and the filet mignon and lobster and potatoes were heavenly.  The french onion soup was superior!  All in all, the meal was the best experience we have had in the Valley.  Bravo!

7bM6IJBGSoxgwhjKrMFlFw.text: My wife and I have heard a couple times that Fleming's has a really good happy hour, and since we recently moved into the vicinity, we thought we'd give it a try at about 530 on a Saturday afternoon.  Our visit lasted exactly 5 minutes.  That was long enough to have a seat at the bar and have the snobby bartender treat us like lepers for deigning to ask questions about the specials.  Judging by his terse and unhelpful answers, you're either in their little Happy Hour club and already have the options memorized, or you're out, so don't bother him.    I don't know if the bartender is trying to apply the Jehovah's Witness Heaven Limit to the number of people allowed to enjoy Fleming's Happy Hour, or if he was annoyed that he couldn't carry on an uninterrupted conversation with a coworker about scheduling work hours, or if he's just a knob, but we were interested in having a nice little time out, not cracking some bartender-induced secret code of Happy Hour enlightenment, so we got up and left.  We went across the lot to another restaurant and were treated to friendly service, great food, and good drinks, at a real Happy Hour with happy people.

0RkKqfq1W8v5h_41S699vA.text: Flemings can be a homerun restaurant or it can be in a slump.  Tonight was a slump.  Prime Rib was fine.  Potatoes were okay.  Asparagus was below average.  Bread was slightly dry and tasteless.  Creme Bruelle was great, but the berries looked worn out.  Had a reservation for a booth....younger manager placed us at a table in the middle of the restaurant since it was first come, first serve for seating according to him.  We were puzzled.  There were lots of tables along the walls, but we got the table in the center.  It was loud.  With that being said, I think eating a 5 pm is a good idea if you need a booth for privacy and quietness.  Next, do not eat their specials.  They are average.  Order off the main menu.  Last, the Chocolate Volcano cake is average.  It is not worth the extra time or money.  If in doubt about where you are seated, get up and leave.  We will do that next time.  Why make a reservation if the requests are ignored?  Tonight was an average meal at a noisy restaurant.  I can get that at Outback for less money and their quality is often better than Flemings!

bYJFMNousFiKbQEbGbfD9w.text: I agree with David M and Ada G. regarding the service in the bar. If you go here, do not dine in the bar. The hostess might tell you its full service at the bar but the service at the bar is noticeably lacking. If you have a choice between waiting for a table and eating at the bar, eat at the table.  We were rushed, not all of our food was packed to go, water not refilled without asking (and waiter never apologized for failing to refill drinks), steak knives were not brought with the food, bread was not brought out without asking, had to ask for refill on wine (since when has a waiter not asked for refill on alcoholic drinks)...all of the usual amenities that are provided at table service was severely lacking at the bar.  The other aspect that annoyed me was that I asked for fried onion strings or straws on my steak and asked if they could prepare it. The server immediately got defensive and acted as if I was asking  foie gras on the side. Instead of simply responding with "It shouldn't be a problem, I'll see what we can do" His response was remniscient of a server at Applebees "Well since we don't offer that item on the menu, I just don't know if they can make that" Seriously, was I dining at Black Angus? It's called common sense, I can understand that response if I was asking for something other than fried onion strings. Very amateur to say the least!  The food itself is amazing at this location. They reall cook steaks well and if you order a medium, it comes perfectly cooked with mostly pink inside and just a little charred on the outside. It's one of the few places that really understand what a medium steak is and they don't overcook it like most places.  I like their steaks better than many more well known places including Donovans and Ruth Chris.  The service needs to improve even at the tables. You don't receive that royal treatment like you do at other upscale steak restaurants including Ruth Chris, Donovan's etc. I can understand that type of service if I'm dining at Outback Steakhouse but we just spent $167 for two and were formally and professionally dressed yet we were rushed as if we were eating at Chipotle during lunch rush hour.  The service needs to improve especially for a fine dining establishment. The basics like refilling drinks, smiling, addressing people as sir/mam, apologizing if items are forgotten are basic elements of good service at a fine dining restaurant yet it was lacking here. If you want an example of great service, go to Durants

u867rk6PicQNMp9c1zjapg.text: This was the second time I've been to Fleming's. Both times have been very enjoyable. This time, a friend told me about a bar special called 5 for 6 'til 7. It is five menu items (mixed drinks, wine, appetisers, etc. for $6 until 7 P.M.). You can still order off the menu, but the specials are only available in the bar, and tables are available in the bar area. Everything we ordered was excellent. I had the steak sandwich (another bar special), which was terrific. If you are a wine drinker, don't go to Fleming's if you are thirsty. The amount of wine they serve (a friend ordered a glass of Merlot) for $6 is ridiculous. They bring a huge glass for the wine, and a little carafe of wine, barely enough to wet the inside of the glass. Stick with the mixed drinks or beer. For you beer drinkers, beer is only available in bottles. No beer on tap, which is a shame for a restaurant of this caliber. Hopefully, when the economy improves, Fleming's will continue with some kind of specials, like the 5 for 6 'til 7.

TXE384-8A9t8ERWefHCLQA.text: My husband and I ate here for our anniversary.  We had the peppercorn steak, Flemings Potatoes, and a salad.  The food was good but not great. I think we could have split the steak and potatoes and ordered our own salad. We also had two beers and one drink. I ordered a cheesecake to go and they forgot the sauce that went with the cheesecake.  Our bill came to $133.00. Now I'm not sure what part of that experience was worth what we paid. There wasn't anything about the food or the experience that was that spectacular.

5i0YdD1Rm57j-j_bqLKthg.text: Excellent resturant. Fabulous steaks.  Great service. Good wine selection.  Excellent place to celebrate an important event.  Every time I've been here the service has been excellent.  The atmosphere is formal, but not stuffy.

3xtk7S-UKkYWbnUVihmJvg.text: Love their Beef Flemington, good poor on wine, good wine selection, good martini's.  Great place to go.

o0ytKXRT7hbqUVsId2N8Ug.text: I went here as part of a business dinner and thoroughly enjoyed myself.  The service was excellent; professional and attentive, without being stuffy or pretentious.  The appetizers, salads, and sides were above average in taste and presentation.  Now, the filet mignon was the highlight of the evening.  The steak was cooked to medium-rare perfection.  If you enjoy a good steak paired with an excellent wine (they have a huge wine list), you should definitely give Fleming's a try.  I'm an out of towner who travels frequently to Chandler and this restaurant tops my list.

rLncDpfENw6tWWndpmW60g.text: Consistently good and constantly packed chain. As usual a little noisy but nice atmosphere if you like a higher energy feel. Had the clam chowder at 13.95 a bowl with a ton of the bread, which is served with 2 great flavored butters (cheesy). Chowder was was very good, not overly rich with cream like some places. Had the 12 oz filet medium rare with the fleming potatoes (yum!), Brussel sprouts, and some shoestring potatoes (very crispy).Everything was great, with the steak done perfectly.Of course at these prices you should expect that. I have had the chocolate lava dessert before, but this time shared the carrot cake for dessert, both are excellent. Another nice prime steak dining experience.

azWSgN8tKH_fp2mpp3FUpQ.text: My wife and I like this place. A lot.  Most people know about their happy hour, it is one of the best around.  Make sure you get on their email list. Some of their "off menu" specials are a good excuse to have a fun night out.  Friendly service and really good food and wine. This place is always a good choice for dinner. Steak, lobster, scallops, cooked to perfection or they will certainly make it right.  Cheers!

0LbxtaNcxJgnEznM6XjN5Q.text: Amazing from start to finish. It is very pricey but you truly get what you pay for, delectable and delicious. Great service, food, and wine.

YyFUossEF4DcNB1gIrL-OQ.text: This is somewhere I'd go maybe once or twice a year for a special occasion. The price runs, but you get what you pay for. This place is known for steaks and it does not disappoint. The appetizers and sides come in decent sizes as well. Their bread served with two different cheeses is delicious. When your food comes out, it's literally still cooking from the plate, which is great- shows that it's fresh. I would say to order your meat one above what you would usually - so instead of medium rare, get a medium. I get bad to send my steak back, but they did it without a hassle and were so kind. Bottom line up front, the steak is always fresh (juicy and flavorful), pricey, but worth it.

eTrfj7OQBaXDwmIOmvRERQ.text: My husband and I like to eat dinner early so Flemings happy hour is perfect for us. Our favorite was the pork belly, happy hour price was around 7$. Tonight we decided to drop in there again. We were told they didn't have the pork belly but it was replaced with bacon. So we said great! Bring us one. I stupidly thought it would be priced in the same realm. Nope, 17 bucks. I find that super annoying. I mean the food was good but really? 17$ for three pieces of bacon? It was clear we were there for happy hour, were looking at the happy hour menu. Seems to me something should have been said. I will not be back. The Keg is much better anyway.

BjP_-V2-oe6P9DfUY7dxRA.text: While the steak was amazing it was my least favorite part of the meal. The cold seafood starter was the best I've had in Arizona. The salad and sides were so delicious I couldn't stop eating them even after I was full. Wine and champagne were the best I've had.   But who am I kidding. Lava. Cake. I would go back just for dessert. We had to fight for the last gooey bite!  The staff is high end, attentive, professional, and polite.

f_r1W-sDQgAag0qi6atmhA.text: Marginal food for very high prices. The fillet had a lot of fat in the bone in ribeye did not have much flavor and was tough. It's not right to charge top prices and deliver such mediocre food. That's the last time Flemings is going to rip me off. Call Dobbs to her tail looked like the size of a crawdad. They are living on their old reputation and I can't pack a couple of times lately hoping for what that restaurant once was.

UG4eLmnwNnVQfhm9rJ6eiw.text: I came here recently for a special occasion dinner with my office staff and it was very nice.  The restaurant itself is well designed, with muted colors, dark woods and dimmed lighting.  The wait staff was neatly presented in crisp white shirts and clean, black service aprons.  We prearranged for a pre-printed dinner menu that was labeled as being for our party that night.  I thought that it was a nice touch, and I am well aware that it was also a clever cost containment measure since it also kept our staff from wildly ordering off of the regular Fleming's menu.  Our servers were all very gracious and attentive and took very good care of our party of about 25.  Our food was all brought out at the same time, which was no small feat on the kitchen's part.  Everyone seemed genuinely happy with their food, I didn't see anyone complaining about anything.    I ordered the petite filet, medium rare, and it was absolutely perfect in every way.  The meat was cooked perfectly and was tender, moist and delicious.  There were various sides served 'family style' raging from buttered corn to asparagus, and they were all very good as well.  As a dessert I ordered creme brulee, and it was deliciously creamy with the perfectly sugar crust on top.  My only complaint about my food, and it is minor, was that the creme brulee wasn't the ice cold temperature that I usually prefer.  I like my creme brulee pre-fired so that it has time to cool off before I eat it.  I don't care for warm custard, but it's purely a personal preference and I still thought the dessert was fantastic.  The only other thing I would point out is that many people aren't fans of the a la carte menu system, it can be annoying, and ridiculously expensive, to order every side dish seperately from the main entree.     That said, this was still a great experience in a wonderful restaurant.  I highly recommend it for any special occasion dinner as long as your budget will allow it.

4Yw7MLCin2fVSAAZOSUgAg.text: Would love to give this place a better rating, but the initial prime rib both my wife and I received was something a Sizzler would be embarrassed to serve. It was incredibly stringy and tough to the point of being impossible to eat. To their credit, once I complained they brought out two new cuts that were very good. Cooked perfectly and tender although under-seasoned. But it made me wonder about how those initial cuts could get through the quality control process. I mean, they were ridiculously awful.  I thought about it being the $29 prime rib special and that's what they give people and then hope they don't complain, but I don't think they would play with their reputation like that. On the plus side, the Flemings potatoes, bread, salad and cheesecake were awesome, but it's time we try a different steakhouse.

vy9wKLlRRrF2D_4Oo3xW7Q.text: 09/01/10  My first, and (so far) only, visit to Fleming's.  I give it 2.5 stars...  First thing I noticed was that it was very dark inside- a pet peeve of mine.  Second, the service looked either harried or aloof.  Where were the smiling faces?  It was 4:15 pm, which meant the doors had just opened 15 minutes ago, and there weren't many guests yet waiting to be seated.  (There were about eight people at the bar area.)  I soon met my server, whose cold gaze and unsmiling face already had me thinking maybe this place was not such a good idea.    After studying the menu, I decided I'd try the Prime Burger for $6. I also asked if I could sample a couple of red wines before ordering a glass of one.  I've been to many venues where this is not a problem, and sometimes, when I can't decide, even willingly offered!  This Fleming's location isn't one of these venues.  My query brought about a more negative change of attitude from my server, but I did get to try two very small samples before choosing a glass.  While I waited for the burger to arrive, I began to boot up my laptop- thank goodness I brought it, bec. the burger took a long time...  The bar area was filling up fast, and the servers started to look even more agitated that I was starting to wonder what was all the fuss?  Finally, just under 20 minutes later, my beautiful burger arrived.  Huge patty, smothered w/ cheese and topped w/ thick-cut, peppered, and smoked bacon, tomato, onion, lettuce, and a pretzel bun.  The one huge onion ring was a nice touch.  The burger was juicy (cooked to my specified medium), quite substantial, and delicious w/ the cheddar, veggies, and bun.  The thick-cut bacon, however, was so salty, that I had to take the slices off!  I was a bit disappointed, since it was such a hearty portion of bacon.  I wouldn't mind having another Prime burger, minus the bacon, for happy hour again, but I'd choose another location.   BTW, as I was enjoying the burger, I finally figured out why all the harried faces and the servers' hustle and bustle-- it seemed like everyone in the bar area had chosen the burger!  The table of six in front of me all had burgers... At $6, it's a steal for diners, but perhaps not expensive enough to garner a nice tip?  Hmm... well, not if the servers' attitudes continue to be cold and distant!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. HH burger.

N0IveTl1xuRNl8rTJim5eQ.text: My husband and I just left! We had high hopes but the service was so poor! We were there for an hour, sat outside, which we actually liked but the waiter dropped our drinks and appetizers off and never returned! While we did tell him we were thinking of just drinks and appetizers, we would have considered dinner, had he upsold. But we never had a chance considering he never came back to ask if we wanted another wine or beer...very unwelcoming and we felt like we were a nuisance after a table of 6 were sat just beside us. My husband had to go to the hostess station to ask for a check. Considering the average prices for dinner at Flemings, I would expect better service. We have had beyond better service at local places as well as high priced. Texas Star in San Diego comes to my mind.

wEO4rM05qBCtiXmv4XEELg.text: If you're looking for that ultimate Fleming's experience you've saved up months for - don't bother coming to this location. Please make the drive up to Scottsdale where the standard seems to be a lot higher than here.   It's pretty packed during Happy Hour but because of that, I get the feeling that the servers in the bar and patio area know they're getting shafted with probably lower than expected tips thus, lower customer service. I sat on the patio for dinner and was not expecting to spend my night constantly waving at the server like I was at dim sum - not here of all places.   Food is great and pretty much on par with other locations, but the service here is like nails on a chalkboard. We sat on the patio and if you order anything other than water, don't expect the server to come by and give you another refill. It's best you measure out your sips for the rest of your dinner. In the time it took to get another beer, you would have sworn they were self-brewing in the kitchen because that's how long it took. Asked for bread service but it never came, even after our entrees came and we asked a third time. What was pretty irritating was that all the other parties who sat down after us in the same area were getting great service, refills, bread, etc. They were all bigger parties and ordering wine glass after wine, so I had a guess as to why he would baby their tables and not ours. Regardless, never in my wildest dreams did I think that my childhood dream of being invisible would come True, but this server definitely made sure of it. Not as exciting as I thought it would be.   We told the manager what was going on and all he could say was that our server had 7 years of experience and was amazing at what he did. If only I had a manager that could say such amazing things about me while I ignored all my responsibilities at work and watched YouTube all day. The manager offered us free dessert, but it didn't really matter to me especially since I did not come for dessert. I came for the upscale ambiance and opportunity to wow the company I was with. I thought I was at Fleming's and left feeling like I was at Chili's.

2s0GJFuDTFpfikC8EAeqeA.text: My husband and I went to Flemings for our annual Valentines dinner. When we arrived we discovered that our reservation had been mysteriously lost! Overhearing our conversation, Gigi took over and immediately seated us, apologizing for the lost reservation. She is always so welcoming and friendly! She seems to be there every time we dine at Flemings. What a rare find Flemings has in her. She knows customer service and she uses it! Krista our server was incredible! Very friendly and engaging. The service we received was some of the best ever. Krista really seems to love what she is doing and it certainly shows. Everything was served with the right amount of time in between, never a long wait. And of course the food is incomparable and cooked to perfection.  Towards the end of the meal, Operating Partner Mr. Jeffrey stopped by the table to offer his apologies for our lost reservation. My heartfelt thanks to all the above mentioned names for making what could have been a disaster into another incredible meal at an incredible restaurant, Flemings!

HHJh1Rzex3K52ShCYTYEeg.text: I will say this place was awesome. Wait staff was great very friendly. Wished my wife and I a happy 21st anniversary and all. Food was like no other. I had a certified angus prime rib which was out of this world . I would recommend this to anyone who is into great steaks. The appetizer was bacon cover in maple syrup and Jack Daniels which again was awesome. Don't just take my word for it go and try it out you will not be disappointed.

lTw0jy-O_gaYT5nk42pFDw.text: Came here from out of state with my best friend for our birthday. Everything was wonderful. Made a reservation online. Once we arrived we were seated immediately. My filet mignon was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and my best friend was very happy with her seared ahi. Sides are for the table and we chose the mac and cheese & brussel sprouts. They were amazing. We finished off with the creme brulee and the chocolate lava cake. The manager came by to check on us (unsolicited)... he offered us a sample of dessert wine along with our desserts. Overall everything was amazing. Our server Byron. He was great.
