o2QTmFcOQxPJvZLSPhLWIw.text: Had reservations for 8. Guess what..no table ready till 8:15.  Got stuck in Coffin corner. Girl friends steak came out raw..she wanted medium.  Bummer. Waiter was okay but I expected a more low key guy considering the venue. Pains me to say it was a disappointment.

Q2-D0e-e_aNlwFRMZJoEqg.text: The restaurant has the wine cellar appearance with red chairs and mahogany wood everywhere.  There are even pictures of wine bottles hanging on the wall.  It gives off a classy and elegant feel without being too pretentious.    The bread that was given at the beginning was average.  Hard on the outside and soft on the inside.  It was the butter that was taken me by surprise.  There was a chiptole butter and also a sour cream butter.  The chiptole butter was the best.    I chose a Chilean sea bass with sauteed spinach.  It was a flakey and stringy texture as a great bass would have.  The bread crumbs on top added a nice crunchy texture for contrast.  It was a fresh fish which didn't have a fishy taste, but not as good of a taste as expected.  My friend had the filet mignon with crab on top and scallops on the side.  The scallops were the best.  Not too bouncy and cooked just right.  The crab has a mediocre taste.  Something common like it can be made at home.  The filet is tender deep red meat and not that flavorful because of the lack of fat.  And again, it was average.  The dessert was the best part of the meal.  The chocolate lava cake with REAL whipped cream.   The warm rich chocolate center with vanilla ice cream and pistachio on top added to the whole cake.    Overall the food was pretty good, but the value isn't.  For as much as it costs, I would be expecting something better.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. I would come to Fleming&#39;s just for this chocolate goodness.  :-)  Best part of the meal
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Surf and Turf

Jz42q18dbiqIytFJ36y6xQ.text: Brandon is AWESOME!! He is a great bartender who knows how to balance the servers, the bar guest, and be inviting all at the same time. Best of all:he is truthful!!! Who doesn't hate those bartenders/servers that sell you on terrible products just because they are more expensive?   Now let's talk about the food. Always cooked to order and promptly served. You never get the feeling that YOU, the guest, are bothering the staff. Maybe that is just at the bar, but hopefully it extends to the whole restaurant!!! They have a fantastic happy hour from 5-7, then have ANOTHER one from 8-10!!!! The second is a little more expensive but sooo worth it!!! I will continue to dine and suggest other do the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime burger with bleu cheese and fries. Glass of Rioja wine

UMj8imNg0V355NJPHZkpaQ.text: First review I've decided to write for a restaurant so far, but felt I had to after reading dozens of reviews prior to coming in, with certain expectations that were not met, and feeling that I wish someone had written what I'm going to write.   To start off, I'd like to come out and say we did not make it past a round of drinks here. This review is strictly related to the "experience", or in our case, lack there-of. We left after 30+ minutes, in large part due to the large gaps in time between the server coming back to check on us.  Our unfortunate experience was rather short, so I'll try to keep it to the point. It was the wife and I's 4 year anniversary. I made same-day reservations for a Friday night (9/5) at 7:15. We pulled up and used the valet out-front, which was nice. We walked in and were seated within a few minutes. So far, so good. We were seated at a 4-top in the middle of what I can only describe as a cattle yard. Everyone seemed so close together, with booths surrounding the room, apparently the only good seats in the house. The wife likes to sit next to me, so I thought I'd ask to switch. Upon getting up to request a booth, I was told they had already sat it... Oddly enough, said booth wasn't sat for another minute or two after I had returned to my seat. Not a big deal, as the experience I was hoping for could easily make up for it.   I returned to my seat in time to greet our server (40+ yo woman) who had only been there briefly. Rather than offering her name, all she said was "Cocktails?!". My wife said she was interested in a glass of wine, and asked for a possible suggestion. The server handed her an iPad to look through instead of, ya know, imparting knowledge that a seasoned server should do at a "fine dining" establishment. We told her we'd need a few minutes to look through the cocktail list, and upon her return she then asked us if we're interested in hearing the specials for the night. I wanted to cut off her butchered attempt at telling us the features, but didn't have the heart to do so.  Their beer/wine menu does not allow one to discern if the beer is draft or bottled. So, while I did not ask, I was not told how the beer I ordered would come, but at least my $7 bottled beer was delivered with a glass. My wife ordered a glass of wine, and at that point, I handed the server my card when she asked if we'd like to start with any appetizers. Clearly knowing something was wrong, she bleakly stated, "Oh, just the drinks? But it's your anniversary! I hope it's not something we did." and walked away.  The way she said it, she clearly could not care less and seemed glad for us to be leaving. I'm under 30, so maybe she assumed we were cheap. Both my wife and I have worked before in the restaurant industry for a combined 12+ years. We left a 50% tip to dismiss any conclusion on their part that we are "cheap."  While I am sure the food is great, as that's all the other reviews seem to cover, if you are looking for an intimate restaurant to visit with your significant other and are looking for a level of service that is on par with the price, then dine elsewhere. I personally am not willing to pay $50+ for a steak and $10 for a baked potato if the level of service I receive is that of a 2am visit to Denny's. I've only been in AZ a year, so perhaps the bar is much lower here for fine dining than it is in Seattle (El Gaucho, Palisades, Canlis, Daniel's Broiler, Salty's, etc).   Very discouraging visit for our first time. We won't be back.

nYe_eiSSTVYaSy0aCTAmjw.text: The happy hour is great - $6 apps/drinks but the bar area is tiny and can't hold more than 15-20 people.  As a result it fills up right away.  Get there early if going for happy hour.  For the dining room the food is great.  The steaks and prime rib are great.  The prime rib special on Sundays is an especially good deal.  You get a salad, prime rib, a side, and a dessert for $39.95.

C0Ir_cycG44cZ4bmhM_vAg.text: Large group rented the whole restaurant for that I'll give them some credit which can be tough. Very unaccommodating with small children, didn't serve until last, although we asked for first as the kids were falling asleep. Steaks were served blue. Was disappointing for Flemming's which usually I love.

UjdYPOoZVPlSgNPFrfTRkw.text: I've been here several times for dinners. Work related and romantic. It's suddenly much brighter in there. I personally preferred the dim lit ambience but it really comes down to the food. Excellent filet, delicious ribeyes, the seafood isn't bad. It's not the very best but it's certainly worth ordering. Wine & champagne list is great and I've never had a single complaint about the staff. Great location off the I-10 with plenty of surrounding places to make the drive worth it. I will continue to go here without a doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

VHjfUml0C739rIHHwyo4xg.text: Once again my wife and I made our annual pilgrimage to Flemings for our anniversary. This place is upscale and pricy, so we only go here for this special occasion. The food here is extraordinary. Why else would we go to a dimly lit high priced restaurant? We had reservations for 5:30 on a Sunday. We usually go on Sundays because that is when they have prime rib, (my favorite).   I started my meal with the French onion soup. The soup has bold beefy broth loaded with onions topped with melted gruyere and parmesan cheeses. Piping hot and gooey, the cheese compliments the onion soup well. Next I was served a salad of my choice. I tried the new wedge salad for the first time. This will be my standard choice in the future. The head of lettuce was quartered into a wedge hence the name new wedge. The salad was topped with slab-cut bacon, blistered tomatoes, crumbled gorgonzola, pickled red onion, toasted pepitas, danish blue cheese dressing. The salad was crisp and creamy, tart and tangy all in the same bite.  The main course I chose was the prime rib dinner with a side of Fleming potatoes. The Fleming potatoes are a perfect side to go the prime rib. Potatoes made with cream, jalapenos and cheddar cheese baked to perfection into a loaf. The creamy slightly spicy flavor compliments the salty savory flavor of the prime rib and any of the 3 accompanying sauces.  The highlight of the meal was of course the prime rib. Cooked to medium rare and served with a trio of sauces, au-jus, drawn butter, and horseradish sauce. The outside was crusted with cracked pepper. It was a generous cut of meat. I was only able to eat half. I wanted to save room for dessert so I had the other half boxed to go.  Dessert was walnut turtle pie consisting of homemade caramel, walnuts and chocolate baked in a chocolate pie crust. This dessert is rich and decadent, the perfect finale to a great meal.  Because it was our anniversary and we stated so on our reservation we received a $25.00 Flemings gift card which we put toward our bill. We still paid a lot for the meal, but it is worth it for the quality of the dining experience. Flemings will continue to be our anniversary tradition for years to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime rib dinner.

x8Jep5ksDqxrXHt4QdkjWA.text: Service was good. The dining room only had 3 tables when we were there. But for a high end restaurant. A steak should not come out burnt if someone orders it MED RARE. They need some work in the kitchen. $100 for a burnt crusted steak.

afSY9vTjRvo2F1G28mFRQw.text: Food was decent but way over priced.  Spent $500 for 5 of us no alcohol! Not close to a 4/5 star experience but they charge like it.  Steak and sides are decent but nothing wow!! Again way over priced

mFAcXvJWqPtS6wxCbQL30Q.text: We had a dozen people come in for a recognition event tonight.  The staff was on point attending to everyone's needs, which is tough when you don't all arrive at the same time.  I ordered a filet mignon medium rare with lobster tail.  When it came out, the filet was more on the medium side, I presume because they tried to time all entrees arriving at the table at the same time.   The table had several sides, including Brussel sprouts (amazing!), asparagus (perfectly cooked), Mac and cheese (very nice), and the Fleming's potatoes (wonderful!).   The creek brulee desert was astounding!

33UQiirXPIg3dZTubajO5w.text: The food is wonderful no doubt. What Fleming's excels at though, is service. If you want to be pampered like you're literally the QUEEN OF EVERYTHING, this is your happy place. In 10 minutes they'll have you saying "Splendid darling, just splendid!"

w0moC3RAGsEM2F6epyl3bg.text: Quite disappointed i must say, I'm visiting family this weekend and was told flemings is the place to go to as the  steak house and such. I guess that means that all they cook good is the steak because the $44 pork tomahawk was far from it. Dry, under unseasoned,  the server recommended that they butterfly it to be best cooked but it may had caused it to be dry, i kept adding salt and pepper to different parts of it, i my self dont eat salt as much. Honestly i felt ripped off and i wasnt the only one . My wife and company enjoyed their food aside from the salmon and chicken, but for the $ we spent there and the expectation of an awesome and delicious meal was far from it. I guess if I'm spending $44 for a dry and almost tasteless piece of meat is the norm. For this being my first time and it being so hyped up it fell far from it, the one thing i did enjoy was the cold beer and tasty dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

nHJJ04BBejrmTx_hxLC33g.text: This is the perfect example of an upscale steakhouse. Amazing service, amazing meats and seafood cooked exactly the way you like It, huge sides to share for the table, and desserts that are impossible not to make room for.   Fleming's has always been a go to for special occasions of any kind and they are sure to make you leave feeling special.   Pricey? Yes. Worth It? Yes.

3c1ohGJ0n58qMANkylkb3w.text: Horrible! Starting with the good, our server. Now on to the food. I had the burger... the bread was so dry and stale I would have thrown it out if it was in my home. The burger was small and overwhelmed by the stale bread. The french fries were over-cooked.  My wife's prime had good flavor but came under cooked, rare to medium rare, when she asked for medium. Finally on to the mixed drinks. I am not sure if any alcohol was put in mine. My wife's was fine. Inconsistent I would say. Sorry for the bad review Fleming's. We won't be back.

CyLF3d7QKhC4WJjitKWKxA.text: My wife and I had a very nice meal. We both had the lobster/filet combo with Fleming's potatoes. The steaks were prepared to perfection and the potatoes were scrumptious. The lobster was however a bit salty but that didn't take away from a great meal. We both started out with salads and for desert I had the hot lava cake and she had creme brulee.  The service was excellent which added to a great evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

g9r6zxsiJhnEpuHoHwaU0A.text: Celebrated my brother in laws birthday and had a wonderful time! Amazing food! Excellent service from all. Yes, it's pricey and worth it. Perfect restaurant for a special night! Our party had a variety of dishes, sides and desserts and all were delicious!

3ET1oJluokzXktBBh9RYbQ.text: Fleming's has never been my favorite place to eat dinner, but I do love to go for their Five Six Seven menu in the lounge or on the patio. Though the prices have gone up over the years, it is still a decent deal for what it is. We started with the Blueberry Lemon Drop Martinis which were refreshing and tart with just a little sweetness. The calamari was good, but too much sauce made it soggier than preferred. We also tried the crab cakes, which to my surprise were some of the best I've had! The prime burger is always good, though the brioche bun and pepper bacon are what really shine through, and always get their onion rings (way better than their fries). Lastly my sister got the flatbread on the 567 menu. I didn't try it, but she said it was delicious. Only downfall besides the increased prices would be that the lighting is so dim in the bar are you can barely see the people sitting in front of you. Will be back for sure, but probably not anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime Burger with Onion Rings instead of Fries
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Crab Cakes

OSRipQz5X7HF-uyJx5Xxiw.text: First off let me say the food was fantastic and the service (for the most part) was too. Thomas was very attentive at first but for some reason my wine glass was empty for 11 minutes which is about 9 minutes longer than I would expect. I understand that the place was packed but if that means more servers to ensure consistent and timely service then so be it.

2TYiV3KuMtNRHPT60RjY5g.text: Great place for a midweek date - no special occasion, just enjoyed some great food and exceptional service.  I'm always happy with their petit filet  - it's always cooked to perfection - and I was super impressed with the mushroom risotto as a side.  My date got the pork chop and while the glaze was a tad sweet, the quality of the cut of chop was next level.  The only thing that sucked is having to get some of it boxed up so we had room for a piece of key lime pie.  Our server was so friendly and attentive and I only wish I would have gotten her name so I could shout her out here.  Definitely a spot I plan to visit again soon!

IuAAw5ESJGi5bJy1sAR4Sg.text: What a pleasant and attractive place with great food.  My wife and I have been here 4 or 5 times in the past couple of years and have always received great food and courteous service.  I can vouch for the quality and taste of their meat, fish and sides.  You get wonderful dishes, large portions, cooked perfectly, according to your instructions.  Not only do they make their meat and fish dishes to excel, but you can't improve on .the flavor or consistency of any of their side dishes, making the veggies sing and dance in your mouth and their desserts take a curtain call!  Add reasonable prices to it all and you will have a wonderful and memorable repast at Fleming's.  You can't miss and they won't either.

C_pDToPTvXX_MfN0VFoUEw.text: There's no consistency in the food quality. As an example last week I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and it was great. Today I ordered it and the cheese was soupy and very little lobster. Three waiter implied that is usually soupy but did say the metal serving dish is not always used. The bacon on the wedge salad and blue cheese is inconsistent as well. It's love to give this location 5 stars but it's got some work to do.

d2QaBITMUeAaOa8IXUZLdA.text: Came here tonight for mine and my wife's anniversary and it could not have been any better.  Brandon our waiter was amazing. Professional, courteous and so friendly.   The petite filet was so tender and flavorful and cooked perfect medium rare too. The NY strip special had three BBQ shrimp as well. Mojito and sangria for drinks, and then creme brulee for dessert.   It was a perfect evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. We were greeted with a personalized card for our anniversary. I had a mojito and my wife had an amazing sangria.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cremé Brûlée with fresh whipped cream and they gave us homemade truffles for our anniversary.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. The NY Strip. It was delicious

hC6DksHGW8R10AlvGTmsMQ.text: My fiance took me here for a mother's day present, and it was great! Service was awesome, and the manager Nick came over to check on us. After dinner we sat at the bar for a bit, the bartenders there are awesome!  Side note: get the Fleming's potatoes. Sometimes I dream about their deliciousness.

ozFs2_I0Cm2tbge9JBLxnQ.text: Recently went to Fleming's Tyson's Corner VA and it was excellent. So, thought I would do a date night with my husband. The chop salad was supposed to have root vegetables and Parmesan and it did not. My steak was ordered medium, but it was tough and overdone. The grand finale was watching the staff set up table settings, dropped a bread plate, knife and salad fork on the floor, picked it up and continued to finish dressing the table with the setting that dropped on the floor. Won't be back to this location. Disappointing.

QsGaGzv6vP5MgXjjS6ao-Q.text: We've been to this Fleming's before and have always enjoyed the steaks. Not sure if the holiday rush is getting to them but the medium rare steak looked more like tartar. Also both of the prime burger buns were burnt. Overall, the seasoning of the food was substandard. The highlight was the excellent wait staff. Special shout out to Eric who was attentive yet unobtrusive.  He made the experience special for an otherwise disappointing meal.

RUjDJfjw9D5W34_A05hTTw.text: Very interesting.  We've been to this Fleming's on several occasions, and tonight seemed to be a continuation of the progression downhill for this restaurant, in my opinion.  We decided to make this a family of four dinner, bringing our 10 and 12 year olds.  Obviously, we tried to stick with steak at this steak house.  We came at opening, about 5pm, arriving at 4:50.  They did have us wait until they were ready at 5pm, and that's okay.  The opening, though, plays a big part later in this review.  We stuck with water, as you can run up a really high bill very quickly.  Our orders were taken late (about 15 minute wait)  because we had not ordered drinks, and the waiters were busy brining out wine, etc, to the other tables.  The bread was fresh, but the butter was not.  It was dried out, like it had been frozen, and we were served the freezer burnt butter.  I asked for the Crab Cake appetizer to be brought out at the same time as everyone else's plate.  This was screwed up, and was brought out early.  So everyone else had to watch me eat.  I was having this as a "small plate" dish.  The boys had the specials, which were a petite filet mignon along with 3 scallops.  We asked for medium--they were undercooked, more along the lines of rare to medium-rare.  The scallops were well cooked, but a little bland.  The 10 year old did not like them, and he usually really enjoys seafood.  I added on the Chipotle Cheddar Macaroni and Cheese for the kids, which they liked, along with Half and Half, which is shoestring fries with Onion Rings, both tasted okay.  My wife had the Double Thick Pork Rib Chop.  The sauce was very tasty, BUT the pork was underdone, and was visibly raw in the middle.  This was unacceptable.  We had to send the plate back, which was put under the broiler, and then brought back to us.  I have to say this is the second time in a row that my wife's meat was raw at this Fleming's.  I would've chalked it up to oven not being hot enough for the first dishes, but this seems to be a recurrent problem.    I had a small plate, the Sliced Filet Mignon, which is served on Risotto.  The meat was very well done, but the risotto was completely dried out and tasteless. I was very disappointed.  As it took about another 10-15 minutes between when our plates were taken away and our waiter came with the dessert menu, we had decided to skip dessert and coffee and make our way to Starbucks, about two buildings away.  I'm willing to forgive the delays due to them just opening up.  Plus, it was Veteran's Day.  However, the food being underprepared for the second time in a row is unforgivable, especially for as expensive a restaurant as Fleming's is.  This is really starting to feel like a "chain" restaurant as it really is rather than an exclusive steak restaurant, which they strive to be.  Overall, I think we're done with Fleming's.

w30zZrVPDVpUWnxVhfzFgA.text: This place is so yummy! The spreads they serve with the asiago bread is to die for! I had a ribeye special with shrimp and scallops and it was delicious! I recommend the blue cheese mashed potatoes as a side! It's very pricey... But if you are looking for a nice dinner out I highly recommend this!

Tfhb5_UxnkNFArsjhm0Nbg.text: Just ate the tuna tacos: this is a $10 plate of chips & salsa - a very very oniony salsa. My wife won't even kiss me now my mouth tastes like an onion. The "tacos" fell apart in the first bite. In past visits I've left feeling violated, like my mouth was forcefully overstimulated. My stomach vomitus with over seasoning. Lastly, no draft beer. Seriously?! Not everyone wants a $30 glass of Cabernet. Some of us like beer, and bottles just don't taste the same. Shame on you Flemings ~ I'm over your overpriced meat, over flavored dishes and over confident menu. You are off point.

4Fstkrq4bAEDboOE_H9rSQ.text: I was there last weekend with my husband we didn't have reservations they told us there were heaters on the back patio which there was, unfortunately I still froze my butt off (not that it's their fault ) but it was uncomfortable throughout the meal . Also, no one noticed us after 10 minutes to ask if we wanted anything to drink... This is going to sound silly, but an appetizer said pork belly fried appetizer served with cranberry sauce, needless to say I didn't realize that was pure fat on a plate ( most places don't serve pure lard on a plate for a snack)  and I told the waiter that it was not to my liking and he seem to be disgusted by it. This place for the amount of money you pay, I am surprised by the crappy customer service and the food was nothing to brag about. I guess I'll have to make a trip back to Cali for some good food!!!!

ZlW_MRsrwt5d27O1T099Iw.text: After my last review Fleming's manager, Miguel, gave me a phone call expressing his apologies for our less than stellar experience and invited me to come back.  I was a bit shocked by the phone call but also very grateful.  Fleming's obviously takes their customer satisfaction very seriously and it made mew feel good knowing that time was taken to care about how I was feeling.   Words cannot express how amazing our revisit was.  Linda's service was impeccable and I would highly recommend asking for her section next time you go.   I ordered the Mozzarella and Tomato salad, what a vision of loveliness it was (see pics) and it tasted just heavenly, the mozzarella melted in my mouth and the tomato's were so sweet and juicy along with that spicy basil I would have been happy just stopping there.   For my entree I decided to try the Barbecue Scottish salmon Fillet.........WOW!!  Absolutely incredible! This is bar far the best item I've ordered here and is now my new favorite. (see pics) It's sweet and slightly crisp BBQ glaze had me yearning for more.   Now I haven't ordered mashed potatoes from Flemings in years since they took their horseradish mashed potatoes off the menu, but let me tell you after trying their Parmesan peppercorn mashed potatoes I soon forgot my long lost favorite, these ones were to die for!!!  Perfectly creamy, thick , buttery and seasoned to perfection I will be ordering these from now on most definitely!   My husband's usual order of chipotle mac and cheese and a medium rare fillet was no exception to the excellence, he reveled in every bite!   What a total surprise it was when Linda brought him a Creme' Brulee with a candle to re-celebrate his Birthday!  That my dear friends is attention to detail and absolutely made us feel very special and quite frankly made our night!   Our entire evening was flawless from first bite to last.  I can't Thank Miguel and Linda enough for taking such good care of us and we will without a doubt continue dining with you.  You won back my heart and I must say you deserve 5++++++ stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. BARBECUE SCOTTISH SALMON FILLET*
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Now that&#39;s what I&#39;m talking about! ;-)

KzvZ29yvs2CUJIngxy7icQ.text: My wife and I recently went to Flemings for her birthday.  Anytime we decide to spend a bit more on a nice dinner Flemings is our first choice.  You know every time you go there you will receive first rate service and 5 star food.  There is not a bad item on the menu there and the steaks are fantastic.    The only thing I would say the location lacks is the bar.  While they do have one, it is very small and gets full quite quickly.  We would love to go there more to enjoy some of the food on the happy hour menu but given how it is set up, we opt for other locations.  The dining room itself is very spacious and representative of a high end dining experience.    One thing that always cracks me up there is how they offer to carry my drink for me when walking me to be seated in the dining room.  May have to actually do that sometime....

viOg91Go0C7Z2t7oYE5w2A.text: This place has gone downhill big time! 2 attempts at a medium rare steak resulted in one overcooked to well, the last being rare with a cold, cold center. Basically, they seared the last one!  I guess the Costco gift cards, etc has relegated this steakhouse to mediocrity. Welcome to Chandler!

7GtNHM8iB6RCWfocFRQ9BA.text: I am giving this 3 starts,  because the Lady at the Front desk, really needs to drop her Attitude. You don't go to an expensive place like Fleming's, to get Attitude from their staff. If our Money is not good enough to her, we would gladly spend it elsewhere. I told my Husband I wish she doesn't get a share of the tips, because she didn't deserve it. It was Our Wedding Anniversary & we chose this restaurant as we had heard good things about the food. However, the Lady at the front desk was so Rude. She is the face of Fleming's. The first you see even before you have a chance to experience the rest of their staff or their food. Her attitude & rude replies, just put me off. We had a reservation for 7.30 p.m. & thought we would get there around 6.30, so that we can have a drink & hang around for awhile. However when we got their it was packed & the small entrance was full, with no place to stand or sit. I manged to get up to the desk & informed her that we had a reservation. Either she was angry with the crowd their or she didn't like her job. She was just rude & said you have got here an hour ahead. I informed her, that we got there early so that we could get drinks before dinner. To that she just said "Oh! the Bar area is full". We got to the end of the Bar Are, near the back door & with a few minutes wait managed to get the attention of the Barman & get ourselves drinks. I had the 'Club Clover' which was so very sour & didn't taste good at all. I had to ask for some Tonic water in it. My Mum was with us too & she couldn't keep standing there much longer. She is 83 years of age. I saw an empty table Outside & I asked her to sit there & I was seated on the ledge outside. The Tables outside were not being used Last night for Dinner, as the weather was bad. The winds were way too strong, with a slight rain & the leaves were in peoples food. A few minutes later, I went up to the girl in the front again & I asked how long it would be before we get a table. I was then Informed by a Gentleman that they were trying to get the guests who were seated outside, in to the Dining area due to the bad weather & it would be a little after our time of reservation. That's fair enough & I was fine with that, as that's the right thing to do. The people seated out there couldn't have their meal in that windy weather & they were there before us & it was fair that they should have a nice meal in peace. I informed the lady then, that I was seated outside & the door was closed due to the wind & if she could inform me when our table was ready. To this she tells me, "No, You can't sit outside, unless we seat you". I informed her that the weather was bad, (If she didn't know it already) & that there was no one who wanted to sit outside, except poor us, as we didn't want to stand by the door & get in the way of the servers & my Mum couldn't stand there & keep shuffling around to make space for the servers to walk. I told her I am seated on the Ledge outside. To that she says, "Ah! Ok". What is this place? A school? She tells us where we can sit & stand? So we can't sit on the chairs outside, even if there's no one &  they can't use those tables due to bad weather, but it's ok to sit on the Ledge. I was very upset with her & I told my Husband I really don't want to eat here. He was interested in eating there, because he had heard good things about the Steak. Anyway, I told him, I don't want to come here again. They are Rude. The Server RICKY at the Bar was very kind to us & kept looking for space so that my Mum could sit. That's how staff should be.Thank You very much Ricky.  We got our table by 7.30 as promised & I was ok by then as the lady who seated us wished us for our Anniversary & she was nice. Our server MARIE was so very nice. She was friendly & chatty. It was like she knew us all along. It made us feel so very special. All the Servers Attention to detail was amazing. They never left an empty glass on the table, always cleared & cleaned. I informed Marie about the Girl up front. She said she will let someone know about it. But I said it was ok & I was Happy now. Whoever the lady was, up front on Sunday 31st January, Please let her know that she really needs to leave her issues at home & not bring it to work. You can't spoil another persons day because you are not in the mood to be nice. People who come to dinner, come to relax, be happy & Celebrate. Just because it is her place of work, there's nothing we can do about it. I feel bad for her, if she has had a long day. But it was my day to celebrate & be happy & not be served with her Attitude.

E_c0pgZQOgsdoD98D0gV3A.text: Took my wife for her birthday and we loved every minute of this place! Great food, great service!

257Rw8cTTtL2-DXE9x1ffQ.text: Staff was very accommodating, service was good. Drinks are overpriced.   I ordered the filet with Gorgonzola, it was cooked properly, tender, and appropriate size. We ordered the Diablo Shrimp as an accompaniment, they were too small and overpriced. The flavor was delicious however.   Scalloped potatoes were not good and would never order again.   I would recommend Del Frisco's or Maeastros any day before Flemings.

y5F3fDffXq1C4_2XQparRw.text: We really enjoy going to Flemings's. I have always had great food and a perfectly prepared steak. I really like the atmosphere.

LREoiwZ-D-arifcNBdFE0g.text: Love this place. Steak and lobster...what could be better?  The food is always consistent, the service is attentive and thorough. Clearly ranking among the best if not THE best steakhouse in the Chandler area.  The happy hour bar area is nice as an alternative and they have the full menu available as well.  Used to come here as a special occasion place but it has now established itself in my general rotation of high quality nights on the town.

aPe_bqiTszTy73gk2Gv3Og.text: Had a LobsterFeast here.... and was not.. NOT, disappointed.  We order the "LOBSTER TOWER" as our appy... soooo GOOOD!  The lobster-cobb salad was a trough of yumminess!!!... I didn't even hit the bottom of the salad bowl... it was soooooo gooooood....  Dessert was devilishly delicious...  Gettin serviced by Anthony was seamless and nice....   Would I go again?  HECK YES!!

qkOR0K4_5BKvERR0U5D8zQ.text: I was going to write a review but after seeing all the one and two stars they have said it all for me few things I will add when you go to a nice steak house and you  have to flag down your waiter like you are having car trouble that is not good the steak was way over cook for medium rare in the dining room the table's are so close together the other table waiter his ass was in my ear half the night. That was the experience my wife and I had there

yJgAfvTpj48HV1doMm_Vtg.text: Sat at the bar. They provided wonderful service, and food was correct to order. Cheap burgers from 5 - 7pm!!! Mature people that work there.

pljnjs4UJRWJ40HKzMC3sg.text: Food was okay, but in my opinion not worth half of what they charge for it. Staff  seemed kind of snooty ( maybe because my boyfriend and I are young and they think we do t have the money to tip well?) I'm sure I'll never be back, even if the food was phenomenal, which it wasn't, I would never pay around 100 dollars to go home and still be hungry because the portions are so small. I guess that's because it's a 'fancy' steakhouse

ub5fzhQran0uEfXDVfeXZQ.text: Happy hour is 7 days a week but only in the bar and patio.  Check out their website for the specifics.  The Flemings burger on the happy hour menu is a winner.  The wife and I usually sit in the bar area.  The service seems to be better in the bar area, and we mix and match the happy hour specials with the dinner menu items.  I am not big on chain restaurants but this place doesn't feel like a chain.  Was reading someone did not like the halibut. This place is a Steakhouse. Martini, steak, creamed spinach, asparagus, baked potato, wedge salad and a dessert you don't need. Now that's the ticket.

-m-GfqXiuOjIxTY-VJEZMA.text: My boyfriend has taken me to this place twice and I absolutely love it.  The service is always top notch.  We have had the same waiter both times and it was nice he remembered us.  The appetizers and the main dish are always on point.  I always get the filet mignon and I love it.  We love going here and will continue to go.

ONB-PFrt56izsr1jekHJHg.text: Oh how I love restaurant week!  1st stop was Fleming's -- I totally dig the Fleming salad, then again I'm a big fan of cranberries in general.  Their filet I thought was nicely done, when I want medium I want it medium!  As for dessert -- nothing to rave about since it kind of fell flat for me.  Not a huge fan of chocolate over chocolate with some chocolate.... know what I mean?  Service was real good they were attentive and quick.  Ambience was nothing too surprising except I wish I had wore my blazer with a cigar sticking out of my mouth while walking around with a Wallstreet Journal clip under my arm.  Hand me my walking stick Remington!  Overall, it was a good experience and the food was good.  I though I can't recommend becoming a regular especially with today's food price. - Enjoy!

pm9qhNxOfsfZ6ZUbnh84fg.text: First time going to Flemings and was hoping for a great experience. Unfortunately it felt like the worse financial expenditure in my life. The atmosphere was clean and elegant but the very loud and made it even hard to communicate with our server. Most of us had Chefs Special which was a filet, scallops, and shrimp. Sounds great right. Well the shrimp was tough and the scallops soft and bland more boiled than seared and the steak was well cooked but all was served warm to cold. I love small portions when every bite is exquisite but for mediocre and high prices you might as well serve a larger portion to ensure your guests at least paid for something of substance.   I never plan to return and next time I choose a steakhouse we plan on returning to the Keg. Better atmosphere, service, quality, quantity, and price. Overall a much better value then the over priced Flemings. Next time i will sit at the bar and try one of their burgers instead. I have the review 2 stars because the chipotle Mac and cheese was awesome and the carpaccio was to kill for. Everything else specifically the main courses was money down the drain.

4B8LFHdjFmmxl3mLLVGw0Q.text: My family comes here regularly. We like to come on Sundays for the prime rib dinner - $40 for prime rib, salad, a side, and dessert. I normally get the Fleming's salad and Fleming's potatoes and then end with the lava cake (so good!). It's a more expensive restaurant, but they have really good steak.

gesG8otdqN-LQ_x5q-DbaQ.text: Dinner at Fleming's was fantastic! The service was professional and attentive. Food was delish; my barbecued salmon fillet flaked perfectly, and the bed of sauteed mushrooms underneath were the perfect complement. Lighting is low and intimate, so it's great for personalized occasions.

6aUoAsBQUnPNTJs765WbwA.text: Thursday night..... Busy!  Bartenders never acknowledged us even after looking at us multiple times. I guess they think they make enough money. Cocktail table opened up after 10 minutes. The male cocktail server did a fantastic job in letting us know of specials and his opinions of the wine and apps and taking care of us--kudos!  Dinner table opened up (20 minutes after our reservation but no big deal at all-- busy).  Megan waited on us and was very good too.  EXTREMELY Loud and Noisy inside (I forgot that since its been years since I was back).  Megan did great at explaining recommendations of all the questions we had w/ the food and wine. Only issue on service was they never brought out our 3 sauces we asked for and were part of the meal.  The steaks $57 and $55 each were good but not fantastic at all and not worth $50+. It seems prices increased about 20% since last time there and not worth it for the good but not great food and the wine prices (happy hour has good prices though).  Spending $250 for two was too high for the food quality we got and the very loud ambience.  Service was very good though other than the bt's.  I'll stick w/ Ruth and Chris, Capital One or Maestros in future.

IOnC40rnSMecWFShWwU8yw.text: Not really impressed.     Waitress was very goog . place was to noisy service slowGood place to eat if you are not in a hurry. I might be back  45 - 50 dollars for steak only is a bit much for me, no extras bake potato 11 dollars to much for me. French fries 10 where is the nearest mickey dees.

G0yxG6d3qk4dFQycKiaKow.text: It's Flemming's, need I say more. Brought some customers here for a post meeting dinner and Brian, our waiter, was fabulous.  Kept all orders perfectly matched and was always attentive. Multiple New York Strips were cooked to perfection. I ordered mine smothered in blue cheese. Wow! So perfectly medium rare and the cheese and juices still make my mouth water.  In my opinion, the best chain chop house in the country.

PmegaJiEkNthipJ0Ve5oBw.text: INCREDIBLE! Absolutely worth every star every penny everything was just on point from the moment you park to the time your finishing up. Flemings made our special event just amazing and i couldnt thank them enough! The WAGYU and the ribeye are what you dream about when youre craving a steak. Ive personally never had WaGyu and was eager to try. Come celebrate a special night at flemings and you will be glad you did!! Thanks again from the Valenzuela family.

iwSmOHzcCGKDUDfLCdDxyw.text: My girlfriend and I went for our anniversary. They asked us what was the special occasion because we were dressed up, and we told them it was our anniversary. They congratulated us and asked how long etc. The service was excellent, I never had an empty glass and the food was amazing. I got the pork chops and my girlfriend got the chicken. By far one of the best restaurants. One of the managers asked us what was the special occasion and then asked if we'd like a gift! They gave us a card and a box of chocolates and a card. Overall, it was a nice restaurant. They can at least have real candles for this type of restaurant ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. My girlfriend and I went out to dinner for our anniversary and they gave us a card, chocolate, and a 25$ gift card.

VFtEksg4HJh8eIIgIct8CQ.text: I MUST write an update from my last review.  After my recent "poor" review on Yelp, I received an email and phone call, from John Jeffrey, Operations Manager.  John went over the issues I mentioned and invited me back to their location.  I must admit, I was very hesitant. I don't write reviews to receive anything for free, I only write reviews only to warn future customers.  I told John I was unsure if I would be back, but he encouraged me to come back in and allow them another opportunity.  My husband and I decided to go tonight and it was FABULOUS!  Every expectation I had was met this this time!  I would highly recommend Flemings, in Chandler, to anyone I know.   Thank you again John, for taking the time to reach out to me, and to invite us back.  We will be back to your location in the future!!!!

3O6kbDtFDdaIusFNSHMKOg.text: Wasn't a great experience. Sat on the patio, service was extremely slow (wasn't busy) and inaccurate. Appetizers (ordered about 5) were underwhelming, amongst other things, calamari was very soggy. Maybe skip this location.

I-Tn0f2CruaibQn14JAxBg.text: First time here, for 11 year wedding anniversary.  Caesar salad was good. Had to wait too long for our entree. I had a ribeye cooked med. rare and was cooked perfect. My wife had a filet mignon cooked medium but it came out med. well. She did not want to wait for a new one so she ate it. We told our waiter about it and he comped our dessert. Had the molten lava cake for dessert, it was awesome.

pDUrjYWohO08ogD7IHGtng.text: While the service was great, the food was mediocre at best and the steak's consistency was more than off. Also, my party was never asked how the food was nor how they could improve. However, the front of the house staff is very kind - and felt like the kitchen brought them down.

asOgrtU8f8bQLNJcM8f_yg.text: Flemings has predictably great service, good atmosphere, good food and an expensive bill. Great for a special ocasion. The steaks are not quite on par with some of the other top tier steakhouses in Phoenix. But, it's still one of my favorites.

K5rEfefucw_invH9aAHdFQ.text: My husband and I love going here. The crab cakes are delicious, as is the cheesecake! The servers, especially in the bar, are always so friendly and attentive!

KpyOlCxzKbjSx0xGt_LK6g.text: I recently dined here and did not have a good experience. I dine at steakhouses frequently, Hillstone group, capital grille etc. and this place has never been comparable. My filet had no sear, my boyfriends dad's fish was over cooked, the creamed spinach was like soup, burrata was a joke and the sauteed spinach was over salted. There pour on glasses of wine are quite small too, no different ounce options. For the prices, go to Capital Grille! Pretty disappointing, especially the waiter with the southern accent giving us attitude for complaining about the soupy creamed spinach and not wanting to order there chocolate lava cake, lol. Chandler is pretty disappointing with there options of restaurants. Not worth the drive.

R8_Kpbpz6355z9YWvAldWA.text: Had a terrible experience the first time my husband and I came here. We were treated like we had no money and our card would bounce. Had we not been given a gift card we wouldn't have come back. Mark was our server this time around and was down to earth and didn't talk down to us (my husband has a beard, that doesn't mean we're poor come on look at Duck Dynasty) he made us feel really welcome here and not like we were outcasts. Next time we come we are asking for MARK!

ZEaeuNlIuC0fkNB1-Mf2bA.text: It was okay.  For the price,  I would not go back.  The soup and salad were excellent, the steak was nothing special.  The service was good, but not great.  The support staff was better than the actual server, although the actual server was very nice and friendly.  Finally, and most important, it was LOUD.  I mean if I say I said "what?" once to the person sitting across the table from me I said it 100 times during the meal.  If you are looking for a quiet restaurant to share a nice meal, go to Scottsdale to Ruth Chris.  (I have to say, I am a Ruth Chris fan and went here to try something new).

mRxZZT1TTSGD2T_hDE-hmQ.text: 5 Stars across the board. Made the reservation online for a small celebration for a 60th Wedding Anniversary for 4 people. We were running late and called the restaurant twice to change our reservation times; Jessica and Gabrielle were very accommodating and took care of it immediately. The valet Matthew was outstanding. We got seated right away with the awesome Jason and Julia waiting on us. The Calamari, Mushroom Ravioli and Crab Cakes were amazing. Jason recommended a  Merlot from their iPad wine list and it was great. The New England Clam Chowder and the Caesar Salads with the anchovies were fresh and tasty. Bread was warm and replenished right away.  Entrees were cooked perfectly with juicy NY strip steaks  and big scallops, served hot. The side garlic mashed potatoes were delicious. For dessert we got the Creme Brule with the chantilly cream and it was to die for. The manager Bruce stopped by to wish the anniversary couple and see how we were doing, and our waiter presented the couple of the evening with a box of truffles and a $25 gift card, which was a very nice and classy touch. Great ambiance, fantastic food and wonderful attentive service. I have eaten at the Scottsdale location and this one is just better and warmer. Thank you so much.

mpyMHO3QjLTnSSsIe1sOJw.text: Our Chilean sea bass and Filet Mignon was cooked as requested. The portion of bass received was definitely overpriced...had great bass at a different restaurant & less expensive. The chipotle cheddar macaroni & cheese was cheesy just like we like it. The Fleming Potatoes which is their version of scallop potatoes were tasty. The staff was professional. The ambience is nice for celebrating a special occasion at least once.

jIxZRWyZUaJ0ym8sGgSoeQ.text: I stopped by Flemings for a Saturday night dinner with a couple of friends. I had reservations, so even though it was busy, we were actually seated 15 prior to my reservation time. The atmosphere was as I expected, although I was a little surprised that some people dressed more casually than I would have expected.   The service was excellent. The waiter took our drink order and brought a loaf of bread that came with two spreads - both were excellent! One friend and I ordered the petite filet mignon, which was served with Fleming's potatoes. My other friend ordered the regular sized filet mignon with a baked potato. I have never seen a larger potato. My two friends each had a salad - one Caesar and house salad. The salads were each around $9, but good size. The regular filet mignon was $32, while the petite with the potatoes was $26. I didn't really think the regular size was that much larger than the petite.   The steak was phenomenal! I ordered it medium and I can't recall a better steak that I have ever had. It was cooked well, excellent flavor and the perfect size.  The server continued to fill our drinks, brought a second loaf of bread and made sure we had everything we needed.  The total of 3 diet drinks, 2 salads, a baked potato, 1 regular filet mignon and 2 petite filet mignons with the included Fleming potato was $135. Not bad for 3 people. I will definitely come back again.

L-D0Zu55-O8mueVHbUB1ng.text: The bone in ribeye, creamed spinach, and lobster bisque are a must. Soooo delicious.. got me wishing I had leftovers instead of scarfing it all down immediately..haha  Jessica was really attentive and personable too! Great service!

1Y__eMovc2fFPzDePr7eTQ.text: Great service. Great steaks. Great over all experience.  One of the best steaks we've eaten in town.

SzDvE0HkDvib5aIn_su63Q.text: Great dinner and great service. They do have an awesome happy hour from 5-7, but it's extremely tough getting a spot at the bar area.   Some of the most flavorful and best food! They have Fleming's potatoes and they're so delicious, I'd highly recommend.  Big selection of wine and cocktails.

r0SFLKNEaIpHUwJKTuE6eQ.text: I used to love Fleming's. It was the most decadent and glamorous restaurant in the Phoenix valley. With their recent menu change -- and pushback from their servers -- it is not.  Their once amazing wine list now has 14 Hands as one of their top Cabernets. : 0  No cream cheese bread dip. No special cloth napkins.  Very downgraded.  But prices are as high as ever.  Never minded paying the premium, when it was worth it.

Nv3UH5XgmGbpeGSfaZ3-IA.text: We're here 1-2 times a week, and generally sit in the bar.  For holiday dinners and such, where the whole family comes, we sit in the dinning room.  Great drinks, food, and service..safe to say we like consistency.

eoYa2bai2mJ7IWQa-OZkCQ.text: Food was good, ambiance excellent for date night. Not crowded, noise level low, would go back again.

ovxiH2Pv479_Mut6M685lA.text: We stop in here a few times a year. Sometimes we do happy hour at the bar, while other times we have a nice date night fancy dinner. Either way, there is delicious food and fantastic drinks coming our way. Yes, it's pricier than most places, but I certainly think they've earned the price tag. Happy hour is definitely worth the stop in - but if you're like us, it costs as much as a sit down dinner because we tend to get one of everything and a few cocktails in that scenario.

qvhu5H03t1GYs4_URN3z8A.text: We hadn't been at Flemings in a while and they have a new happy hour menu.  I was excited about the Mushroom Farro burger, a new vegetarian option. Our food was served quickly outside in the patio, staff was very courteous and efficient.  The Farro burger looked amazing but it didn't taste great.  The mushroom patty crumbled,  fell apart as soon as l planted my utensils in it.  Moreover it was dry and starchy.  It was passable but not acceptable within the  Flemings standards l expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Regular burger
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Farro mushroom burger.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

-sCpf-sXI-SE2Y1mQiWL7w.text: Had a late lunch/early dinner in the bar area. Even though the restaurant doesn't open until 4pm, the staff will allow you to snag a high-top table/bar stool 15 mins before the grill opens. Service was quick and attentive. Food was of high quality and had a 1990's upscale feel to it, kind of like Cheesecake Factory.  Some of the dishes are a bit overkill, trying to create fancy pairings that seems to backfire...for example: Filet Mignon and Potato Waffle with a demi glace and horseradish cream sauce. These components by themselves are each pretty good, but served together, there were too many competing flavors...and the potato waffle is completely unnecessary vs. a traditional batter waffle.  Also, while The Prime Burger was pretty tasty, I couldn't tell if it was flame broiled vs. just cooked on a griddle. The fries served with the burger were on par with other bar fries, but were thrown for a loop when they threw in a handful of deep fried olives. While that was a pretty bold move, leave deep fried miscellaneous foods to the state fair.  Will definitely give this place another chance, as we only ate in the bar area vs. the main dining room. And, since steak is kind of their niche, I'm hoping more effort is put into the one food that is incorporated in their namesake, Fleming's Prime STEAKhouse.

cYnL53IlU2u1GCwhEIU9GA.text: Ok here it goes . 1-5 scale for Fleming's. Steak 5, 12 oz Filet mignon was cooked to order and tasty  Potatoes:4 very tasty, but expensive Cajun shrimp: 5  (Big shrimp cooked nicely) Service:5 friendly yet efficient   Conclusion: Steak alone will fill you here, sides are delicious but extravagantly priced.  Service is A+. Great if you are rich or for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bread and butter!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Fleming Potatoes and Jumbo shrimp
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Filet mignon and horse radish

7dpjZJPGMwoudHwbcqeWKQ.text: Have had some fine meals here in past times. Tonight, I feel ripped off. 4 mature adults with a great deal of dining experience. All agreed, prices went up, quality went down. I had the days special, halibut. For$50, a 6-8 oz. Portion of mediocre, tasteless previously frozen fish, with 4 stalks of grilled asparagus.  The$64 Bone in ribeye , supposedly prime... I don't think so. A bit tough, gristly. Wife's so called shoestring fries were a mess of limp ,lukewarm crap. Had them removed, replaced with nice baked potato. Wedge salads and onion rings pretty good.  Berries and cream dessert a real disappointment. Handful of grocery store berries and a glop of over whipped cream. 4 people, no booze, $360. Service was pretty good.  Overall, nothing special here anymore.

Gq8s1riYjPAI7JZnwt9KDQ.text: Fleming's tries to be a top end steakhouse but it just isn't.  Went here for dinner because it's close to home.  Ordered medium main filet.  It was more on rare and tough.  Just terrible.  Waitress sensed I didn't like it but I told her it was ok.  Manager immediately came and comped drinks- dinner and one dessert.  I really appreciated the service and attention by the manager.  I just doubt I will ever go back.  Steak 44/ Dominick's/ bourbon and bones/Mastros are much better options.  Would even go to Keg before this

UT8SH40YvS3Kzkjg8qMngA.text: Visited the ahwatukee location for my birthday and my experience was fantastic. We were seated right away. The service was absolutely wonderful and the food was just as good. The Mac n cheese is to DIE for!!! We had a bottle of wine and ordered the tomahawk. My lord it was such a good steak. No room for Desert but oh my, everything I could have hoped for.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

_7W7DyzuUTFTtVpJ8KFwCw.text: I came here for one of those financial dinners, which allowed me to invite 3 friends.  I told my friends I wasn't gonna sit with them cos I see them up to 4 times a week, and I wanna meet new people.  i sat with a single lady, and a Korean couple.  The four of us had such a great time talking, that we are going to meet in another week for Korean BBQ.    We all had the 8 oz filet mignon medium rare.  i wish mine was rare as i asked for rare/med rare.  oph well, it was tender, quite gamey tasting, like Ruth Chris' filet, but oddly, filet mignon at The Keg is NOT gamey, not that I mind gamey.    i prefer the Ruth Chris filet because of the butter, ummmm smells soooo good, like frying in butter on your plate.  But the Flemings version was served to us with no meat juices or butter at all.  I thought the meat was rather dry, and wished for something to dip in.  We were given asparagus, which "was not enough:" and fortunately the Koren lady asked for more asparagus and they brought another plate, really hot!  Good!  Also had the usual mashed potatoes with the skins, which was quite sticky and gooey.    That caesar salad with crispy proscuitto, quite a small salad, can't believe it costs $12 on the menu.    Bread was not baked crispy enough, if I were not with these other people who already touched the bread i would have sent it back for more baking, or asked for extra crispy.   But our dinner was free to us by our host, so I can't be too vocal not paying for it.    The cheesecake was really really delicious, it was not so heavy and had light berry sauce on top and a dollop of whipped cream.  What is heavy?  TJ's brand of cheese cake is HEAVY TO MEEEEE.  I asked for my cheese cake to go, but ended eating half of it, just couldn't stop.    I really enjoyed the company I was seated with, and service was excellent.  We were in a small meeting room which was well-lit.  I would not have liked to sit outside this meeting room as I like bright lighting on my table.

AOfq7CbdxIcWxAxHajkU4g.text: We decided to push the boat out after a number of pretty poor experiences in Goodyear so we moseyed over to Chandler to Fleming's. It did exactly what it said on the tin. My New York strip was cooked to perfection, medium rare as I like it. My companion, for some unaccountable reason in a steak restaurant, had chicken which, in fairness looked great and which he said was delicious. Onion ring sides and what I can only describe as a slab of cream-infused and definitely sinful potatoes left us bloated and satisfied. The accompanying margaritas were, in my view, on the sweetish side but not bad otherwise. I switched to a very nice Pinot Noir. Dinner for two was a relatively expensive $250, including tip, it it was more or less as expected so not complaining, just setting expectations. Special occasions only but really very good.

Qd_Z5kL93-2iWQISHQvpXQ.text: Have heard the buzz from fellow co workers and friends about Flemmings. We went for the first time and honestly werent impressed. We were seated front and center with constant people moving around us. The waiter was nice enough , explained the menu, the butter (changes daily), and was somewhat prompt with service. Steak obviously is the main choice here with one option for chicken, a couple fish options and lobster tail with sides.  Not being a big steak eater and one option for the chicken I picked a few sides with a salad. The asparagus was nothing to write home about. The lobster mac and cheese was ok, the salad was delicious. My wife had the fish and felt it was ok but again have had better at less price. The best part of dinner was the bread and butter to be honest. The prices though were ridiculously expensive and not worth it even at half the price. For a quarter of the price Charlestons is way better. Oh the staff was super nice though.

zXovrIs-okKzAwKAS_sxJA.text: Never disappointed having a meal here. Service is 100% awesome and the food from soup to desert can't be beat. I eat here about four times a year and I always enjoy the expierence

hzWCEa53TR7e45CnJI_zxg.text: Been here a couple times, ambiance & service are great & I really like the lobster bisque. Down side is the steak is just not good. Better off going elsewhere for high quality steak.

_4AhGXRH_P58zOepBXe-CQ.text: We chose to have our holiday party at Fleming's this year and I am so glad we did! We had a private room and the service was flawless! The food was so good that another couple that we had dined with the night before at Mastro's Ocean club in Scottsdale commented that the food was so much better than our previous night in Scottsdale. Great wine list too. So...Great service, great food and a great wine list. What more could you ask for???

v5JTMniyUh_9jov5u1J8Yg.text: Why are they so stingy? A $12 chopped salad with nothing but lettuce, veg and a little shaved cheese was sooooo small. Like 5 bites max. Dressing was tasty. But, really?

epwgOHLP84WtcoihGANt1g.text: I have been going here for years and often wondered why this Fleming's ratings were so significantly lower than the other Fleming's. Think I found out why. Management. I called to make a reservation for a family birthday party of 8 and asked for the small semi-private dining room. The hostess confirmed that the room was available and happily booked our date. Twenty minutes later the manager calls and says unless I wanted to guarantee spending $1300, I couldn't reserve the room. After some discussion I said let me get this straight, that unless I guaranteed to spend $1300 I couldn't reserve that dining area, that no one else has asked for it, and that if no one else does ask for it, then you will just make it part of the main dining area. He said that's right. I told him to keep the room and we would go to Mastro's. He said ok - not even an apology!

UhaMM0jfm7OwfZA5_4SJGQ.text: The first time I went to Flemmings was a few months ago in Glendale. We went with some friends for 5 6 before 7. My wife and I thought I was pretty good. We had bought some gift cards at Costco and got some more gift cards as a gift and had intended to visit the Flemmings in chandler My wife snd I went here this week to celebrate our 3 year anniversary.  The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of the atmosphere.  It was very loud. So loud the waiter had to talk even louder and I could still barely hear him. 2 things I noticed that caused this situation was 1 the music in the restaurant was loud and more pop style (It could have been any style of music) and 2 the seating.  Not that full of a night but everyone was seated close together and that makes it so everyone had to talk louder.  Our waiter was just fine and the food was really good. Still though for the price of it I don't want to feel like I'm at a normal family restaurant where I expect it to be loud. My wife and I decided that we would do the specials before dinner time but not eat dinner here again

MUWInnPPmgq1JVhpSTCVQA.text: Actually a good deal for HH..$6.00 burgers and crispy fries.  burgers are huge and definitely will fill you up. Service was pleasant and quick and the patio has outdoor misters which are OK for curly hair but not a beautiful blowout..lol.  If I return would like to try something different next time and the martini.

ivUgPpK-w0KK070l83n6Cw.text: Let me begin by saying I'm usually a huge fan of Fleming's. I've gone to the Scottsdale and Lincoln location quite a few times, and have received nothing but stellar service each of those visits. Tonight, I cannot say the same about the Chandler location.   Let's begin by Brittany (our server) coming to take our drink orders... It took close to 20 minutes (18 to be exact) to receive our drinks. We hadn't seen our server and was wondering where she had went, so we had asked a near by server if he can find out where Brittany was because our table was ready to order. Long story longer... A girlfriend of mine had ordered a $155 bottle of Caymus, the server had her sample it, and my girlfriend told the server the wine needed to be filtered. Brittany disregard what we had requested and poured it into a glass pitcher (can't think of the name for container she poured the wine in) and never came back. We finally had to tell the young gal that was helping Brittany serve the table we wanted the wine to be filtered because of the sediment. This gal kept challenging us... Stating why didn't we tell Brittany this in the beginning... And we told her we did, but she never came back to do it. Mind you, there was 3/4 of the bottle left, it was not like anyone drank the bottle and demanded anything for free. My boyfriend who is in the restaurant industry... A GM of a restaurant in North Scottsdale would not have let something like this slip without touching the table. No manager came to touch on the table as this was an on-going challenge of the night. This went on for the majority part of our visit until we watched the manager  go into the wine cellar with our other server to grab another bottle we had requested.   Point is, no one touched the table. Despite of the challenge for the night with the wine, you would've at least expect a manager to come by because no one had taken responsibility for such poor service we left quite disappointed... Can't expect a decent tip if you do not receive decent service. I think holding yourself ACCOUNTABLE is a major issue at tonight's visit. No accountability whatsoever. I highly suggest someone in charge reading, 'Leaders Eat Last'. It's a great read on leadership.   Tonight's visit left a really bad taste in my mouth. Very poor service! Brittany did not return to our table as she left it for the other gal to take care of us. I know how intimidating and frustrating it can be to serve, because I myself have served for 5 years while going through college, but at a place like Fleming's I don't see why you cannot be successful when all the tools you need are right in front of you. Being in the service industry isn't for everyone, it takes a lot of patience, and customer service skills. You work in this industry to be of at service to people no matter how bad a night is going.  Do not have any reasons to return.

RM533oVuaQLGnDTlIRFDLA.text: Note that I went here for happy hour  I ordered their $6 happy hour burger and at my server's commendation the happy hour carpaccio.  Not sure if it was because of happy hour or not, but the burger I received was sort of small for one with a normal retail of $13.95. Lets break it down into parts.  The bun- fairly dense and hearty bun that soaked up the juices and didn't fall apart on you when eating it. Not really the most flavorful, but a good base for the burger.  The patty- smaller than the bun (not a good sign), seemed to be a coarsely ground and actually really juicy. Just the way I like it, except for one major flaw. I asked for the burger to be cooked to medium, and the burger I received was well done. Not sure I like that an expensive steakhouse overcooked it's beef. The patty was a little too salty too.   Toppings- 2 small pieces of bacon that probably would have made 1 regular sized strip. The lettuce and tomato were cheap though and there was no onion to go with the burger. (reviewing my photo there was onion,  it was just so small and thin that I couldn't taste it). This level of veggies I would expect in a fast food place. Cheese was nicely melted but wish it had a stronger flavor.  Sides- the fries were decent, but the portion once again small.  The carpaccio wasn't that good to me. I liked the toasted Parmesan bread they served with it, but the beef itself didn't seem that fresh to me with a pale color that was starting to turn grey around the edges. Maybe the beef was perfectly fine, but it just didn't look that fresh to me. Of course maybe I just didn't eat it fast enough either. I felt like I liked the carpaccio at Va Bene down the street a bit more.   So why did I give this place a 3 star review although I didn't really think the place was that good? Because I think the price I paid was worth the meal I got, no more no less. Not a value buy like I was expecting, but decent overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Happy hour specials $6 each

FeRmxvqTkBw1MucabtI6Mg.text: We went to Fleming's for our annual Valentines dinner only to learn our reservation was missing. After a few minutes and fearing that we would be turned away, Gigi stepped in, pulled rank and seated us. Gigi has always been very gracious every time we have dined their. I dont think she takes a day off as she is always there. We then received OUTSTANDING service from Christa who was very nice and engaging. Later in the meal Operating Partner Mr. Jeffrey came by our table and apologized for loosing our reservation. As always, the food was amazing and was served at the appropriate time between courses, no long waits. The entire restaurant was running like a well oiled machine on this very busy holiday. No wonder this is our favorite restaurant that we frequent often. My sincerest thanks to everyone one mentioned for not only saving our evenings plans but for also making it another great Fleming's experience!

rbOfJ3yhtszUbxiANWO3OQ.text: Amazing food, customer service and atmosphere.  We eat here at least twice a month with zero disappointment.  Today was outstanding. The perfect dining experience. Ill have to blame that on Brittany.  She was attentive, on point and spectacular at customer service and the cooked had her back by cooking us perfect burgers. She suggested the perfect drink and treated us as if we were her friends and she was our hostess.  And if course i had the best company in the house. Thanks Flemings for having us tonight. Doesn't matter if we are dressed up or dressed down we always get the great service

a9fKVeehPloLEOST7cevoA.text: My wife took to me to Flemming's to celebrate my 31st birthday this Wednesday.  What a pleasurable experience we had.  Everyone from the hostess to server to bus boys were extremely nice and inviting.  An example of the service we received can be summed up by this.  They offered to bring me dessert for my birthday, once finding out I was gluten free they provided me with a key lime truffle covered in toasted coconut instead of cake.  Ugh, impressed I was.    The food was remarkable.  Their new Porcini Filet Mignon was out of this world.     Go to Flemming's and enjoy.  The next thing for us to get to is the happy hour.

LiP_9y2fGiXdMJm9a6hj-g.text: Great food, service is impeccable, never disappointed BUT wish creamed corn never left menu!

MqIdrrxddaykFBHZIXkz0w.text: So here's the thing, had dinner here the other night and the food was very good. I'm a little over steaks cooked in a 1600 degree oven though and would love to find a place where they actually cook steaks over wood so you get the nice charred marks.. nonetheless the food is good, especially the sides. However, the sides are ridiculously overpriced. We tried their lobster bisque which was delicious, but $14.95 for a cup of soup? The crab cake appetizer was $19.95, salads and all potato and veggies are all about $12. Yes you can share and again everything we had was very good, but still...yikes.  Speaking of their steaks, I would say if you order the ribeye be sure and inquire as to how thick it is. My ribeye came out not even an inch thick and looked like a steamed breakfast steak. I did turn it back and they were very gracious about it.  I simply shared with my dinner date which was more than enough and it was fine because really the rest of the food was fabulous.  We had great service and notice a number of Captains walk around making sure everything was going smoothly.

iCZucowjeX0M-UcteIv5cQ.text: We came back with other friends. Some things were better, noise, for example.  My prime rib was tough but the rest of the meal was fine. Drinks arrived on schedule or not unreasonably behind schedule.  I like the wine by the glass and was thrilled to find Colby red blend which I love. The dessert I ordered was not delivered but a couple of minutes later was.   My wife had no problems.  A friend ordered coffee with dessert but they had run out so he had to wait.  Waitress was nice but maybe overwhelmed.  Since we had the Sunday night prime rib special the price was high but not larcenous. This is not priced as high as the top steakhouses but shouldn't go higher.  It is not in the same league.

Szcon9dCWEMVf2HWvt_Jcw.text: Three of us sat at the bar. Three pretty bartenders were working pretty hard. They service was polite but very very slow. My . drink had very few ice cubes. Tiny portions of salad dressing too...waited 15 mins for a side of dressing. No one asked how the meal was. Grilled shrimp was served cold (put it in my salad) mashed potatoes were like mini bricks. The wrong gravy was served  on an entree . Ribs were amazing, filet was amazing but not good enough to overcome shabby service and substandard sides and the absence of bread...

ZEgCXwFInHnTiXmYorxL6Q.text: The service at this location is not what one would expect at an upper end steakhouse or any fine dining establishment.  This was my third visit to this location and the service level and attentiveness of the wait staff is not on par with other Fleming's or what it should be for the price point.   Perhaps as one of the few upper end dining options in the area, they just can't get a decent staff since the area is cluttered with chain casual dining restaurants.    This place really needs to try harder and step it up and give people a level of service they expect for what they are paying.

XcFOvAaWAiRTfmCtbcqxIg.text: Went out for our wedding anniversary and decided to give this location a try. Have dined at Fleming's in other states before and always enjoyed ourselves. 1st big plus is we had a reservation and our table was actually ready. Nothing irks me more than making a reservation and still having to wait 20 minutes for a table.   Service was very good. Our server Megan was very nice and knowledgable. She even called over the manager / sommelier to answer my questions about the wine list.   Food was great. My wife had the small plate scallops and they were outstanding. I had the pris fixe menu petite filet and salmon with the chili lime shrimp appetizer. Also very good and very filling. We finished with the chocolate lava cake. I'm not really a dessert guy, but it was worth it.   The only thing that keeps me from giving this location 5 stars is the bar & happy hour. The bar is very small and absolutely packed every night. Since you can only take advantage of the happy hour specials in the bar it becomes a regular mob scene by 5:00. Management needs to seriously rethink the logistics on this. They're sending a lot of potential customers next door to Roy's and the Sandbar due to poor planning.   All in all a very good experience. We'll be back.

5cOrx6scccrNd-lRK2fTVw.text: Overall the experience was pleasant and I would give them 3, if not 4 stars...  However, they failed to accommodate my simple request, which was to pay the bill for the entire table (my family and our guests)....  For some reason, it was so hard for them to honor my request even though I approached them twice.   My guests ended up paying for their own meal.... unbelievable...

9fkhGvqknSIt9IW0n4p_FQ.text: Fianlly a happy hour that made me happy.  If you want some great food and drinks on a current economy budget the daily 5-7 happy hr may be a good choice for you.  $5 specialty drinks including a pomitini poured at the table. This drink was quite good and yes girly.  $5 appetizers including a great seared Ahi with a Jicama carrot salad. The Ahi has well spiced and of decent quality.  There are other $5 options as well.  $6 burger that looked huge and induced 2 onion rings and a challa roll for a bun.   There also is a $12 ahi burger that is more of a croquet style with 2 onion rings or a portobello burger too.  This happy hr is available at the bar era, or in the more relaxed patio. There are heaters on the patio for the cooler nights.  With thees prices we kept eating, and eating and yes eating. We left stuffed on great food.  I recommended a side of the saluted mushrooms of the menu as they really enhance any meal.

Ns6lp-Ib75m2cd7594i8wA.text: Came here with a group of 12, we called ahead and they were able to get us sat all together and we didn't have to wait at all. We were able to arrive before our reservation and immediately sit down.   I ordered the dry aged rare rib-eye with asparagus and a Caesar Salad.  Steak was cooked perfectly, and melted in my mouth. I am pretty sure I could cut the steak with a fork and not even chew if I wanted to.   For desert I had the cheesecake and it was your typical New York style cheesecake, was delicious and the right consistency.    Overall the meal was a little pricey, but I did opt for a dry aged steak and full 3 course meal.

WlWxhV5Yf26DpLr5geSwgQ.text: Outstanding food and service.. Steaks were perfectly cooked and the lava cake is to die for. Highly recommend to anyone wanting a great dining experience. Wait staff is highly attentive and really wanting to make your experience top notch..

g3J1ijX5UU6-QeXy5i91zQ.text: My wife and I have gone to this location a few times for our anniversary. It is a wonderful place the staff are always very kind to us and the service is wonderful. The steaks are usually on point and very good cuts all though it seems this time past time it was very average. Maybe the have changed the steaks?? There was no "wow what a great steak" feeling, we both get the aged NY steak medium. Don't get me wrong I'm not trying to knock the place just giving you our review on this particular night Nov. 21st 2016

tlphRzK86x-lsx9Wp4NQ-A.text: For an up-scale chain restaurant, this place is pretty good. Service is excellent, the food was very good and best of all, what an extensive wine list!!   Flemings I think is grabbing onto the future and running with it! For their wine list, they will hand you an ipad which then you may procede to search their over 100 varieties and choose a glass or bottle to your liking. What is so neat too is the fact that each wine has a flavor profile description - so much better than having your waiter try to describe to you each wine or him guessing what you would like.   The food itself was pretty good, a bit peppery...but not overdone or anything (you better not get over done at a place like this) We went on a Sunday which turned out to be a good idea...every Sunday they have a special where you may have a prime rib steak with your choice of side and a salad and dessert for $29.99. Not too bad considering you will pay $25-40 per regular entree.
