The ambiance is very classy, service is wonderful (the waiters even have their own buisness cards...weird, huh?) you can't go wrong with Fleming's for a special dinner or even just because. :)

oAyp5lG5ccb7JgG8Qy_pjg.text: Our server Kerry was impeccable with our dinner.   We came for our anniversary and enjoyed a delicious steak dinner complete with sides :  truffle lobster, asparagus, house special onion rings. And cheesy grits.    Enjoyed fresh and warm sour dough bread with  2 spreads made especially by the chef.    A special place to share with your loved ones and business associates.   Be ready to treat yourself to a decadent meal and come hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chocolate Lava cake with ice cream and raspberries

y22SC51WuQnRjJt6IvHTYQ.text: We had fabulous service, attentive and non intrusive all while giving great recommendations and giving attention to refill drinks and takeaway plates and silverware.  Burrata, prosciutto, roasted garlic and tomatoes plate and the calamari with roasted red peppers were our apps.  The calamari was just okay, nothing better than at average restaurants.  Burrata (one of my favourite cheeses) had no olive oil or salt on top, very odd.  My entree was a Chilean Sea Bass.  Cooked perfectly and was exceptional ($45).   I asked for no citrus sauce and that was where I was a winner.  The bass was garnished with oranges, with the sauce the dish would be way too sweet.  In addition I ordered the recommended Brussel sprouts.  They were fine but too caramelised to the point of close to chipping my teeth!    My husband's 6 oz petit filet Mignon was cooked medium, he asked for medium well.  Very little if any any seasoning was added.  I personally despise needing to add seasoning to a steak at a steakhouse.

CRGbjnCfJ43n97j3ZuQKnw.text: First time here.... went with my boyfriend and my parents - because my parents have been going for years.  But it's definitely in need of an update in my opinion... (maybe that's just the Chandler location, but it seemed small and old to me lol). The filet was just okay... not worth the $$$ - could get a way better filet at another steakhouse (Buck & Rider for example!) I would go to many other steakhouses before returning to a Fleming's..... Sorry to be harsh.  If I would have known how the atmosphere and food was ahead of time, I would have most likely tried persuading my parents to try somewhere new - somewhere with better ambiance and food ....

BS348RpH5U94KKYB-48qgA.text: I'm far from a fan of chains.  I stick to local restaurant owners when I want to spend my money on a great night with the Mrs..  Our experience was great.  Timely seating, attentive service, and great ambiance were all spot-on.  But then the calamari and apps came.  I was quickly reminded that I was dining out in a chain restaurant.  Nothing original.  Nothing special.  Nothing unexpected.  My petite filet at $48 could have been better with seasoning.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't stellar which I had hoped for such a pricey little entree.  I would go back, but it wouldn't be my preference when other classic steakhouses like Durant's exist.  If you're looking for a standard steakhouse you'll like Flemings.  Yet, if you want to make it special and tasty go elsewhere.  It's not broken, but they can improve on what's coming off the grill.

MFrX2Q9s6DBTWZzVrunoRA.text: Came here for Mother's Day brunch. I've never been a fan of this chain but our brunch was really good. We had the Surf and Turf crab cake Benedict it was great except the hollandaise could have been much better. The lobster bisque was very flavorful. The kids ordered pancake and Mac n cheese. The Bellini was considered one of their better brunch beverages... there was nothing special about it. I've had better. The service was nothing to write home about except on yelp. Probably won't be a top choice next time to dine..

Q5jZrKx5C3ObwvX_xUwpWA.text: Flemings is a chain steak has and with that being said, it's what I would expect from a chain.  Flemings gives upscale vibes especially when they ask the name of the reservation and if you don't have one they make one for you but overall I felt like it was like an average chain with the "perception" of being upscale. Some examples are the reservation system, the valet parking, even though there is tons of parking available a stone throw away and the prices.  I've been to plenty of steakhouses so I know steak can get pricey but for me, it was even pricier and missing that upscale vibe. The decor was okay, lots of people were just wearing casual clothes and our waiter was nice but my steak was just okay. The sauce on it was kind of off, it was a special and the shrimp side I got was almost rubbery which i was disappointed with. My husband got his prime rib as rare as he could get and they delivered on rare, I was surprised how rare it was, but he liked it. Except the top was lightly burned, so he wasn't impressed either.  Overall, if you are looking for an average steakhouse with expensive prices for an average experience, then this is the place for you. I wasn't too impressed but it wasn't bad either, it was okay.

W-Y3EX35EoHdglFFPA9YlQ.text: Truly a world-class experience dining at Fleming's this Valentine's Day weekend.   We'd initially made dinner reservations for later in the evening, but needed to change our plans. We arrived a couple hours early and the restaurant was very busy. Despite this, the friendly hostess accommodated us and the staff was able to seat us on their gorgeous heated patio within about 5 minutes of arrival.   Our server, Kennedy, was a ray of sunshine from the beginning. She informed us of their happy hour specials and was great about checking up on us as required. Scott was also great about keeping tabs on our table and was bringing things out at lightning speed!  Over the course of the meal, we had a couple glasses of wine, lobster bisque, scallops, petit filet with truffle poached lobster, loaded baked potato, and for dessert: their stunning chocolate lava cake.   Everything came out fast and fresh. The lobster bisque was rich and creamy with just the right amount of spice and nice, thick chunks of buttery lobster. The scallops were served with a blackened seasoning atop herb and cheese filled phyllo cups. They were slightly underseared, but had a great flavor profile that was incredibly addicting.   The steak was also fantastic. Cooked to a picture-perfect medium, it was juicy and perfectly seasoned. There was a bit of a mixup with the kitchen pushing us out a petit filet oscar (lump crab and bernaise) instead of the truffle poached lobster and caviar we were hoping for. Kennedy was quick to correct this minor misstep, however, and got it resolved without a hitch.   The chocolate lava cake was the cherry on top. At the touch of your spoon, the pillowy cake with a beautifully crusted exterior gives way to an eruption of smooth, decadent dark chocolate filling. The wonderful creamy vanilla ice cream with pistachios its served with makes for the perfect spoonful when combined with the cake. We left absolutely stuffed!  From the friendly hostess to Scott and Kennedy's awesome service to the management staff who checked in with our table and went out of their way to provide us a great experience, we had a perfect date night at this Fleming's location. Highly recommended for a romantic evening out with that special someone.  Pro tip: You can save $25 on $100 or more by checking in!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Decadent chocolate lava cake is the perfect end to the meal. The cake is pillowy with a nice crust and a generous amount of smooth filling.

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Truffle poached lobster with creamy bérnaise topped with caviar makes for the perfect steak accompaniment. Now THAT&#39;S surf and turf!

ml94NOCospr3Vh0Ft7RESg.text: We typically really like Flemings. But it gets a three star review because the food is higher than the value that you get. Second, they eliminated the Sunday night prime rib special, which was both delicious and a great value. Will be back, but we know we would be spending more money if the prime rib was here still. Come on chef Michael!

This one is great for formal dining and as a date night.  I asked for my filet cooked medium rare and the outside area was a little too cooked.  My wife asked for her Prime Bone In Ribeye as medium rare and it was delicious.  Creme brulee for dessert was perfect.  I would come here again.

8pYIJ0Tm1EXmxOMFo6V20Q.text: As part of my Happy Hour splurge during the holidays, I decided to stop by Fleming's for the bar to take advantage of the Happy Hour. Great restaurant for dinner and lunch in the past so I thought I'd take advantage of the "buzz" for so long about Happy hour in the bar.   The staff I have to say was attentive and personable and it wasn't quite crowded as I expected. Despite coming for HH, I checked out the dinner menu to see if anything new or exciting jumped out. The first thing I noticed, a change in the menu. Initially, I thought it's been that long since my last trip, but realized it wasn't. I decided to hit the Signature Bites and cocktails and had the Surf & Turf Sliders. You can pick 2 for $10 or 3 for $15. I decided to try all 3 which consisted of Filet mignon, crab cake, and lobster. To drink I went with the Blueberry Lemon Drop  The drink set the bar high as I watched him prepare and it was delicious. It was $9 and I realized that I could drop 3 of these jokers down with no problem. When the food came out, my buzz tapped me on the shoulder and said: "what's that"?? The 3 sliders arrived.  They were decent, but nothing to keep me coming back for (esp with the price). Maybe I was expecting some "garnish" or fries" with it to round it off.. Yes, I know it's the higher grade steakhouse (over Outback) but I think they could take it up a notch to improve the Happy Hour menu. I will return for dinners but not

My husbands fish special came out cold and the other three over us that got filets were overly peppered. Description not on the menu. Two of the three of us hate pepper. Soooo... Server was very disengaged.  I have had great service in the  bar at happy hour but for a $400 marginal dinner. Never again.

n7Lu8c1VT5Sx9Xp2J_eclw.text: My husband and I went to the Scottsdale Fleming's twice a month for 14 years.  Happy hour every other Friday.  We loved it.  The wine was excellent at a reasonable price and the food really good.  Service was the best.  Fast forward, we moved to Chandler.  We decided to give Fleming's a go.  We won't be back.  The happy hour wine was $14 and the pour was small.  We witnessed a server tell the bartender he was under-pouring and he then made corrections.  My husband's burger was fine.  My sliders were the worst.  The small buns were cold and hard.  I sent them back and they grilled thrm slightly, still hard, old, and cold.  The meat was cold.  The lobster tasted like old fish salad. I was really surprised by the crowd.  Must be the holidays and economy.  It surely is not the product or average Yelp reviews.

sGgXF_hvfJ_AQqLDFs4jeA.text: Having been to Fleming's before, I was really looking forward to tonight's visit to celebrate a special event.  We had a reservation and were seated right away in the dark and fairly crowded room. Our table seemed exceptionally small for our party of four, which made dish and glass placement a little tricky, and during the evening my chair was bumped a few times by the waitstaff and guests because the tables were so close together. We started with crab cakes, slab-cut bacon, and lobster bisque, all of which were quite good.  There was a mix up with my drink order, and even after attempting to correct it, I still received the wrong drink. Then, we waited and waited and waited for our entrees.  3 of the 4 steaks were ordered medium well, 2 of which arrived medium rare.  After the long wait, we were in no hurry to send them back.   Our favorite sides were the chipotle mac and cheese and the Fleming's potatoes, which don't look particularly appetizing when they're served in a rectangular brick, but which tasted fantastic!  We could have passed on the Yukon mashed potatoes and asparagus we ordered as neither were particularly remarkable.    We finished off with creme brulee served with whipped cream and fresh berries, which came out right away and was just as wonderful and creamy  as I remembered it being here.  Overall, the dinner was nice, but it didn't feel quite like the celebration dinner we'd hoped for.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Creme Brûlée

I-250kJdAe-yZ2acMFtSfw.text: The food was great once again i had a pork chop Large an a bake  Patatoe   with butter an chives my girl friend had salmon am mushroom she said it was great the wine manager brought her a box of truffles we where in last Saturday for her birthday we has the lobster an steak we both enjoyed the food an i has a bake patatoe .I will be back for sure.

aciSaJoNS_FvOuYaLaaRnA.text: This is a great resturant, went there for an anniversary dinner. The place was packed, but still ran very smoothly. The staff was very attentive and made sure your needs were met.   Had a couple of appetizers, the sweet chili calamari (which as fantastic) and the pork belly with grits. The pork belly was somewhat soft not seared very well, it also lacked a bit of flavor.   My main course was the special for the night. Small lobster tail and a small bacon wrapped  filet. A bit of advice, I asked how was their medium rare and the staff stated red in the middle. I went with medium and it was a bit overcooked but still a good filet. With a small cut like that it cooks very fast so I would go with the medium rare next time.   I will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Small bacon wrapped filet with a lobster tail.

6EOCBtzqqyTwOoSulRm0lQ.text: Sorry but the new menu is very disappointing! No ravioli???  Sliced filet with potato waffle = yech!! No flavor! Awful! None of the 3 of us would ever order that mess again!!  Bring back the sliced filet with risotto and chili oil!  You are killing what used to be a very nice place to dine!  No Fleming's potatoes?  New menu features more drinks than food! After years of going to Flemings this might be the final visit - sad but overpriced, mediocre menu choices leave me with no other choice  One choice of butter vs  the usual 2 choices?  No onion rolls? No Flemings salad??  We hope you get it back together but the recent trend is not promising   I get it you're  cutting costs but your killing revenues  Will take a miracle for me to go back  This place is very tired, and losing grasp of what customers really loved about the old Flemings  We were told there is a new president and if this is the result, be prepared for yet another new president shortly

g4UPMl1clz5RVLO7bbYrew.text: 1st and foremost I will say that the environment is very nice here.   You will get out formal dining areas with high ceilings that requires you to look presentable. This is the ultimate date location when you want to look your best for your husband or wife.  I think everyone knows that you should expect a bill of over $100 here. It's nice to splurge every once in while on a nice bottle of wine or at least an expensive glass or 2.  However, if you are in the 50 to $60 per plate per person range, you don't really get much. I ordered The rib eye and my wife ordered the fillet with a side of brussel sprout.   The sprouts were amazing let me just say that.  The steaks were a little underwhelming.   All we got for the stakes was a plain piece of meat on a white plate. No garnishes, no sauces offered, just meat on plate.   Each was very tasty karma but in a societee where we eat with our eyes, I was a little disappointed.  Perhaps next time we will up our budget to $100 per person and get something we are not disappointed in

Nyw7W4PUakQiOccKq5G1tA.text: Plan on paying top dollar for your meal, but, you will get your money's worth. Prime steaks and high quality seafood. Service is excellent. Great place for that special occasion. Bar is intimate. Have eaten here numerous times over the years. They have maintained a high level of quality and service during all these stops.

6K4EzUsi23Jj3kGOsn-U6g.text: With the reviews that I received from people that I know personally, I was expecting much better food. The ribeye was almost bland and the flemings potatoes were undercooked. The service was great, but for the price of the food, I expected a lot more quality than what I received. I have had much better steaks for less than half the price I paid here. I will not be returning. It was a waste of my hard earned money.

wzrBjX_IL6ocaTusxtkU9A.text: Always fantastic service! Everything on the menu is pretty much a la carte. So when we go, we order our own steaks and a bunch of sides to share. I always get the filet mignon. Absolutely delicious. The creme brulee is also amazing! Creme brulee is my favorite dessert, so it's nice to indulge here. I also can't stress enough how great the service is here. The staff is clearly well trained and everything during dinner here always goes smoothly. Can't wait to dine here again!

Pat609rT5d2hQH3fWfmhvQ.text: So- I always come here for happy hour. I actually haven't had regular dinner at this location- ever.  The happy hour menu is pretty cool- it's limited, but the stuff is tasty.  I have, however, had a problem with slow service here.  Frustratingly slow actually- which isn't expected for this type of restaurant.

-1ViF4txXWZsB44g40848g.text: My boyfriend and I decided to treat ourselves to a great night to celebrate and have a great night.   We were disappointed and the experience ruined what was supposed to be a great Saturday night.  We had reservations and were seated immediately in a great booth. Our waiter was friendly and we got off to a great start. Two cocktails, French onion soup and a shrimp cocktail to start. So far so good. Then we ordered a wedge salad, a steak each, two sides and two glasses of wine. I would not recommend using the electronic device to pick out wines as it was super confusing and looking at the wines on the printed menu was definitely easier. He ordered his steak medium and I ordered mine medium rare. When they arrived, the tip of his was medium but the rest was rare at best. Mine was underdone as well although not as much. There was literally a pool of blood on his plate by the time we finally got the waiter back to our table after flagging another waiter to get him. We were embarrassed (because how are you supposed to have to do that at a place like this) but sent it back. A manager stopped by and said he understood it was under cooked and we explained the situation. He listened but it felt a little patronizing. What came back looked like a hockey puck. At that point, we just told them they could take it away. We were so embarrassed that we just asked for the check and wanted to leave. Our night was ruined. And we somehow felt like it was our fault. They removed that steak from our check and a round of cocktails but our check was still $200. I received an email survey that I completed after the experience and still have heard nothing. The steaks were the only problem with our meal but we were at a STEAK HOUSE. How is that what they screw up?!??!?!?! And why did we feel like it was our fault the meal wasn't as we ordered it? We've had MUCH better meals at The Keg and plan to keep it that way. A HUGE disappointment and we won't be back.

CEMuSYyWednmZD5yX07reg.text: Let me begin by saying that if you come here, you should not allow anyone but Nikky (Nicolette) to serve you. Not because others aren't excellent, but just because Nikky is extraordinary.   We visited with a group of 4 - 2 of my colleagues, and a senior level client. We were exceptionally obnoxious, and Nikki was brilliant, walking a tightrope of give and take good humor and unrivaled customer service.   We all had an absolute blast and the food was wonderful. We had the seafood tower for 4, and two of us had the petit fillet medium rare and a lobster tail.   The fillet was cooked perfectly - slightly charred on the outside and pink, warm and tender in the center without being chewy.   The seasoning was right on, adding the right amount of savory while allowing you to taste the perfection of the quality cut of meat.   The lobster was cooked well - with a hearty substance while maintaining its tenderness.   The Mac n Cheese was some of the best I've had at a steakhouse.   The wine list was extensive and even impressed out super-wine-connoisseur client.   We will definitely be coming back, and Nikky will be serving us.

UU2EPFjhl6nboyi2OYheNA.text: This is an update to a previous review. I was in Phoenix again for a week and came here for dinner one night. The dry aged strip steak was fabulous but the asparagus was overcooked, mushy and just horrible! It was so mushy that the knife couldn't even cut through it. How can you cook a steak just right but screw up something simple as asparagus? It also cost Eleven Dollars, so one would hope to get one's money's worth with a half dozen asparagus stalks. Five star steak dinner and a 0 star side dish on more than one occasion, equals 3 stars.   I'll be back for the steak, but never will I get their overpriced and overcooked asparagus!

lhK2i1KRa9yIRavqsisAZQ.text: Service was slow, never got bread, and the halibut special wasn't anything to brag about.  Halibut never really tastes fishy but when you cover it up with a weird white sauce and throw crab on it you might as well put cod on the plate.  Just not what you would expect from a $100+ dollar meal.  Check out the flemmings potatoes though.  It's a glimmer of hope, even though an extremely small portion for a "family style" portion.

iMqqvOMIm2OW9papIzuM-g.text: I'm a vegetarian and in years past, they've had a great veggie plate option. Tonight I was served an entire head of nearly raw unseasoned broccoli, two halves a roasted tomato, a few stalks of asparagus and a couple ravioli with no sauce. An entire head of broccoli?? Really? Just because I'm a vegetarian doesn't mean I don't know the difference between good food and a lazy, slap it on a plate if it's green kind of dish. For an upscale restaurant, they should know better. All they would have to do is create a pretty plate comprised of the sides already on the menu and it would be outstanding. So disappointed when the rest of the upscale restaurants in the community are showcasing fresh, delicious vegetable dishes, yet Flemings is falling short with a total lack of understanding of anything other than meat. Otherwise, great wine selection, service and I highly recommend the housemade burrata.

Yl6JphpM41wA4FK4YLM28g.text: A+ SERVICE and 5 stars! We love the steak (my fave is the RIBEYE). They have great wine selections and their service is always great too!
