YiiU40M2v-1CPDJY60kgzA.text: Excellent bday dinner started with signed bday card from the staff for my bday date - nice touch! Our waitress was wonderful - not too intrusive, but very helpful and even helped put on my girls bday necklace - nice! Dinner started with surprise seared scallop on cheese sauce which was delicious. Wedge salads with blue cheese, nuts, and crisp piece of bacon was fantastic. Then our entree of filet, lobster, asparagus, and Flemings potatoes. Steak cooked perfect - everything was amazing. Then bday desert with chocolate tart filled with gooey chocolate and 2 ice cream scoops, with fresh raspberry. Really, the entire meal and bday experience was perfect - both my bday date and myself were completely impressed. Thank you Flemings for a wonderful night.

0zNvAu6escE5qT5LjwhEBQ.text: We had a most enjoyable dinner at Fleming's. The staff was very friendly and polite. The meal was so yummy - I didn't want to stop eating.  The young lady who seated us was very sweet and warm. Mark (our waiter) was helpful and prompt. Conner (who assisted Mark) always kept bread and water on the table- and cleared off dirty plates quickly. The manager came over and checked on us (we told him how well we were being taken care of). We were impressed with the young man who valet parked our car (missed his name). Very friendly and enjoyed chatting with him a few minutes. Of course, compliments to the chefs for the best seabass and mashed potatoes I have ever eaten....the cream brulee was so yummy.  Thanks for a wonderful evening... Your staff is awesome....

AwV_Xg2nKoTHEbKRcf0HaQ.text: I really want to give this place a 2 star review but it wouldn't be fair because of one person: our server last night. The food was outstanding, Main Filet, Dry aged rib eyes, petit filet ... all cooked to perfection. Yet I feel like the service was that of a cheap corner restaurant. Party of four, and the server's attention was directed to only one person. From the wine to the food, Every time he came to check on the table only one person was asked, three of us felt totally ignored, it wasn't until our meals were halfway done that he asked the rest of the table how our food was, with a quick dismissive scan. I felt truly embarrassed with my dad, he was visiting us and we raved about this place, so we took him for dinner there. He is hard of hearing, so I had to ask him a few things regarding his dinner and instead of being sensitive towards this, our server just asked my boyfriend questions, as if he knew what we wanted or needed. Mixed feelings about this dinner - I have been there before and this is the first time it happens!!! I hope the server was just having a bad day, but come on! Is not like the steaks are $9.99, and even if they were you don't make a good name and expect the business out of past reputation. It's an ongoing process. Step up with your server training Fleming's!

qBnuBnWB6R92UJ0ifqoRJA.text: The service was outstanding!  Ask for Robert's section if you go, you will be treated very well.  The steaks however were not the best.  We were really craving a good steak so we were excited to try this place.  With so many other options in the DC Ranch/Scottsdale area, we probably will not go back. We ordered medium filets and we both got medium well. My husbands was closer to well done on the outsides.  It's too bad because we like the atmosphere and the service. I was told they are a high end Outback.  I wonder if they rotate chefs too.

G1Xbag0ESCWyaeSCWcAmfw.text: This is my first fine-dining experience.  Unfortunately, I was not impressed. I guess I expected a waiter like SpongeBob when he cleared his mind of everything but fine dining and breathing.  But what I got was just a regularly decent wait staff.  Nothing wrong with that, but I thought there'd be an "experience" to go along with the price here.  Nope.  We had a party of about 18 for a couple grads in the family.  I will say that we were all given good attention by our waiter, and he did a fine job earning his tip.  Its just that there wasn't anything special about the service that you wouldn't find at Applebee's or something.  The food was an experience, though. I had plenty of time to look the menu over a thousand times (late people, I swear).  The cheapest thing on the menu was in fact on the kids' menu.  But we were there for a special occasion, and it was a steak house that featured....steak.  So I would've kicked myself for ordering anything other than steak.  I may have paid $50 for it, but good lord that rib-eye was the best steak I ever had.  No exaggeration.  Like I said, I've never been to a restaurant like this, so maybe that's why I've never had a steak that good.  And I know there are probably competitors for the best steak in Chandler and the surrounding cities.  But for me, this is as good as its ever gotten.  If there is a steak that tastes better than this, I don't know if I could handle it emotionally.  I'd probably start crying.  I don't have to describe it.  If you eat steak, then you know what a good steak tastes like.  This one tasted like tha; probably better.  Flawless.  Of course, all sides are extra.  I ordered nothing but the meat, as I guess I'm a little too budget-minded for this place.  The pop I ordered took the place of potatos or a salad.    People ordered the lambchops, chicken, sliced filet mignon, crab cakes, and some other stuff.  The only complaint was about the french fries haha.  I didn't try them.  I will say that the wedge salads looked great and were very big.  Also, as far as the amount of food you get, the chicken seemed to offer the biggest portion size.  Honestly though, everybody paid so much for their food that I didn't want to ask anyone if i could try their stuff.  It really is a nice place, too...at least I think so.  The lights are dim so people won't see you frown at the prices.  The napkins are fancy...and so are the ones in the bathroom apparently, as my cuz brought one out to show me.  It is not quiet - but not louder than any other restaurant.  From what I read and hear people say, a fine dining place is supposed to be quiet and stuff.  If that matters to you, perhaps this isn't fine enough for you, because its just like any place else volume-wise.  Perhaps 3 stars is stiffing them a bit.  I mean, my meal was perfect...the service was good...and the ambiance was nice.  Am I just too much of a cheapo?  Did I expect too much of an experience for the price?  Maybe.  But I still feel that everything except the steak could have been just a tad better.  If there is ever another reason to go fine-dining, I'm sure I would suggest some place else instead of coming here again.  I saw what they have to offer...and despite the awesome steak, it just wasn't enough to bring me back.

p45cgOVGg7N6DksNqZsyxg.text: Great experience at Flemings Phoenix.  I've wanted try Flemings for some time.  We have one in my home town of Walnut Creek, CA., but have not yet got around to it.  On a recent business trip to Phoenix our hosts treated us to dinner at Flemings. We started with an array of appetizers. All very good. For my entree I had the rib eye and I have to say it was perfection! Cooked as I ordered and seasoned perfectly. The mashed potatoes and green beans were very good too. Desert was carrot cake. I'm not a big fan of carrot cake, but as far as they go I'm sure it was great.  The server was attentive and very friendly. Also, I ordered horseradish on the side and he remembered without being reminded. I don't take that for granted anymore.   The location was a bit strange. It's located in a strip mall. I'm accustomed to a Flemings being in cool, unique locations. But maybe it's a Phoenix thing. Everything is located in a strip mall in Phoenix.  I've eaten at Morton's and Ruth's Chris many, many times. Flemings is my new favorite and will have my steakhouse business going forward.

PwAjXNN2hsc_hcuNQpeFQA.text: The atmosphere was a little different from what we expected.  It is much more relaxing and casual than the ones we've been to in L.A.  The waiter was very polite and funny at the same time.  He seemed relieved and excited to serve our table since we were the only under 50 table in the whole restaurant.  *Steaks = very yummy.  cooked to perfection.   *Decor = a little on the vintage side *Service = wonderful

2Uuy-YfWoDYCvpVOYaCkBw.text: Our dinner last night at the Chandler Flemings was excellent. The bacon wrapped filets w/tempura shrimp were cooked to perfection and may become a favorite for us. Whether it's a full dinner or the fabulous bar menu, this place never disappoints.

0lA3vN0QhtkQj8byjHYIjw.text: Had a fillet - was as good as any I've every had.  Tender, cooked to perfect temperature.  Terrific flavor.  Seafood chowder was good as far as Arizona goes.  You just don't get great chowder here.  Waitstaff was attentive, but otherwise invisible, which is exactly how I like them.    Eating here is different that most places.  Ignore the prices, I would say even ignore the menu.  Tell the waitstaff what you want, they will bring it and charge you what it costs.    If you are price shopping this place, you will not be satisfied.

dxctWZOFyFUeZ2n3wOUSuQ.text: This a review highlighting Flemings Event hosting skills-  I had a luncheon/seminar here on yesterday and was thoroughly impressed with both the outstanding quality of food and excellent service. Flemings was closed to the public during this event because they open at dinner hours. Although the restaurant was not officially opened all of the employees still kept the same level of service as if it was; as a matter of fact I was graciously greeted by a hostess upon arrival. The actual meeting room was sectioned off in the rear of the restaurant, this would make a great place for any after wedding rehearsal dinner, seminar/luncheon, or even possibly an upscale bridal shower. The wait staff was very friendly moved stealthily to each table during the seminar which is very important (nobody wants to hear a bunch of plates clinking when you're trying to listen to a presentation). On to the food! The salad was pre-chosen by the host which was Fresh Mozzarella & Sweet Cherry Tomato- one word to describe it would be "AMAZING"! The tomatoes were perfectly sweet and paired so well with the creamy FRESH mozzarella, I literally thought about this dish when I was on my way to sleep for the night. For dinner attendees at the seminar had the choice of chicken, salmon and of course steak. My co-workers and I all decided to try something different so we could compare. I had the Chicken and was impressed by juiciness and the mushroom chutney it was served with. The Salmon looked delectable and received high praise as well as the Petite Filet Mignon. All the entrees came with fresh Sauteed Green Beans and Fleming's Potatoes (think of the best scallops you've ever eaten, now times that greatness by 10 and you'll have Fleming's Potatoes).  The seminar concluded with a Cheesecake that was sent straight from the Cheesecake gods (it was a huge piece and I was already full but I somehow made room for it!). The Cheesecake was rich, creamy and lightly topped with blueberries (I can't believe I had to go back to work after that feast!). This was my first time at Fleming's I will be sure to come back during normal operating hours so I can try even more of the amazing menu. Bravo Chef and Staff!

2tXJFtGhrCRZuD44lnLyEQ.text: The food here is great with a nice atmosphere! A great place for a very nice dinner. A nice place to have in my own back yard of chandler and not having to drive to Scottsdale for the same quality.

yYCjzZRAOZIdvshl0ArAVg.text: My husband and I are frequent customers of the Chandler location steakhouse.  Normally we have always been satisfied with service and meal.  We usually spend 180.00 - 200.00....  Last week we ordered the King Crab Legs and was terribly disappointed.  The quality was much like what you would get at a casino buffet if not less.   When I complained to, I presumed the Manager, she kindly brought an additional half order to our table and they looked identical to my original order.  It's as though they scraped the bottom of the pot for these sad little legs.  The presentation was horrible.   My husbands rib eye for the first time was not cooked properly and the quality of the beef had so much gristle and way too much marbling there was little left that was palatable.  What's up here!!   We may have to drive into Phoenix or Scottsdale for a quality steak.  Too bad.

vkEJCdm7jMyEyTKQijXP4Q.text: Had the NY  strip, green beans, Mac & cheese and key lime pie. Out of a group of four that shared the same side dishes, I ended up getting food poisoning! Three days later and I'm still feeling the effects and lost six pounds too! I will not be going back... Diner beware!

xASZAcQWmIKoUhWycTVUvQ.text: Was there on Dec. 3.  They got the "rare" correct on the filet mignon but it was so horribly salty that I had to drink water throughout and guzzle 3 glasses after the meal.  My mouth was still so salty I needed more food just to get rid of the salty taste from the steak.  The veggies were very good and so were the mashed potatoes.  The dessert was excellent. When the lady (other couple we were with) remarked on how horribly salty her filet mignon was and how bloated she felt afterwards, I knew they didn't just screw up mine.  The chef is a salt freak.  It was a shame that someone knows how to cook steak to order (rare) but he destroyed it with so much salt.  I don't like to make a scene in front of other people and that is why I didn't send it back.  The servers were pleasant and the decor was very nice.

W3J-C39KhQa2e6MYCBcW1Q.text: Came here on my birthday and was not impressed. The atmosphere was nice but my husband and I were not happy with the food at all. The bread they gave pre-meal was just ok but didn't seem very fresh. There were two types of butter that came along with the bread and both were actually pretty good. I ordered the lobster bisque to start and honestly, the flavor was a bit odd. I personally think the lobster bisque at Red Lobster is better not to mention cheaper. For dinner, I ordered the seared scallops that came on top of puff pastry and a measly portion of vegetables. The scallops were gritty and seemed like they had not been cleaned properly as I could taste granules of sand. My husband ordered the ribeye since Flemings is supposed to be known for their steak. He said that the steak was not seasoned at all. For sides, we ordered the Flemings potatoes which were really good and the baked potato which was fine, but honestly, how hard is it to mess up baked potato? When the check was presented they also gave me a box of chocolate truffles since it was my birthday. I wont lie, these were amazing!!! Unfortunately, the truffles, Flemings potatoes, and butter will not make me come back. I am all about giving places several tries before deciding to go back but not a place with a huge price tag such as Flemings. When I spend $100 on a dinner for two, I expect everything to be sensational and Flemings was very far from it.  PS: The husband said it was the worst steak ever and you would be better to light your money on fire rather then spending it here. :)

yjjaOFx6ojWzNQjhN9uEoQ.text: The 5 for 6 'til 7 is so awesome and such a great deal! I wasn't sure the first time we went if we should dress up or if it was okay to wear jeans and a nice top but everyone was either in their business casual work clothes or jeans. I would recommend getting there a little early because it fills up quickly! We got there at 6pm and by 7pm it was pretty full.  I have recommended this to so many of my co-workers and friends to try out and so far anyone that has gone has come back to me saying what a great time they had and how surprised they were with the 5 for 6 'til 7 deal :)

zPkJClmNjGgIGgFllfXm_Q.text: flemings is always top notch. we went for the thursday night wine tasting 20 wines for $25 introducing there new 100 wines by the glass. The selection was good from lite whites to deep reds a great way to sample a portion of there new wine list. then to top it off we received $25 gift cards for dinner. so we stayed and had the AZ resturant week pre fix dinner for $39 the food was wonderful. salads, soup lamb chops and filet. i guess to sum it up you can't go wrong with a meal from flemings. they also have a great happy hour.

LPrv6csdGQCrhCAyT5aEJw.text: We had a party of four reservation at 7:15 and we got in pretty much exactly at that time. Service was fast and friendly. The bread and butter was amazing and the steak was even better.. I got the NY strip for 41 bucks and it was huge and worth every juicey penny.

uIREBoVgEcvoT1dMO9zhoA.text: Our group of six ate there on a Friday night.  We had steak, fish, scallops and many sides and salads.  We all agreed we were completely disappointed with the food.  Our bill was around 450 (we didn't have any alcoholic beverages) and we could have gotten better meals for less than half the price.  Service was decent.  Save your money.

GkRk9dugw7TIxG8v4U9qLg.text: I have to say that I fought going here tonight for dinner. I mean, I am in Arizona and there are Fleming's restaurants in California, so like any good yelper of course I'm going to want to experience the best and most unique restaurants that Arizona has to offer. However, this just so happens to be my brother's favorite restaurant so he won because this was our family's last supper, of sorts, before we leave him by his lonesome in Phoenix. Well off to Fleming's we went and it was fabulous. For a chain restaurant Fleming's does it right; nice decor, impeccable food, excellent service and over 100 different types of wine. Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list and checked up on us at all the appropriate moments. The additional support wait staff was very attentive so much so that when (like the klutz that I am) spilled the last sip of wine all over myself, he quickly took my sweater to the bathroom where he blotted it with ice water and handed it back to me in a Fleming's handle bag and recommended that I take it to the dry cleaners and ask that they treat it with the spray that removes wine stains. What a sweetheart! We ordered the sweet chili calamari to start along with a bowl of roasted corn chowder soup with lobster, shrimp and potatoes. I ordered the petite fillet mignon cooked medium rare, my bro had the 20 oz steak and my mom had the Mahi Mahi. All of it was amazing. We finished it off with creme brule and our bill was about 2 bills. Overall it was a great experience and I'm glad my brother won this round.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

tvcy2ts7ZP8BT3jlr9_DXg.text: Service was good. however, my fillet mignon was cooked well done when I ordered medium well.

pgkkYTIp7EvEBXLjll9Izw.text: Great overall experience!! I took my fiance for his birthday dinner - and from start to finish - every employee we encountered wished him a happy birthday! At the end, the waitress brought over a box of chocolates and a giftcard to come back for $25 off.  It was truly a good experience.  The food was delicious - expensive but very nice for a special occasion. The steak was absolutely delicious - melts in your mouth. He had the ribeye and he said it was the best steak he has ever had.  I had the chef's featured  entree - 2 four ouce bacon wrapped filets, 2 scallops, and 2 shrimps.  I asked for all shrimps and this was no problem at all!! Mine came with some asparagus as well.  Both entrees came out perfect - from the cook temperature to the specific personalizations to each dish!  The complimentary bread and calamari appetizer  we started with was sooooOOO yummy and the portion size was great! The sides left a little to be desired - we tried the Fleming's potatoes and the macarroni and cheese - both were only okay and did not stand out.  I would invest some money and time into revamping those sides - they did not compliment or stand out like the steaks did!! Similarly...the desserts were only okay for us. We had the donuts and the cheesecake. Overall, a great experience. I would definitely come back - especially on a special occasion - this place knows how to make that person feel good and recongized! I would pass on the desserts and would consider trying other side dishes or passing on them altogether. $10-$13 per side dish is too expensive to be mediocre.

wlH30cB7CYhq8Kq_YUkyvw.text: I stopped in for happy hour this past Friday. I'd previously been for their happy hour, and had a good experience and good food the first time. My first visit I tried the tenderloin carpaccio and the seared ahi tuna. Both were tasty, but I should have only ordered one; I was too full afterwards. I also had a nice glass of merlot that first visit. (I'd give the first visit 3 stars.) This latest visit was not as good; the service wasn't friendly. I sat @ the bar with a buddy, and we both ordered the prime burger. The burger was good, but regardless of how busy the bartenders were, they just weren't friendly (male or female). Shouldn't a place like this offer friendly, quality service? I'm a patient guy, and understand when a place is busy but that doesn't mean quality has to be lacking. I'll go back for the food, but am hoping the service gets better and friendlier.

-ZoyskI35fvx_oDM1IrVKw.text: Well, the food is absolutely incredible, but the 165$ pricetag for dinner for two was a LITTLE much. The wine we had was great and we both got the surf and turf... with filet mignon of course. I would definately go there again... when I save up some money... Not a place for teachers to go. :)

yWENRLP6qt2CTj1a41YmRA.text: My favorite dish is the bone-in ribeye for 2. It's a special that you have to ask for and it's usually available. The Fleming's potatoes are delicious, and the lava cake dessert is a great ending to a great meal. The wine selection is also very good.

0eBQMALhdV-xdg5PcC4kgQ.text: Best tuna appetizer I have ever had.  The spicy mustard is out of this world.  When they have a corn/seafood chowder on the menu it is the best chowder you can buy.  Steaks are always great and when halibut is in season they do a terrific job.  Sides are very good.  Especially like the Flemings potatos.  When they have Beef Flemington on the menu it is also top notch.  Prices are high and worth it.

1TYuT6iFYcC2Ldncy1LoyQ.text: We had another fantastic meal!  This was at least our fourth visit here in the last year and it was exceptional.  Took out my in-laws, wife, & son for their Birthdays, which are all pretty close together.  Everyone of us was really happy with our meals.  The adults all had the 8oz. Filet Mignon & Lobster Tail special, which was great.  Everyone's steak was cooked to perfection, we all enjoyed our salads, the Fleming's Potatos, & each of us had a different dessert (delicious & filling).  Our waiter made an excellent suggestion on a Merlot that I wasn't to sure about.  He brought over a sample of it for me to try. I've now found another wine that I will seek to purchase.  This is the fourth wine that we love, that we had at Fleming's first.  Also, my son had a great steak with his kid's meal that he really enjoyed.  Thanks again, Fleming's for a most memorable evening!

SA8GBz4nuQeHRT61kD9boA.text: Went there for our anniversary and was very pleased! The food was terrific as well as the mixed drinks! We got a peach cocktail and it tasted delicious! We both got an 8 ounce sirloin along with a baked potato and it was awesome! The baked potato definitely sealed the deal!  The manager came over and gave us some truffles to take home along with a gift card for our anniversary! It is expensive but very nice and romantic for a special occasion! Really awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

cH-DoTU_GxOUmiBsGdLgAQ.text: Delish!  Do I need to say more?  For a nice mean try Flemings.  Great happy hour too.

rja53u4MTGliCIFRzoFpPw.text: I have visited a Flemings a few times over the years and I am always satisfied.  I usually go with my husband's family on Sundays to take advantage of their Prime Rib deal.  I always enjoy visiting.  They always have great steaks and amazing sides.  I haven't been for happy hour but I heard it's pretty good.

H7psReaDq39KEew27A5zfQ.text: I love this place. We always have good meals (or happy hour visits). Tonight we went to celebrate my husband's new job. We didn't go all out. But we were still treated well. That's important to us. We don't like being treated one way when we spend big bucks and another when we don't. Anyway, we had the Sunday prime rib special - an awesome deal - and bottle of wine. Our waiter was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. The pacing of our meal was good, too. Ooh, and I love the new version of the wedge salad. The tomatoes and pork belly (rather than thin bacon) were amazing.   My favorites dishes: prime rib, filet mignon, ahi tuna (small plate typically) and various specials.  Appetizers/happy hour: tenderloin carpaccio and calamari. The prime burger is awesome.  Salads: wedge and Flemings.  Sides: mac & cheese, Brussels sprouts, spinach, Fleming potatoes and asparagus.  Desserts: creme brulee, carrot cake and chocolate lava cake.  Cocktails: blueberry lemon drop, peach whiskey martini, blackberry bramble and farmers daughter. Also, ward b or 8, but I didn't notice it this visit.  Looking forward to another visit soon.

cwcRZZxncqtySFuV0COchA.text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here and it was perfect!!!! The service was simply divine and the food was a-ma-zing!!!  The dinner was cooked to perfection and at the end of our meal we were presented with the most delicious dessert!!!!!!!  Truly we had a sublime experience! The ambience was romantic, classy and friendly. It was welcoming and professional at the same time.  At the end of our dining experience the manager brought us an anniversary gift - a $25 gift certificate to use when we return!!!!! I was so shocked and impressed with their customer - centric approach.  I definitely give Flemings five stars and highly recommend others to visit!!!!

GdadE_S2Jte50axKtzw58A.text: Recently returned to Fleming's and had a better experience. I would still like to see better service and lower prices. My prime rib was excellent tho. Kudos to the chef!

0xV1sbFZygxZrahvvoWvvg.text: We have dined at this Flemings location numerous times before and had wonderful experiences, however, this time things fell very flat.  Things started off fine with water and a wine list that was provided via Ipad.  My fiance's mother asked the waitress for wine recommendations and she wasn't able to help ( it seemed like she wasn't too familiar with the selection).  Ordering food was fairly quick and easy.  Once we received our steaks, the waitress informed us about the lava cake that takes 20 minutes to cook, and told us she would check back in shortly to see if we were interested.  We didn't see her again for at least 30 minutes.   I know, I know.  When people usually say 30 minutes they are grossly overestimating out of frustration; however, we actually did wait that long.  So long in fact, it began to get awkward at the table.  All the food was consumed and our wine glasses were empty, yet our waitress was nowhere in sight.  When she did finally show, it was too late to order the lava cake.  We instead ordered two plates of creme brulee and two desserts to go, along with a cup of coffee.  The coffee was cold, and it took 10 minutes to get a new hot cup.  Once dessert was finished we again were left waiting around for our waitress; waiting to clear dishes, waiting to receive the check, and again, waiting to pay the check.  In all it took us two hours to have a simple meal, and that was not by choice.    The food was great, per usual, but the service was just downright bad.

VGYahmTQXZJCwHauUJiZ1Q.text: Excellently prepared entrees with great service.  The steak dishes are understandably the stars of the menu, and on Sundays they have a great special for prime rib: for $37 in addition to the prime rib you get salad, side dish, and dessert.  The prime rib itself is very tender, and perfectly cooked with a choice of 3 sauces to dip it in.  Another good deal is the spring special: Filet mignon and lobster tail with salad or soup, and mashed potato or green beans, for $35.  The filet was also very tender, perfectly cooked, and the lobster was full of flavor, and they will cut it off the shell for you if you desire.  The salmon is also good, perfectly seasoned and nicely cooked.  Service was very attentive, and even though I didn't need it, they offer black napkins to place on your lap if you are wearing something dark so that any lint from the white napkins on the table doesn't get on your outfit.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lobster cobb salad, sans egg (had to request it!)

sAluGwMa-Tw9njhu4voE6Q.text: We visited Flemings for the steak and lobster special. Our meals were cooked perfectly and the portions were just right. Our server, Byron M. was excellent. He made sure our visit was great. He was very attentive.

IiiQtAYtRkjzacwz5hLFxg.text: We came here for our 25th anniversary dinner. The atmosphere is pleasant with excellent service. Unfortunately, the food itself was only okay.   They make their food with special twists, like champagne and merlot infused butters with their bread. It's unique and fun to try but the bread itself was nothing special, we would've preferred regular butter with good bread. The Caesar salad has fried capers and prosciutto chips on it. Again, it sounds incredible and was good but nothing I'd crave. Creme Brulee - ditto although the Chantilly cream was excellent.    I will say our filet mignons were cooked perfectly and served piping hot. My husband didn't prefer the flavor of the seared edges but I thought it was good (not great).   All in all, I wouldn't mind if someone wanted to meet here but I'd probably prefer The Keg.

F4XcsV4OMnQBrMYMol9img.text: I thought I had previously offered a review of Flemings, but I guess I didn't.  So here goes....  Long story short - GREAT STEAKHOUSE in Chandler, AZ!  I received a gift card at Christmas while visiting my partner's family in Phoenix.  We decided to check out the restaurant considering we don't have a Flemings in Portland, OR.  The place is part of the Open Table reservation system which worked perfectly.  I made a reservation via Open Table and collected 1000 points for doing so.  Even better!  We arrived a few minutes early and were greeted by a kind hostess who immediately attended to our reservation.  The place was a bit swanky, but not too intimidating.  The lighting in the restaurant was perfect.  It had a lively ambiance and the patrons were middle-age to older and a bit more upscale than say, Outback Steakhouse.  We were seated and assigned a very knowledgeable waiter who introduced himself as well as the menus and wine selections.  We were offered a choice of either white or black linens which took me by surprise.  Of course I chose black from the standard white as I knew that would hide any unseemly messes.  The food arrived well-presented and almost reverently.  Our plates looked AMAZING!  I ordered a filet mignon which was grilled to perfection.  The medallion melted in my mouth!  The garlic mashed was equally delicious and the asparagus was cooked al dente.  We savored each bite and anxiously looked forward to dessert.  We ordered creme brulee and raspberry chocolate lava cake.  One word:  HEAVENLY!  The dessert was a perfect ending to an already amazing meal.  Needless to say, we left Flemings more than satisfied.  The service, food, atmosphere and cost led to a very harmonious experience for all of us.  We will definitely put Flemings on the agenda of places to dine when we're back in Arizona in a few weeks.  Heck, we'll visit on EVERY visit to AZ!   Thank you Flemings for the outstanding hospitality and excellent service experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chocolate lava cake... Heaven!

lxX5LezVrYOfK50NRAHhtg.text: We had a craving for a nice steak dinner. We arrived and were seated immediately. The service was great. The staff was very attentive from the server, to the bus staff, to management. The steaks we're to cooked to perfection and the rest of the meal was great. Will definitely be going back.

vAD1oPRlzavfLe-Zj9Tqsw.text: My hubby and I ate here earlier tonight. We made an early (5pm) reservation so we could squeeze in a movie post dinner. Since they open at 5, we figured we would be the first people inside. Much to our surprise it was packed with happy hour patrons. It must be a good one, so we will come back another time to try it.  Leave it to us, though, to dine at a steakhouse and both order seafood. I had the lobster tails and they were amazing. My hubby enjoyed his salmon and said it was some of the best he had ever had. We also had asparagus and the Flemings potatoes. Both were great!   Service was impeccable. We will definitely go back for seconds ;)

Xw98f14THj5Muhr9o1FilA.text: First of all let me say that the only reason I am not giving this a 5 is a because the bar area is rather small and you have to strategically plan to get here early and scout a seat. I came with my all male Co workers and we had a great time. Drinks were strong, prime rib burger was on point and I definitely plan to come again. I love that the happy hour menu strayed away from the norm, pizza or wings...had a great time but get there early or be prepared to stand around and watch others have a great time

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime rib burger....food orgasm
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

AlnfjE3qmtrCmICRwdBCuw.text: Even though I still think the bar area is lacking, now that I have been here a couple of times for dinner, I have no qualms about adding an extra star. Their steaks are phenomenal! A little pricey perhaps, especially since the sides are all a-la-carte. Oh, but their mashed potatoes are so delicious it's worth the extra money. And they have some great salads, too!  It's the type of place you really want to order multiple courses because everything they serve is great, not just the steak. And even though the beer options are limited, their wine list is fantastic. They have a huge selection, at many different price points. Pretty cool that they also give you an ipad to look it all over.  Even though this place is a chain, it's worth a visit if you are in the mood for a great steak. It definitely beats out the other options like The Keg and Ruth Chris. Get on their email list and you'll get the advertisements for when they do special stuff like give you a free gift cards when you spend a certain amount on dinner. They also sometimes do seasonal pre-fixe meals. Right now they also have a small plate special that will help keep the bill reasonable. Of course, you can always stick to the $6 sirloin burger in the bar. ;0) Just wait until the weather is good so you can enjoy it on the patio.

NtCYpaa44aIojrLxeuUqaA.text: This place is subpar for the price. If I'm paying $50 for just a steak, I expect to have an ambiance that is nice, romantic and dressier. Not people with kids, dressed in sandals and shorts. For two and 1 glass each of wine I spent $250...for meh steak and some mashed potatoes and mushrooms. It was our anniversary and I could have spent the same at a nice restaurant and gotten an even more special experience.

jCIvEEXcapUuDEoJsCftSQ.text: Great service and delicious food. I had the Chilean sea bass and Fleming potatoes, with a lava cake for dessert. Husband went for the lobster tails. Definitely a treat!

d30R7rvMIQ2ElsjeUvNX8A.text: My wife and I were on vacation and came to Flemings for my birthday dinner. So for those of you who don't know, everything here is ordered separately unless otherwise. We arrived early and took a seat at the bar, lucky for us Brandon (bartender) was awesome. He went over some drink options, went over the happy hour menu and the dinner menu.  Then it was time to be seated, our waitress Krista was great, just like Brandon. She went over the menu, made some good recommendations and we were not disappointed, she definitely made you feel welcome. I suggest the mac and cheese (to die for), my wife had the prime rib (which according to her was sooooooooo good) and I had the seasonal fish which was cooked to perfection. So after all that goodness and if you have any room left, get the carrot cake and you will love every bite. Our experience was wonderful, from the moment you walk in, we will definitely be coming back.

69v8GVFjO2gCJqgaZPfimw.text: I was kind of surprised that this place wasn't to my expectations, it is really nice inside great Ambience but they had not given their full potential I believe. the waiters were kind of slacking on refilling drinks and asking if there was  Anything else that we needed they had us just waiting around the whole time. The steaks were not that great neither. Maybe it was a bad day

c6SNo-Ml3aKtQsajkPgioQ.text: Here again. Steak BURNED. Sent it back. Came back really burned. We were with a party of 16. So I just sent it back and told him I didn't want a steak anymore. No manager came and apologized.   Come one Flemings.

kMhn1fhk-tyDhOOKKpyOTQ.text: Can't understand how this location isn't 4 stars plus. They never disappoint and last night was no exception. Took my daughter for a nice dinner and everything was perfectly prepared, from the salads, to the prime NY Strip.  The service, as always was impeccable. Jurgen our waiter took good care of us and his colleague remembered my daughter and I - from our visit - two years ago.    In previous dinners with the wife and/or friends we've sampled virtually everything on the menu and never left unsatisfied. If you live in the SE Valley, save yourself a trip to Scottsdale for a special occasion and come here.

gnbOGWIZES--aFj65A10EQ.text: First off, they didn't offer us the restaurant week menu.. lost a star for that.   After hearing such good things about this place my lady I decided to check it out.   1.) Took at least 15mins for our waiter to come introduce himself. 2.) Not a fun atmosphere at all. The booths we sat in felt like we were on display and far from comfortable. 3.) Calamari was awesome, enjoyed that very much win for them. 4.) When the food eventually came out I said to myself, "this is going to amazing!!" I mean it had to be, the presentation was on point like Ruth's Chris or Mastro's and it smelled great. I was wrong so very wrong. I don't think this restaurant believes in flavor. 1 steak was severely undercooked and 1 steak was over cooked and tough.  5.) The sides-- the mac and cheese was close but no cigar. The twice cut fries looked and smelled good but tasted like sonic fries with zero salt. 6.) Our free dessert lacked luster and the expensive ass food was anything but spectacular. I need to go back to Mastro's and have the butter cake  My advice if you're looking for a really good meal go to Ruth,s Mastro's, or Steak 44 this place is weak.

wQgabWbkbqteKlEz8BjIAA.text: Tonight my wife, daughter, and I went for a nice dinner. We ended up on the patio because the restaurant was so busy and we hadn't made a reservation.   Long story short, our waiter told us he was the only one waiting on the patio patrons. The service was slow.  The food was amazing and when the manager asked how our experience had been, I was honest about our disappointment on the slow service.  He was world class and apologized immensely. He then offered us a complimentary dessert and comped our appetizers.  A world class experience was recovered because of his acute awareness of customer expectations.  Hats off and we will be back

yZA6-ldw0FeOa1KZJVM86w.text: This was an awesome meal for me. I ordered the main filet and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly to order and tasted amazing. The lack of the fifth star was for price and one minor shortcoming in service.   Price: dinner for two with gratuity came out to $200! That is pretty high even considering the quality.   Service: between our order and the arrival of our dinner there was some down time. This would have been a great opportunity to offer us a second round of bread. I watched other tables have the same experience. I think this must be a policy. Might be a policy to review.

Yq4Gc_xMlX4XXoner2GBaQ.text: Tried this place on business trip. Ordered salad and ribeye steak. The steak was good but not great same for the salad. Ruth's Chris is way better than this place. They have the best steak and I will recommend it instead of this place.

vT0_xR0xxAXcstxi61bg1g.text: My husband and I like to wine and dine at the fancy places for special occasions. I decided to take him to Flemmings in Chandler for his birthday because I didn't want to drive to Scottsdale, and I remember the Scottsdale one being really good with excellent service. This place, not so much. Half the restaurant was filled and there were like 3 servers walking around. We waited a good 10 minutes before anyone came to get our drink orders. The house bread is pretty good but the two cheese spreads it comes with are not very good. We asked for regular butter and that never came out. We got the calamari with sweet chili and that was pretty good. The presentation was really sloppy though, sauce all over the side of the plate and just played really sloppy. I got the Alaskan king crab legs and the husband got the bone in 20oz ribeye. The crab legs were smaller and the meat was dry in some parts, soggy in other parts, and just wasn't the quality we were expecting. The prime rib was cooked perfect medium rare but the flavor was just lacking. The spicy Thai green beans were pretty good and the flemmings potatoes were ok but really heavy. No complimentary dessert for husband's birthday but we got a box of truffles and a $25 gift card. Overall ok but will probably go to Steak 44 or Capital Grille before coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

9RiGc7vPjYYJXyJnxUa6kQ.text: Went here for New Year's eve, Gary was our fabulous server -very attentive and shared lots of great information about the food. Our main course of fillet mignon and truffle mash potatoes were on point, perfect! Also had their signature chocolate lava cake, a little fancy for my blood but my husband ate every last bite. they also have a great happy hour, worth the money to splurge on a great meal. Also, their bread and multiple butters to dip in were delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Choc lava cake

ZS3KFSVcPsQAdf8aidMMuQ.text: Flemings Flemings Flemings ...   Well, upon arrival, I was shocked at how loud it was on the dining room floor. There are other seating areas, but the main dining is in one particular area. I will say apart from the noise, I enjoyed the lighting and the atmosphere in general; lots of people smiling and enjoying food.   I ordered the Chilean sea bass & ended up sending it back. Here's why: the 'broth' that it comes in is a bit much for me. My fish was swimming in a broth that made the crunchy bits of potato soggy & took away from the overall enjoyment of the fish. The fish itself was cooked perfectly, but it lacked flavor. The chile pesto that was used to dress the plate was FABULOUS ! I'm wondering why they don't ditch the broth and focus on how the fish and the sauce pair together effortlessly..   The second meal I ordered was the filet mignon & lobster tail. The steal was OK. It was dry and over cooked but instead of ordering AGAIN I decided to give it a try... Eh. I should've sent it back! The lobster was the highlight def. it was tender and cooked perfectly.   Suffice it to say, I'd give them another chance and try some other options on their menu. Although, for a steak house to send out a dry over cooked steak requested medium, that's a pretty tough blow.! I think there's a fine line between being a restaurant that can handle volume & being one that produces decadence with every plate served.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chilean sea bass. Where&#39;s the fish? You gotta go huntin for it!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Filet &amp; lobster

JqEmW7UivDw7kXudXNekIw.text: Fun and elegant happy hour! Lite bites and also a glorious wine list! Service was quick and assistive. Patio was lit with heaters for warmth on a chilly night. I had the carpaccio and baked brie which were fab! Both were tasty and would definitely order again. Wine was served in proper glasses and so many to choose from. It is a pricey place but a superb place for an elegant happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carpaccio
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States. Baked Brie, delish!

78zHVVQ3ERYIg8RATjeW6Q.text: My husband and I dined here about a month ago and we were disappointed with our meals.  I wanted to say something and my husband told me not to. But it has been bugging me ever since because we did spend a few hundred dollars here.  We definitely don't mind spending money on really good food, however, not for something that was sub par.  My rib eye steak was so fatty I was spitting out fat in every bite. I know rib eye steak is a fattier piece of steak, however, not in every bite! My husband's lobster was dry and tough. I have been telling all my friends and family about our experience letting them know that the food is not worth the price.  I keep wondering if people just go there because it's supposedly "upscale"-- I say not.

Geu6tfsXb2CaV_BR_FZ6cQ.text: Very comparable service to other locations I've been to. No complaints, great service, and delicious food. We went on Thanksgiving since it's just my husband and I, and it was packed!

7czRc8urmrolSk1iEHap7g.text: The food was amazing! Service was good but considering my fiance and I apparently don't look the part we felt constantly hounded, "checked up on" and rushed out from our dinner. It felt a little awkward and unfortunate. I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in the reaction of a young tattooed couple trying to enjoy a nice evening together and wished we were not to feel so judged as if we were going to "dine and ditch" little alone my wine ended up needing to get replaced from a fly getting into it.

u_UOLiq6BdvS2WBpOgGgew.text: We had the Steak and Crab special and it was delicious!  Best dinner ever!  Dessert was So good!  Everyone wished us a happy anniversary!  It was an amazing and Kerry our waiter was great!  Great great service!  We can't wait to go back!

9O3Fybrg2UgrEw2r0P4z5Q.text: Lots of money for not much quality. Yes, the ambiance was nice, but the focus of our trip, the food, was not worth it. I ordered the steak with the king crab. Kudos to the for actually making it lump crab versus shucking your own. However, it was so dry I had to ask for a replacement.  They were quick to get a new fresh order out to me. It was fine, but did have shell mixed in. :(  Another positive was that my steak was cooked to perfection.    We ordered the Chipotle mac n cheese and the peppercorn parm mashed potatoes.  Mac n cheese was flavorful and a great spin on a classic. The mashed potatoes were flavorless. Which made the dinner even worse... I was so excited to have them!   In the end we thought we'd redeem the night by getting dessert to go..  carrot cake and turtle pie. We've yet to eat them, but regretted the order as soon as we got the bill... they were 12 bucks each!!!  So in the end we spent $200+ tip on a meal that was worth maybe $100.   This place has some cool factors -ipads for wine and dessert options and great service, but I wouldn't pay that much more for those qualities.

Wt0XpnjLBvNT_5jjoaUHtA.text: We have eaten at some of the best steak places in both the US and Canada and were pleasantly surprised at Flemings. For starters the Seafood Tower is a meal and amazing, my wife had the Wedge Salad with a slab of bacon, which I had to tryI had the Clam Chowder, outstanding ! We split a 12 ounce filet with the coffee rub, perfectly cooked and delicious. The Fleming potatoes were good, expected more of a kick with jalapenos but still good. Finished the meal with coffee and a Sambuca on the rocks! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler, AZ, United States

YiWU4INCbua_5oVd0kDj6g.text: We brought our mothers to Fleming's for Mother's Day. We have been many times in the past and really enjoyed everything- food, wine, service. This time was different as it seems Fleming's has made some changes. I will start with a positive. Our waiter Nathan was fantastic! Very sweet and knowledgeable and took good care of us. All the staff was professional and provided good service.  To start with the rest, they have always had an amazing wine list but for some reason they cut WAY back on the number of choices for a glass of wine. There was not one thing on the glass of wine menu that I was interested in. Three of the salads were great, but one had less than acceptable lettuce on the plate. The onion soup was good.  The top it off lump crab was not good at all! It was very disappointing. The steaks were ok, but nothing like they used to be. I had never had a less than perfect steak there before. Overall, an awfully hefty bill for a meal that did not equal up to that:-(((((

83qOchOU9QfQaETCeirWeQ.text: The food here is great. If I was rating on the food alone it would be five stars.  The service, not so great. The hostess stand was really disorganized. We had reservations, but when we walked in there was one girl at the desk refusing to make eye contact with us or the other couple that was waiting. There were two other girls behind her but they were busy talking about whether or not to post something on facebook (really? we can hear you).  Finally the first girl looks up and says she'll be right with us. Back to staring at her computer screen. More waiting.  Once we were at the table, the server was nice, he just took a very long time to do everything. It was about 15 minutes before anyone came to our table to greet us (which at the price point of Fleming's is ridiculous) and even then it wasn't our server, it was someone else who just dropped off water glasses and said that our server would be there shortly. That was about the pace of everything else. My date and I can usually pass the time very easily but there were points where it was getting so awkward waiting for the server to show up when we could see him aimlessly wandering throughout the restaurant (yes, aimlessly, not actually doing something, I used to work in the industry, I can tell the difference between someone who is legitimately slammed and someone who is just dazed and confused).  Again, two stars because the food was SO good. Not only for dinner that night but there was so much that I had a fabulous lunch the next day as well. But really for the whole experience go to Maestros or Capital Grille.

IdMvGc3DCh9N4gLktM16kA.text: Ask for Jurgen (like the Jergen lotion)  Reservations were easy, got the time we wanted.  My husband and I went for my birthday, we were greeted and seated with a signed birthday card, nice touch.  We had a few minutes to look at the menu then we were greeted by our server Jurgen.  Asked us what to drink, we wanted a bottle of red wine and made a wonderful recommendation.  Brought water and delicious sourdough bread and a couple of different butters (very tasty and rich!)  My husband loves salads but Jurgen recommended the clam chowder.  We got both and split them!  The salad was pretty good but the clam chowder was to DIE FOR!!!  Perfectly seasoned.  We both ordered steaks, with rubs, their potatoes and the Brussel sprouts.  All fabulous!  My husband didn't realize that a sauce came ON his steak.  He's not a sauce guy so we mentioned it to Jurgen so the manager came over.  We weren't complaining but the manager asked if my husband wanted another steak, no questions, over sauce!  Amazing.  He said no, but we got dessert for free instead.  Really?  Yes!  What a way to stand behind your product.  The other manager stopped by as well, just to check on us and chat for a minute and to wish me a happy birthday.  The gal that was taking care of us as well was very attentive but not overbearing.  She impressed us also.  Though it was expensive it was so worth it.  Oh, did I mention Jurgen gave us truffles as well?  What a fabulous meal.  We will definitely go back for the next special occasion.

yVlja19wX5tUAHl-2OEATA.text: Overall visit was great with no real complaints. I ordered lobster tail which was served with warm butter in a dish above a candle to keep it warm. Which I loved because it made the lobster taste even more delicious. The lava cake is definitely worth it. The peach mule was not peachy at all in fact it was very limey and tasted more like a margarita. Perhaps it was made wrong but I didn't taste the peach whatsoever and for a 18 dollar cocktail I would hope for something that tastes like the description. Also, ambiance was fine but you are very close to everyone else as far as seating and it is VERY dark so seeing your food is actually really difficult. Other than that the food is great and I'll definitely come back. Good for date nights and celebratory dinners for sure but not the best place for young children. You will also spend a lot here so made sure you plan on it. For the 2 of us it was over 200 with 1 cocktail, 2 entrees, 1 side, and 2 desserts.

0oN9czYGAD8hYFZeOE9SmQ.text: We like to go there after work for Happy Hour on the patio.  They have 2 Happy Hour menus and until tonight, we have ALWAYS ordered off both, with no problems whatsoever.  Tonight, however was a different story.  We were charged regular prices for most of our bill and when we asked about why, the waiter was dismissive and rude about it, loud enough for neighboring tables to hear.  He did take the bill and come back very quickly, saying that the bill was correct and just dropped it on the table.  I would have expected a manager to stop by and say something, anything, but evidently the managers there do not care if their tables have issues, they just hide in the back.  At no time, did we ever see a manager that night, but for 5 minutes (before we ordered) while she lit some patio heaters, then she disappeared the rest of the night.  I would expect them to do at least one table touch during the meal.  I guess it's not a "Fleming's thing".  All in all very disappointed with the service, the confusion regarding the bill, the menu and the way it was handled and we won't be back.

XMscOqk9Bb-9yesH1bnlEA.text: Go to place for special occasion.  Just don't count calories.  Expect great    Steaks, extensive wine list, tasty apps and save some room for desert.  Bone in ribeye is one of the best.  Mash is always seasoned perfectly.   Very good service as well.  Only downside is the large bill at the end of the meal.

1PEMU9NSdG_LQvNNhsw7wQ.text: Consistently good Happy Hour. Good burgers and drinks. The downside is how crowded it gets and that the happy hour is only good in the bar. It should be entire restaurant.

sTF-McDPMF0sjotrivGIQA.text: Great happy hour.  We come here on our Tuesday veggies-and-booze night when we pick up our CSA.  I think their happy hour is five items for $6 each until 7:00.  There are also some cocktails and wine.  One of those five items is their burger which you can order rare plus, it comes out perfect this way.  Nice and creamy (instead of dry and chewy), full of flavor and juicy with nice thick pieces of bacon on it.  This might be our new favorite.

EX-GQpDwBsrrO2iHCIBn7Q.text: Spent our first wedding anniversary at Fleming's this evening.  This was an impromptu reservation made the same day and we were happy they could accommodate us at such a late notice.  For us, it came simply down to the ambiance.  Jordan, our server was wonderful despite her having to shout over the noise.  So if you are looking for an intimate dinner for two this isn't it.  However, our food was delicious...steak perfectly done, great halibut and Fleming's salad was quite nice.  A glass of an awesome Moscato left no room for dessert but received a token of congratulations for our special day which was beautifully presented and greatly appreciated.  Yep...the prices are high...figure on $45+ per person.  We thought it warranted the price but the ambiance could use a definite boost to cater to a more perhaps private dining experience rather than having to shout to speak to one another.

3BWJb1JTS2Bhq3haQ_C1PA.text: This is a happy hour review only. I have never been for dinner. I love this place. The bar is kind of small, so you have to get there early if you want a seat for happy hour...or go on an odd week night. Camille H. already described the happy hour menu very well. In addition to the burger, the crab cakes are amazing - 100% crab meat and no filler/breadcrumbs. The cocktails are yummy - I had the white cosmo last night - delish!   I would give the place 5 stars, but am always unhappy with the service. They are all very snooty and pretentious. If they were just nice and real, I would love this place even more.

JRecaG3qxrfFjbrPRUgHrw.text: I would have given it less but they did comp our bad meal. Ordered filet with crab stuffed prawns and the stuffing tasted like it had been left out. The manager (who never gave her name) tried to tell me that they where fine to eat. They really undercooked my husbands steak and desert was served in a very dirty bowl.  We went in because we had gift cards. I guess we will be giving it another try.

F8fMeDPERIixpnd_e-BQbg.text: When only a serious cut of beef will do, prepared and served by another (instead of your backyard grill)--go to Fleming's. Very nice restaurant with professional waiters, a great menu, and tasty wine list.  Although, I've eaten several fine meals at Fleming's, the reason for this recent review is a new discovery: the PINNACLE of hamburgers for $6 dollars at happy hour. A half pound Prime meat hamburger, with smoked bacon, and choice of cheddar, gruyere or blue cheese on a toasted challah bun. Damnation!! best hamburger I've ever eaten. Did I mention 6 bucks at happy hour? Phenomenal.

4kqFGuSt2LDtWshPDTPrPw.text: Great steaks. Great sides. Good wine. However, avoid the bar, oddly enough, especially during happy hour. The appetizers, while cheap, are not nearly as good as what I would have expected based on the steaks and other options I have really enjoyed in the dining room. The bar and the dining room just seem to operate on two different wave lengths. If that were not the case this place would be a solid four stars for me.

zvL2JSARFZXPF-m2cfW3LA.text: My mother and I love Fleming's happy hour menu, great food and drinks at a reasonable price.  We usually start our mother/daughter fun outing nights at Fleming's before going to the movies or to an event together.  I've equally enjoyed their dinner menu while celebrating birthdays or while on a date night. I highly recommend their filet Mignon and any of their side dishes. If you visit during their happy hour, get the burger and any one of their martini's.

PlDvQUrBBrJYCBAaQZjeUA.text: My family arrived to celebrate my moms birthday! The hosting staff did a great job of seating us in a minimal amount of time. We had an emergency change in plans and they accommodated us quickly. They also accommodated the temperature of the room for our easily cooled friends. Everyone enjoyed their food. And the server was great UNTIL......two spiders crawled up onto our table right between me and my son. When I complained, I got some half assed excuse that they had just sprayed the night before from the manager. My husband, not wanting to look douchey and not like we were just trying to get a free meal, told them not to worry about it. But personally, I think they still should have done something about it. When you pay for a $500 meal, you don't want to deal with bugs. I was in the service industry for nearly 10 years, I understand the prejudice that goes on behind closed doors. I understand that they probably thought I was lying, but frankly, I couldn't care less. That's gross. I don't want to pay for a meal with bugs.

GeBe5RCzadDFVw0YYoKkIQ.text: Love this place! Just went here and ordered the petite filet and lobster tail, everything is so good here. I also love the pork chop! My favorite dessert is the lava cake hot and yummy.

hMdUbVIz00B2omvj7Rd7Ew.text: I don't usually go for corporate food; however, Fleming's is an exception. On my last visit I had a New York Strip, rare and ordered a host of sides for the table including sauteed mushrooms, sauteed spinach and mash potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of coolness in the middle. The sides were delicious and the service superb. Never felt rushed the entire evening. By Phoenix standards, Fleming's is a little expensive, but well worth the money.

WfzPTID-Uyd7K1bF7kw7Mw.text: I've done every prime steakhouse in the Valley (Morton's, Donovan's, Mastro's, etc) ordering the same cut each time ... Boneless ribeye, medium rare. Flemings won hands down. Service is impeccable and when you are a regular, you are remembered and treated accordingly. My favorite restaurant.

3MZXMuNMVYfXX8ZB2vgEBg.text: The last few visits to Flemings have been a disappointment.  Not sure why so much has changed there - but it has. The steak was a bit overcooked, did not want to complain and put a damper on the celebration at hand - it was acceptable, it also had obvious fork holes poked into it.  The side salad is small, we used to be able to split it, not anymore. The appetizer they serve as a complimentary appetizer was dull - cracked bread with 3 dips that aren't very flavorful. It was noisy, hard to visit. We sat on the main floor at a 4 top table. The Service was confusing, had one person take our order & then it seemed another Server took over, we hardly saw the person who took our order at our table, but saw her at others surrounding ours  - food was delivered by someone else, which is typical in many restaurants - that was acceptable. There was a birthday celebration and the birthday person was handed a little box with candies, which is nice - but not special, in the past, they would serve the birthday person creme brulee -- When we want a special night out again, it won't be at Flemings. Prices do not justify the atmosphere, food or service.

VMaLclBL9YWdXPeXX4G8EA.text: Great steaks! We had the filet minion last night and it was cooked perfectly! The staff was very nice as well. This is a great place for a nice night out. We will be back for sure!

0Iw5_8Vbp8dhDxblvz0xQA.text: The food is definitely good, but I didn't think it was substantially better than other restaurants to justify the high price.  I had the filet with a side of the fleming's potatoes.  The steak was cooked how I like and was very good.  The potatoes were fine, although personal preference would be for a less creamy alternative.

U8NTz1rl5mQYglIpZJmzZw.text: This is just about as good as it gets!  When we went for dinner at about five o'clock, the place was nearly empty, so we did not incur the dreaded wait.  After being seated, our waiter politely introduced himself and asked for our beverage orders.  Our beverages were out in under two minutes and the waiter was more than willing to offer helpful recommendations about what was best on the menu.  I decided to go with the New York Strip cooked medium rare with garlic mashed potatoes and a Caesar salad.  The steak was impeccable, with every bite melting in my mouth.  The Caesar salad was about as good as a Caesar gets, and the garlic mashed potatoes were exploding with flavor.  For dessert, I decided upon the lava cake, which I did not share.  The lava cake was so amazing that I felt compelled to share information regarding its goodness with everyone at the table!    The atmosphere in this place is relaxing, the food is unbelievable, and the service is fantastic!

s8_MP7RjmDTAMxrHpjD7iQ.text: OMG OMG OMG, the happy hour hamburger is so delicious (I think it's the bacon that does it).   I've only been here twice, and both times for happy hour. They have an excellent happy hour for the quality of food they serve. I've tried, obviously the burger and also the crab cakes, both which were yummy. The drink specials are great too, they make a great margarita and have an ample wine list. I'll be back!

Kqwe11xg8lraHp07VdDgHA.text: Mostly good.  However, I went there one night and ordered the special which turned out to be a take on steak oscar.  Well the oscar part of the steak (i.e., the crab) was horrible.  Most other nights we've been there things have been good.
